loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es: Mary Luz tiene 28 años y vive en el barrio Las Lomas de la ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 2 a 7 años. Ella es una mujer que vino  desde el departamento de Antioquia con sus padres hace 20 años en condiciones de desplazamiento y en busca de nuevos horizontes. Habiendo organizado su hogar   emprendió su negocio  ofreciendo servicios de renta de lavadoras, maquinarias que trasladan a vivienda  para solucionar sus necesidades domésticas de lavado de ropa de cada miembro. Mary Luz apoyada por  su cónyuge que es taxista y con la filosofía de minimizar el trabajo doméstico,   genera con su negocio   ingresos  importantes para fortalecer el bienestar de su hogar. Su desafío más importante el poco capital de trabajo con el que cuenta para invertir en su negocio. Esta es la razón por la cual se acercó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para solicitar su primer credikiva con el cual comprará  2 nuevas máquinas  lavadoras,  pues diariamente el servicio se amplía hacia otros barrios y no alcanza a responderle a muchos de sus clientes a quien quiere captar para aumentar su mercado y lograr mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mary Luz, 28, lives in the Las Lomas neighborhood in the city of Cartagena with her spouse and three children who range in age from 2 to 7 years.  She is a woman who came from the department of Antioquia with her parents 20 years ago as displaced people in search of better horizons.

Having organized her household she started a business renting washing machines.  These are machines that they take to the customer’s home to meet their domestic laundry needs.  Mary Luz gets help from her spouse, who is a taxi driver, and in an effort to lessen domestic chores her business generates important income for her household’s wellbeing.  

The most important challenge she faces is the little working capital she has available to invest in the business.  This is the reason why she approached Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to request her first Kiva loan that she’ll use to buy two new washing machines because service requests increase daily toward other neighborhoods and she is unable to meet demand of many customers that she wants to secure to expand her market and earn higher income.

loans.use: to buy two new washing machines to lease out.

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en: Marceline is 25 years old. She has 2 children who are ages three and five years old. Marceline sells different kinds of clothes which include scuffs and children's clothes. She has been in this business for 3 years and this has enabled her build her own family house. Marceline is requesting a loan to buy more clothes and make more profits to expand her business. Marceline plans to buy a piece of land from the profits she hopes to make.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Kibanga Development Group

texts.en: 41 year old Fatia is a happily married mother of two. All her children are in school. Fatia has been in a restaurant business for close to four years now. Inspiration from her close friend is what made her start up this business. Before that, she was more inclined to fishing. Fatia believes her determination will see her make further progress in the near future. It has only been four years, but she feels like a past master already. This makes her upbeat. She feels she can shoulder most of her responsibilities with less disquiet using the business insight she has. Fatia still runs her fishing business though, but on a small scale now. Weekly, this business generates her profits summing up to shillings 65,000. She says she will use the proceeds from the kiva loan to purchase more food stuffs.

loans.use: to purchase more food stuffs.

loans.name: Milquicided Zenon

texts.es: El Señor Milquicided,es Padre de 2 hijos de 13 a 16 años, el cuenta que desde los 16 años estuvo trabajando con su padre en una carpintería pero decidió independizarse y empezó a trabajar en el campo de la cerrajería, un tío le enseñó esta actividad, en la ciudad de Lima y con los pocos ahorros,Milquicided se compró un carrito cerrajero para duplicado de llaves y así trabajar en Ica, cuenta que le fue bien y empezó a ganar dinero, después se compro otro carrito cerrajero y actualmente lo alquila a un primo, y así poco a poco empezó a crecer en el oficio de la cerrajería,el dinero que esta solicitando es para   modificar sus 2 carritos cerrajeros ampliando cajones de seguridad, mostradores y pintado de ambos carritos y con el dinero que le sobre desea comprarse 2 maquinas una eléctrica para soldadura y la otra es de Tornillo venero, Milquicided al igual que otros hombres emprendedores desea incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de trabajo, tiene una aspiración o sueño de ser el primer cerrajero de su distrito que hace trabajos de duplicado de todo tipos de llaves y chapas computarizado, miquicided esta muy agradecido con el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Milquicided is the father of two children aged 13 and 16.  He tells us that he worked with his father in a carpenter's workshop from the age of 16.  However, he decided to start working independently and so started working in the locksmith trade.  An uncle taught him this business, in the city of Lima, and with a small amount of savings he bought a small cart where he cuts keys.  He started working in Ica.  Milquicided tells us that things went well and he started earning money.  He then bought another cart and he currently rents out that cart to a cousin.  He gradually started growing in the locksmith trade.

Milquicided is requesting a loan to modify his two carts.  He will expand his safe draws and his counters, and paint both carts.  With the money he has left over, he would like to buy two pieces of equipment: an electric welding machine and a screw welder.  In common with other entrepreneurial men, Milquicided would like to increase his income and improve the quality of his work.  He dreams of becoming the first locksmith in his district to cut all types of keys and locks using a computerized cutting machine.

Milquicided is very grateful for the support he is being given.

loans.use: to paint his locksmith carts and to buy welding equipment

loans.name: Bagrat

texts.ru:
Баграту 53 года; он живет в селе Гегамаван Гегаркуникской области с женой и двумя сыновьями. Старший сын работает менеджером на пивоваренном заводе «Гюмри», а младший учиться в средней школе. Жена не работает, помогает Баграту в производстве и реализации сельскохозяйственной продукции. 
Сам Баграт после окончания техникума продолжил учебу в Ереванском институте народного хозяйства. Получив квалификацию экономиста, Баграт девять лет проработал на Гагаринской птицефабрике. С 1992 года занимался коммерческой деятельностью в разных городах России. 
Последние 10 лет, основным занятием Баграта является сельскохозяйственная деятельность. На своей ферме он разводит двух коров и двух телят, а также выращивает картофель и чеснок. Полученную молочную продукцию и овощи дважды в неделю отвозит на рынки Еревана. 
Баграт намерен приобрести еще одну корову и расширить производство чеснока, для чего ему необходим кредит в размере 1,000,000 драм.
texts.en: Bagrat is 53 years old and lives in the Geghamavan village in the Gegharkunik area together with his wife and two sons.  The oldest son works as a manager at the "Gyumri" brewery, and the youngest attends a secondary school.  His wife does not work and helps Bagrat with production and sales of agricultural products.  After finishing college, Bagrat continued his education at the Yerevan institute of national economy.  Once he achieved the qualification of an economist, Bagrat spent nine years working at the Gagarin bird factory.  He has been involved in commercial business in various Russian cities since 1992.  Bagrat has been primarily involved in agriculture for the past ten years.  He is raising two cows and two calves at his farm and also grows potatoes and garlic.  He takes obtained dairy products and vegetables to Yerevan markets twice per week.  Bagrat intends to purchase an additional cow and expand his garlic production, for which he needs to obtain a loan in the sum of 1,000,000 dram.

loans.use: To buy an additional cow and to increase garlic production

loans.name: Rahamatou

texts.fr:
Rahamatou est une femme âgé(e) de 29 ans. Elle est célibataire Rahamatou travaille comme revendeuse des produits d’alimentation générales depuis 2005. Elle vend à toutes personnes au marché de N’KAFU. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. 
Rahamatou a requis son second  cycle de crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation
texts.en:
Rahamatou is a young woman of 29. She is single and has been working as a grocery retailer since 2005.
She sells to everyone in the N'kafu market. She purchases her products in Lomé.
Rahamatou has requested a second loan cycle from WAGES to purchase grocery products.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products.

loans.name: Foad

texts.en: Foaad is 64 years old and lives in Al Hashmi, Amman with his wife and two children. He makes a living by running a grocery store, and is applying for a loan for 1,500 JD to buy more products to sell to his customers. His goal for the future is to improve his family's life by expanding his store.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is 42 years old and married to Naomi. He has been a farmer for a period of seven years. This is his third loan which he has invested in farming. Nicholas earns a monthly income of KES.78,000. He will use the loan to purchase herbicide and also to  employ labor to assist in weeding irish potatoes.

The anticipated profit will be used to purchase a tractor and a lorry for transportation. Nicholas hopes to educate his children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: to purchase herbicide and also to employ labor to assist in weeding irish potatoes.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
Zoraida nació en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 31 años de edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, ella vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla todo tipo de actividades económicas,  ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la venta de flores, ella vende sus productos en uno de los mercados más visitados por los pobladores de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien y gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

En esta oportunidad Zoraida requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo flores.  

El Banco Comunal “Comuzone I” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Zoraida was born in the city of Cusco.  She is 31 years old, lives with her common-law husband and has three children.  Zoraida lives in the city in which she was born and this is where she carries out her business.  She divides her time between her household chores and her business selling flowers.  Zoraida sells her products in one of the most popular markets in the city of Cusco.  She has been in this business for 15 years and it is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

On this occasion, Zoraida needs a loan to buy merchandise (flowers).

The 'Comuzone I' community bank meets every month in the city of Cusco (Peru).  Cusco is known as being a touristy and commercial area.  It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi fiesta and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world: Machupicchu.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (flowers)

loans.name: Fernando Group

texts.en:
Fernando is widowed with four children. He is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Fernando is a farmer and grows  corn to earn a living. He has been doing this for 26 years. He has requested a loan of 9000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for the corn plantation. 

Fernando has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Fernando hopes to send his children to school.

Fernando is the leader of a 3-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his corn.

loans.name: Lhamdegmed

texts.en:
Lhamdegmed is 51 years old and lives with her children and husband in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Umnugovi province of Mongolia. Her children are both high school students. Her husband is currently unemployed. 

Lhamdegmed has a business making traditional Mongolian clothes. She started her business two years ago. She is planning to expand her business and have more customers. She is a diligent and talkative woman who says "I like my business and want to expand it more. At the same time, it brings me a sufficient amount of income." She is requesting a 1,300,000 Tugrik (MNT) loan to buy materials and participate in a trade fair.

loans.use: To buy materials and participate in a trade fair

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en:
Jeanne was born in 1972. She is married with six children who are between five and seventeen years old and all attend school. Jeanne is married to a driver. 
Jeanne requested this loan to buy more fabrics which will enable her to expand the business.
Jeanne has had a sewing business for more than 20 years. She wants to save some of the profits she will make from the business. She would love to have a fabric store where she would make clothes for her customers.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics and make more clothes for her customers.

loans.name: Mebra

texts.en:
Mebra is 42 years old and lives in the town of Buwenge in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is married and has five children. For the past three years, Mebra has been working hard to manage her clothing and garment business, which sells women's suits and garments. 

To expand her business, Mebra has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more traditional Ugandan dresses called Gomeses and more party dresses for the Christmas season, and will help Mebra to generate greater profits and to improve her family's welfare. Mebra hopes that in the future she will be able to set up another clothing business at the market center. 

Mebra is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mebra who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase traditional and party dresses.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 

Merlyn has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and gasoline by the liter. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and gasoline to sell.

Merlyn is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Merlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and gasoline to sell

loans.name: Angela Concepcion

texts.es:
La señora es confeccionista, desde hace 5 años se lanzó como microempresaria, es propietaria de un taller de Costuras y tiene  44 años de edad. 
Tiene su taller en casa de sus padres, posee  máquinas industriales y un buen local con todas las comodidades necesarias para realizar su trabajo. Vive en la ciudad de Pilar,en el Barrio San Antonio, tiene casa propia,  y movilidad propia (vehículo).
Ella se dedica a la confección y ventas de prendas como: camisas, pantalon, remeras para damas. También fabrica uniformes para empresas por pedidos especiales. Tiene muy buena aceptación dentro del mercado, es conocida ya en la zona por su buena terminación en las prendas y precios acomodados. 
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad de pedir un préstamo, ya que sería invertido en compra de telas, que es la materia prima utilizada para la realización de su trabajo.
texts.en:
The member is a seamstress.  She started as a micro-entrepreneur five years ago.  She is the owner of a sewing shop and she is 44 years old.  Her shop is in her parents' house.  She has industrial machines and a good business with all the necessary conveniences to realize her work.  

She lives in the city of Pilar, in the San Antonio neighborhood, and has her own house and transportation (vehicle). She works making and selling articles of clothing such as shirts, pants, and t-shirts for women.  She also makes uniforms for businesses by special order.  She has very good success within the market; she is already known in the area for the good quality of her clothes and affordable prices.

She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity of requesting a loan.  She would invest it in buying fabric, the main material used to complete her work.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
San Miguel se formo gracias a la unión D. varias vecinas y amigas D. la ciudad D. Santaní, ellas son mujeres jefas D. familia que tienen como objetivo ayudar a sus familias por medio D. su trabajo y gracias al apoyo D. sus compañeras D. grupo. Ellas están trabajando muy a gusto dentro del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras D. la fundación y les gustaría poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
Una D. esas mujeres es la señora Lourdes, quien gracias a su sacrificio y trabajo ha podido ayudar a su familia y sacarlos adelante. Ella nos comenta que se dedica a la cría y venta D. cerdos y gallinas, lo cual la ha ayudado en los gastos diarios D. la casa. Dice que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, pero que le gustaría poder seguir.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. gallinas pequeñas para la cría y posterior venta, así también para la compra D. alimentos para cerdos.
texts.en:
The group,  San Miguel,  was formed thanks to various friends and neighbors in the city of Santani.  These women all take care of families, and shared the goal of generating income to help support their families.   They are all working enthusiastically within the program, "enterprising women" within the foundation and they want to reach the highest level they can.  

One of these women is Lourdes, who thanks to her hard work and sacrifice has been able to help improve the quality of life for her family.  Lourdes raises pigs and hens, which has helped generate income for the daily household expenses.    She says her work is very hard but she would like to continue growing her business.  Her portion of the loan will be used to buy small hens to raise and sell, and to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.use: to purchase more hens to raise and sell, as well as feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Uganda.  She is married and has four children, two of whom are in school. 

Mary has a business selling local medicines.  She has been in this business for four years, and she works seven days a week. Mary sells her products from home, directly to her customers. Mary has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bottles of syrup and powdered medicines.  

Mary's main business challenges include the rainy season and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own permanent premises for her business. Mary lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bottles of syrup and powdered medicines.

loans.name: Lorena Aracely

texts.es: Lorena Aracely de treinta y tres años de edad vive con sus tres hijos en casa propia. Ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad frijoles, arroz, leche, pan entre otros, se ha hecho de mucha clientela últimamente, pues posee la tienda mas surtida del lugar, donde vende los productos de mas bajo precio y de excelente calidad además el servicio es inigualable Lorena se caracteriza por su amabilidad; es una mujer muy activa, trabaja muy duro desde que sale el sol, le gusta estar siempre delante de su competencia y satisfacer todas las necesidades del cliente, su lema es, cuando el hombre espera mover montañas, empieza siempre por mover pequeñas piedrecillas y Lorena quiere empezar por lo más pequeño es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, pan, bebidas, aceites, productos de uso personal etc. Lorena Aracely tiene la esperanza que así lograra llevar a su hogar seguridad económica y una mejor calidad de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Lorena Aracely is 33 years old and lives with her three children in her own home. 

She has a store where she sells basic staples such as beans, rice, milk, and bread among other items. She has recently made lots of customers. She has a well supplied store, selling her stock at a good price and high quality and the service she offers is unmatched. Lorena is characterized by her friendliness.

She is a very active woman, working very hard, starting at dawn. She likes to stay ahead of the competition and satisfy the needs of her customers. Her motto is, when a man hopes to move mountains, he always begins by moving tiny stones, and Lorena wants to begin tiny, and this is why she is asking Integral for a loan in order to buy basic grains, sweets, bread, drinks, oils, personal use items, and other products. Lorena Aracely has the hope that in this way she could have financial security and a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sweets, bread, drinks, oils, and personal use items

loans.name: Claudette

texts.en: Claudette is 28 years old. She is married to a driver. They have two children aged 1 and 8. She has requested the loan to buy more foodstuffs to sell, such as bananas. With the profits, she will pay school fees for her children and renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs such as bananas to sell.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh, 45 years old, is a  housewife who is married to Bassam, a taxi driver.

Fatmeh used to make scarves and clothes for her children with knitting wool until almost five years ago, when her sons and daughters grew up and convinced her to continue making and selling, because the designs she makes are not much available in the market.

Knitting wool to make scarves, gloves, and tops using her creativity, and with the help of her family who brings her new customers every time, she was able to help improve their family income level.

Now, Fatmeh wants to open her own store with a small workshop and employ people who need help, but to achieve this goal she first wants to increase her profit by making and selling more goods. For that reason, she has applied for a loan to buy more material and simple accessories to be used on clothes.

loans.use: to buy more wool and simple accessories to be used on clothes

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 47-year-old woman. She is a responsible, happy, smiling, and very honest mum. Faith is not looking for a job now because she is contented being a farmer. She sells crops from her small farm and keeps dairy cows and poultry. 
Faith is seeking a loan worth 50,000 KES to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business. Juhudi has teamed with Kiva to give Faith access to a loan that will help her horticulture farm grow into a highly profitable business. Faith’s family will benefit from the growth of the business. This will not only increase their income, but also improve their living conditions.
During this end year season support her so that next year she can start a new year on a good footing!

loans.use: To grow her horticulture business

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the six members of the Yakaar association, represented by Ibrahima F.. The Yakaar group describes their business plan as follows:

“Context: In earlier times this peanut-growing valley flourished. Plenty of rain fell during the wet seasons and harvests were abundant. The livestock here never knew feeding problems and lived peacefully.

Then rainfall became scarce, the soils became poor, and the fields no longer provided nourishment for the families. Poverty established itself definitively.

Faced with this situation, the Yakaar group plans to start a sheep-raising business. In the season before the holiday of Tabaski [a Muslim holiday known outside West Africa as Eid al-Kabir or Eid al-Adha, in which each family slaughters a sheep to commemorate the story of Abraham’s sacrifice], our region of Diourbel offers excellent opportunities for fattening sheep because it is located in a grazing area and peanut-growing valley. It is a very favorable context for fattening and marketing rams. The requested loan will allow us to purchase a number of purebred rams in very good health.

Overall objective: To increase the income of the group members with the profit earned from sheep-raising, and to reactivate the production and sale in the local market of quality meat.

Activities: Sheep-raising workshop

Activity 1: this will consist of purchasing thirteen rams in Djolof, which offers good prices on the rams as well as assuring their good health.

Activity 2: Purchasing sheep feed for proper feeding and phytosanitary maintenance, for a duration of two months in order to fatten them

Activity 3: Phytosanitary treatment.

Activity 4: A herdsman will be hired to guard and care for the sheep during the entire two-month period.

Activity 5: Commercialization: After two months of fattening (with special feed) and caring for the rams, we will proceed to market them exactly on the day before Tabaski for our first cycle – just at a time when the demand is very strong and the supply of good-quality rams is often quite limited. A quality product must be competitive on the basis of both quality and price.

A total of four cycles are planned for the coming year. Each cycle will generate a profit of 180,000 francs [about $350], so by the end of the year profits will total 720,000 francs [about $1400].

Strategy: Our strategy begins with the purchase of purebred rams; with a good diversified feeding regimen, at the end of two months the rams will be quite sleek and will be successfully during the preparations leading up to the holiday. We will set up a methodical process for providing the market and grilled meat stands with quality meat on a quarterly basis (four cycles per year).”

Original French:

“Contexte du projet : Autrefois le bassin arachidier était florissant. Les hivernages y étaient pluvieux et les récoltes abondantes. Le bétail méconnaissait les problèmes alimentaires et y vivait paisiblement

Les pluies sont devenues rares, les sols pauvres, les champs ne nourrissent plus les familles

La pauvreté s’est installée définitive. Face à ce contexte le groupe YAAKAAR propose de faire de l’embouche. A la veille de la célébration de la fête de tabasky, la région de DIOURBEL offre des opportunités d’embouche car située entre la zone sylvopastorale et le centre du bassin arachidier. C ‘ un contexte très favorable à l’activité de commercialisation de béliers. Le prêt sollicité servira à acheter un nombre de brebis de race et en très bonne santé

Objectif général : Augmenter les revenus des membres par le profit tiré de l’embouche et re dynamiser les activités de production et de ravitaillement du marché local en viande de qualité.

ACTIVITES : atelier d’embouche

Activité N° 01

Il s’agira d’acheté des béliers ( 13 ) dans le DJOLOF qui offre de bonnes dispositions autant sur le plan du prix des sujets que sur le plan de leur état de santé.

DESIGNATIONS NOMBRE PRIX UNIT MONTANT Achat des sujets 13 30.000 390.000 Transport Sous total……………………………………… ……………. Ff ……………. 65.000 455.000

Activité N° 02 : achat aliment de bétail ;

Par une bonne alimentation et un suivi phytosanitaire pour une durée de deux (02) mois pour parvenir à les engraisser ;

ELEMENTS CALCUL (coût-tête- opération) PRIX Paille d’arachide/ niébé 10.000 Son de mil/ 2500 Tourteaux d’arachide 5000 Eau 2500 Divers 2500 Total 25.500

Activité n° 03 : traitement phytosanitaire ;

ELEMENTS NOMBRE PRIX UNIT MONTANT Ivomec 15.000 Autres produits phytosanitaires 10.000 Prise en charge du vétérinaire 02 mois 40.000 Sous total 65.000

Activité n° 04 : sécurisation et entretien :

Un berger sera utilisé pour la sécurité (gardiennage) et l’entretien des animaux pendant toute la durée de la première opération deux (02) mois et sera reconduit pour chaque opération.

ELEMENTS PRIX UNIT MONTANT Motivations au berger ( deux 02 mois) 25.000 50.000 Sous total 50.000

Activité n° 05 : commercialisation.

Après deux (02) mois d’engraissement ( alimentation spéciale) et de traitements des béliers ; il sera procédé à la commercialisation sur pied juste à la veille de la célébration de la TABASKY pour la première opération. Au moment ou la demande est très forte alors que l’offre de qualité est souvent assez limiter. Un produit de qualité doit soutenir la concurrence avec des arguments ( qualité prix) à l’appui. Quatre opérations sont planifiées dans l’année.

Chaque opération générera un bénéfice de cent quatre vingt mille francs…..( 180.000 )

Soit au bout d’un an un bénéfice global de sept cent vingt mille francs (720.000 )

DESIGNATIONS NOMBRE PRIX UNIT MONTANT Vente des béliers 13 60.000 780.000 Total vente ………………………………………………………………………………… quatre opérations ………………………………………………… 780.000 ……………… 3.120.000

La stratégie :

La stratégie de mise en œuvre passera par l’achat de béliers saints et de race ; avec une bonne alimentation diversifiée au bout de deux (02) mois pour que les sujets présentent des images assez reluisantes afin d’être revendus avec succès durant les préparatifs de la fête. Avec méthode un plan de renouvellement des béliers ; avec les mêmes dispositifs sera reconduit pour un ravitaillement du marché et des dibiteries en viande de qualité pour une périodicité de trimestrielle. ( quatre 04 opérations l’an) »

Background :

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, which provide the rural poor throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these groups are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional associations from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. Senegal Ecovillage Microfinance (SEM) works with our partner organization CRESP to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

loans.use: Purchase of purebred rams; feed and veterinary care; hiring of herdsman; transportation to market

loans.name: Kwesi

texts.en: Kwesi is 42 and father of 5 children, 4 of whom are in school at various levels. He retails household items in a rented shop in his community. With only a basic level in education, he has managed to run this business over the last 6 years. He took part in the TEACH learning sessions facilitated by KRABAN SUPPORT FOUNDATION in late 2006. He expects the KIVA loan to give a major push to his business.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is 46, has two children and even though they no longer depend on her, they still profit from her economica aide. She makes woolen knitted items and she also prepares tamales (a typical food made in this area that is made of corn, meat and are wrapped in the corn leaf), as well as chicharrines (fried bits of flour). She sells these items within her community. She also works on domestic tasks in private homes in order to increase her earnings. She wishes to use the loan to perfect and to expand her current business. She belongs to the group Laguna Azul (Blue Lake) 1.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

EPIFANIA TIENE 46 AÑOS, DOS HIJOS, AUNQUE YA NO DEPENDAN DE ELLA AUN LES SIGUE BRINDANDO AYUDA ECONOMICA. SE DEDICA HACER TEJIDOS DE LANA Y TAMBIEN PREPARA TAMALES (ALIMENTO TIPICO DE LA ZONA QUE CONTIENE MAIZ, CARNE Y ESTAN ENVUELTOS EN HOJA DE MAIZ) Y CHICHARRINES (FRITURAS DE HARINA) TODO ESTO LO VENDE ENTRE LA GENTE DE SU COMUNIDAD. TAMBIEN TRABAJA PRESTANDO SUS SERVICIOS EN CASAS PARTICULARES HACIENDO ASEO PARA INCREMENTAR SUS INGRESOS. QUIERE PERFECCIONAR Y AGRANDAR SU NEGOCIO CON EL CREDITO. PERTENECE AL GRUPO LAGUNA AZUL 1.

loans.use:
"Vender"

COMERCIANTE

loans.name: Inés

texts.es:
Mrs. P. started her business a year ago thanks to the credit of a local financier. She sells perfumes of various brands and quality and already she has clients that buy merchandise weekly. The number of sales is growing thanks to the personalized attention she gives to her customers.

With the money loaned she can buy more merchandise and products that are in style, which customers have already been asking for. Her goal is to make the clients always feels very well attended to.

Mrs. P. is 29 years old and lives with her two children in their bamboo house. She would like to expand her business in order to sell her products through other businesses in the area.

Translated fom Spanish by Isabel Rutherfurd, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

La Señora Inés comenzó su negocio hace un año gracias a un crédito otorgado por una financiera local, ella vende perfumes de varias marcas y calidades, ella tiene clientes que le hacen pedidos semanalmente y sus ventas han crecido últimamente agracias a su atención personalizada que brinda a cada cliente.

Uso del Préstamo

Ella confía que con el crédito que reciba pueda comprar mas mercadería y productos de la temporada ya que existen clientes que le han hecho varios pedidos y su meta es que el cliente siempre se sienta muy bien atendido.

Información Personal

Tiene 29 años y tiene dos hijos su vivienda es de caña y su meta es extender su negocio hacia varias instituciones del sector.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia M. is a woman who works hard to help her family to fulfill what they need. Her business is a taxi service. Her husband works daytime and nighttime to earn money for their family, driving the taxi. She’s very happy about their business. She’s improving her business and she’s thinking of some day having two taxis to expand her business.

Olivia's business earns about three hundred tala per day (around US$ 120). She plans to use her loan from the S.P.B.D to buy tires, petrol, brake fluid and other sorts of things for the car in order to keep it in good condition. She’s thankful to the S.P.B.D for the programme that makes things easier for her and her family.

loans.use: To purchase tires, petrol, and brake fluid

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.pt:
Gabriel is single and lives with a woman. He works for a private company. Gabriel’s girlfriend does not work outside the home. She takes care of the housework. Gabriel was born in a northern province of Mozambique. The only family he has in Xai-Xai is the woman he lives with. In the future, he plans to legalize his marital status.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Gabriel e solteiro mas vive com uma mulher. Ele e trabalhador de uma Empresa Privada. A mulher de Gabriel nao trabalha fora de casa. Ela cuida dos afazeres domesticos. Gabriel nasceu numa Provincia ao Norte de Mocambique. Em Xai-Xai a unica familia que ele tem e a mulher com quem vive. No futuro ele pensa legalizar a sua situacao matrimonial.

loans.use: Gabriel would like to use the loan money to buy construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE MERCHANDISE TO OFFER HER CUSTOMERS, ESPECIALLY DURING THE HOLIDAY SEASON.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Lê Thị Thắng, 48, is petite but always has a big smile on her face. She operates a restaurant serving breakfast only. She is a member of TYM fund in the village of Phú Minh since 1994. Her initial loan was 20 USD which was used to raise pigs. In later rounds, she always qualified for maximum loans. In 2001, feeling that she has good cooking skills, she decided to take out a loan to open a restaurant right in her house. Her house location is easily accessible, right on route #2 at the intersection with the entrance to the airport. Her husband is a bus driver so he has a lot of contacts who would become her customers. The food served at the restaurant is delicious so it's no coincidence that her restaurant is busy. Her revenue is around 200 USD a month. This time she's requesting a loan of 1200 USD to buy food & drinks, to expand her restaurant to better serve her customers.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Dáng người nhỏ nhắn, nụ cười thân thiện đó chính là ấn tượng đầu tiên khi gặp chị Lê Thị Thắng, 48 tuổi, bà chủ quán bán hàng ăn sáng, thành viên cụm 39 Quỹ Tình thương xã Phú Minh. Chị Thắng tham gia Quỹ năm 1994, ban đầu chị vay mức 20USD để chăn nuôi lợn. Các vòng vốn sau, chị vay vốn rất tích cực, đều vay các mức tối đa. Năm 2001, với chút tay nghề, chị quyết định vay vốn mở cửa hàng ăn sáng tại nhà. Vị trí quán khá thuận lợi, ngay trên đường quốc lộ 2, ngã ba sân bay Nội Bài, cộng với sự quen biết rộng rãi của chồng, một lái xe, và sự hấp dẫn trong món ăn, quán ăn của chị ngày càng đông khách. Thu nhập bình quân của cửa hàng là 200USD/tháng. Chị dự định vay 1200 USD để mua thực phẩm và đồ uống để quán ăn ngày càng phong phú và có chất lượng phục vụ tốt hơn.

loans.use: Buy food and drink

loans.name: Eutropia Teodosia

texts.en:
Teodosia has been a member of the community bank “Orquideas” for six years. In that time she has learned the importance of saving and is especially appreciative of the interest earning savings account each associate has. Teodosia plans to use her savings to pay her children’s school fees, buy their uniforms, and pay for their supplies.

Teodosia is 36 years old. She is married and has three children who are 16, 12, and 8. Teodosia sells clothing in a small town four hours away from Ayacucho. She buys the clothing in the city of Ayacucho and then sells it at the local market. Teodosia has been doing this for eight years.

Teodosia needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy clothing to sell and make some improvements to her house. Teodosia dreams of owning a car and finishing her home.

loans.use: Teodosia needs a loan of 2000 soles (3 soles = $1), which she will use to buy clothing to sell and make some improvements to her house.

loans.name: Aparicio

texts.en:
Aparicio ever since he was very young has been dedicated to agricultural work. His performance has contributed to the development in the means of her family. Thanks to his efforts his children have been able to move themselves to the capital city of their country in order to fulfill their goals. The effort of this working father has allowed required him to recreate himself so that he can provide for his family in distinct places and in diverse situations. Your help will contribute to the improvement of the quality of variation, and quantity of his products now that the money that he is soliciting will be invested into the purchase of fertilizers and other things he needs

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Aparicio, desde muy joven se dedica a la labor agrícola, su desempeño ha contribuido con el desarrollo de las capacidades de su familia y gracias a su esfuerzo sus hijos han podido desplazarse a la ciudad capital de su país para cumplir las metas que se han trazado.El esfuerzo de este trabajador padre ha tenido que multiplicarse ya que ahora tiene que velar por su familia; pero en distintos lugares y en diversas situaciones.Tu apoyo contribuirá con el mejoramiento de la calidad, variedad y cantidad de sus productos ya que el dinero que solicita será invertido en la compra de abonos, fertilizantes y demás cosas que le hacen falta.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and tools

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Mrs. Yon L., age 31, is a garment worker who has lived in Siem Reap province since 2005. She earns $2.50 a day.
Her husband is a construction worker who builds houses and makes $6 a day. They have three children, all of whom are in school. This couple has applied for a loan from Kiva to buy a motorbike that they will use to commute to work and to buy some land. They will hold on to the land until the price goes up, and then sell it for a profit.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike and a piece of land.

loans.name: Sintia

texts.es:
Sintia is a pregnant young mother due to give birth and this little baby is inspiring her to work even more. She earns an income by raising chickens and guinea pigs, and she has noticed that selling chickens is very profitable and enable her to quickly earn income. Therefore she has decided to install a bigger coop with improved quality so she needs a loan that will enable her to complete this business proposition.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Sintia, es una joven madre en espera de su pequeño que ha de nacer y esa dulce espera le motiva a trabajar aún más. Se dedica al cuidado de pollos y cuyes que le sirven de sustento, tras observar que la venta de pollos es un negocio rentable que le permite obtener las ganancias de manera rápida ha decidido instalar una granja más grande y mejorada con los estándares de calidad que se exige, por esa razón solicita un préstamo que le permita llevar a cabo este propósito.

loans.use: Purchase a large quantity of chickens

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah S. sells soap as well as running a restaurant. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Hannah and her five children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.
She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Bui Thi S., 46, joined Tinh Thuong Fund in 2002. Since then, Mrs. Bui has used the Fund’s loan to invest into making noodles for restaurants in her neighborhood and breeding chickens and pigs, which have helped her family earn a stable income. Her husband is very hard-working and supportive of what she does. She has three children, one of whom has already grown up and moved out. The other two are still in school. Her family income is about 4 millions VND per month. In the next loan period, she would like to borrow 10 millions VND to keep making noodles and breeding animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Bùi Thị Sến 46 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2002 vay vốn của Quỹ gia đình chị đều đầu tư vào làm bún kết hợp cùng với việc chăn nuôi lợn nên gia đình chị luôn có nguồn thu nhập ổn định, chị chuyên làm bún bán cho các cửa hàng bán ăn sáng quanh khu vực nên việc làm bún của gia đình chị luôn diễn ra đều đặn, chồng chị là người chịu khó luôn hỗ trợ chị trong công việc, ngoài viêc làm bún gia đình chị còn đầu tư nhiều vào chăn nuôi lợn và gà, bình quân hàng năm xuất chuồng 4 tạ lợn, chi có 3 con, 1 con đã trưởng thành và ra ở riêng, 2 con hiện đang đi học và sống cùng vợ chồng chị. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào làm bún và chăn nuôi.

Thu nhập bình quân 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Pigs

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 50 years old. She is married with five children between the ages of four and twenty-four. She sells milk and bananas. Every day she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Victoria now hopes for a loan to buy more milk and bananas to increase her inventory and profits.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of milk and bananas to sell

texts.es: Camila habita en el barrio Villa Venezuela, ha sido una mujer luchadora y ha logrado salir a delante con sus hijos ya que es madre soltera, a sus 56 años de edad, sigue con su negocio que son ventas de electrodoméstico, ropa y cosméticos. Tiene tres hijos que ya son independiente los cuales siempre la han apoyado en las ventas, ya son quince años de experiencia. Comenzó con dinero propio, salía a vender ropa  a los departamentos lo cual le generaba alguna ganancia y eso le permitió poner el negocio en su vivienda, aunque las ventas algunas veces las realiza de forma ambulante. La solicitud de préstamo es para invertirla en capital en la compra de electrodomésticos, ropa variada y cosméticos para ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de productos. Su sueño siempre fue luchar por su familia y ahora que sus hijos ya son independientes espera que la familia se mantenga siempre unida porque para ella sus hijos son todo en esta vida
texts.en:
Camila lives in the neighborhood of Villa Venezuela. She has been a fighter, getting through life with her sons while being a single mother. She is 56 years old and continues with her business of selling electric appliances, clothing and cosmetics. She has three children who are now independent. They have always helped with her sales, with which she now has 15 years of experience. She started with her own money, to sell clothes door to door. That generated the profits which allowed her to set up the business from her house, although she still occasionally sells in the streets. Camila's loan will be used as capital to buy electric appliances, clothing and cosmetics, in order to offer her clients a wide variety of products. Her dream has always been to take care of and defend her family, and now that her children are now independent she hopes her family stays united because for Camila, her children are everything.

Translated from Spanish by Nathan Paluck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of clothes, cosmetics and electric appliances.

loans.name: Tautuu

texts.en: Tautuu L., 68, is married with 9 children. She has 3 years of experience in the plantation business farming  taro, yams, and bananas. She sells to the village and general public 3 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD). SPBD loans are Tautuu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her earnings will be use to improve business and help out with the family. Her husband and children also do the plantation.

loans.use: To further improve business status and also help to improve her home and help out with her childrens' educations

loans.name: Mrs. Mue Kim Sour Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mue K. S. is a group leader of four people requesting a loan who all live in Tumnob Leu Village in Kampong Cham Province. Mrs. Mue K. S. is a 39-year-old widow with three children: one is a construction worker, a second works as a recycling collector, and her youngest child attends the local school. Mrs. Mue K. S. owns a piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Her second child’s recycling business is going well, and she would like to help expand it. She will use her loan to buy empty bottles, cans, and plastics to resell to the recycling factory. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan.

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy empty bottles, cans, and plastics to resell to a recycling factory.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en: Mrs Pham Thi Y. is 50 years old. She joined TYM  in 2007. She has two grown children who work. Her husband is a construction worker. Now she and her husband's primary income is raising and growing. With an income of about 4 millionVND/month, her family’s economy is still developing. Pham Thi would like a loan of 9 millionVND ($550USD)  to invest in raising.

loans.use: To invest in raising

loans.name: Namasuba A –Yudaya Group

texts.en:
A. S. Yudaya is a 27-year-old business lady. She sells tomatoes, onions, green pepper, garlic, and eggplants, among other agricultural produce used in spicing both local and continental dishes. Her business is now 3 years old and she rents a stand in Namasuba-Mpida market at a fee of Ush 6,000 per month. Hardworking Yudaya wakes up at 5.00 AM every alternate day and heads to the popular Owino market to purchase her supplies. On good days, she sells an average of Ush 20,000. Her weekly profit margin lies at approximately Ush 30,000.

To boost her business, Yudaya is using the loan proceeds for purchasing more supplies like tomatoes, among other things. This reserved lady is a single mother of two children, aged 9 & 6 years. She keeps her business running amidst stiff competition by relating well with her customers and according them the courtesy they deserve. Her major challenge in business is keeping perishable supplies fresh, considering the fact that she does not have a refrigerator. She therefore dreams of running a retail/ wholesale shop for fast-moving consumer goods which have a long shelf life, and also educating her children to university levels.

loans.use: Purchasing more supplies like tomatoes among others.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: EDITH ES SOLTERA, TIENE UN HIJO DE 8 AÑOS ACTUALMENTE VIVEN EN ANTICRETICO EN LA CIUDAD, EL NEGOCIO ESTA UBICADO SOBRE LA AV. PRINCIPAL DESDE HACE MUCHOS AÑOS ATRÁS, TIENE COMPETENCIA EN EL RUBRO PERO POR SER POPULAR EL NEGOCIO EN LA ZONA TIENE BASTANTE DEMANDA. EL CREDITO FUE FINANCIADO PARA AMPLIACION DE NEGOCIO DE LICORES EN GRAL. NO TIENE DEUDAS CON OTRAS ENTIDADES FINANCIERAS, SOLO CON AGROCAPITAL DEMUESTRA UN EXCELENTE COMPORTAMIENTO CREDITICIO.
texts.en:
Edith is single. She has one 8 year old son. Currently, they live in Anticretico, in the city. The business has been located above the Principal Avenue for many years. She is competent in this area, but to be popular the business is in a area with much demand. The loan was financed by increasing the business in liquor. She has no debts with other financial entities, only with AGROCAPITAL. She exhibits excellent credit behaviour.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow the business

loans.name: Bakhtiyar

texts.en: Bakhtiyar I. is 53 years old. He is married and has three sons. At a young age Bakhtiyar learned to operate a small business from his parents. Through a lot of sacrifice, he became a main producer of agriculture for the area in which he lives. He continued working in the same business after he was married. With the income from the business, he was able to open a dispensary in his house and also raise cattle successfully. He hopes to continue growing and improving his business and offer a better future for his children. Bakhtiyar would like to see them develop into professional, ethical, and hardworking adults. He is requesting a loan of $1200. He will use the loan to buy livestock, as raising and selling animals generates an excellent profit.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Begmahmad

texts.en:
R. Begmahmad is 37 years old. He is married with four children. Begmahmad has been selling men’s shoes for 2 years. He began selling to acquaintances and friends, and after a while he realized that he had a lot of clients. So, he decided to rent a shop and establish himself in “Vahdat” market. He is a very enterprising man with a great desire to get ahead. His business has profited from his labor and he hopes to grow as a businessman. Begmahmad needs a loan of $900 USD, which he plans to invest in inventory in order to offer better service and variety to his clients. You can be an important part of the growth of this business. Today is your opportunity to help, have no doubt. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To increase inventory and working capital

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa M. sells groceries like milk, Milo, canned products and others at Pedu near Cape Coast. Theresa has received senior high education, is married and has 4 dependents. Her husband is an auto mechanic. Theresa has been selling groceries since 1994. She is responsible for paying housekeeping expenses since her husband takes care of the family’s financial needs. Her loan will be used as additional capital and will enable her to increase the sale of groceries in order to meet an increase in demand from her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business in order to reinvest back, ensuring the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: As additional capital in order to increase the sale of groceries.

loans.name: Afde N°7 Group

texts.fr: Les cinq femmes du groupe Association Femme Développement Entreprise AFDE N°7  ont une moyenne d’âge de35 ans vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Som (région de Thiès). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles exercent presque la même activité de vente de poissons secs et fumés, d’huile de palme et des tissus. Elles sont très sollicitées dans ces activités. Dans le cadre de l’amélioration de la qualité de leurs services et l’agrandissement de la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe confiance ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de micro finance IMCEC avec laquelle il est à son deuxième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).  Leur premier prêt était  correctement remboursé. Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour constituer un stock important. Les produits sont vendus au comptant au marché grand Thiès.  Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 25 000FCFA au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The 5 women of the "Association Femme Développement Entreprise AFDE N° 7" group have an average age of 35 and live in big extended traditional families in the Som district (Thies region). They met because of living in the same neighborhood or being related to each other. They have almost the same businesses selling smoked and dried fish, palm oil, and cloth. They are much sought after in these activities.

In the desire to improve the quality of their services and expand the size of their businesses, the members of the trust group decided to join the micro-finance institution IMCEC, with whom they are on their second solidarity loan (group loan). The preceding loan was correctly reimbursed.

They intend to use this loan to stock up. Their products are sold for cash, in the market of Grand Thiès. They each hope to make an average profit of 25,000 F CFA during this loan cycle, which will be used to reimburse the interest on the loan and cover the needs of their extended families, investing any remainder back into their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expanding their business inventory

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is a fish and meat vendor in her village. Aside from that, she is also a dealer of beauty products for men, women and kids. For the continuous productivity of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000. She will use the loan to purchase more fish and meat and also additional items for her direct-selling business. She would be very glad if her requested loan is granted towards the development of her business.

Corazon and her family are living in Silauan Norte Echague, Isabela. Her four children are: Almer - 31 years old; Donato - 24 years old and Artem - 20 years old, they were all high school graduates and the youngest is Jaya Marie - 12 years old, an elementary student.

loans.use: To purchase meat, fish and items for her direct-selling business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
M. Nguyễn Thị (1203020308) is a 26-year-old female living in the town of Ninh Giang. She is married and has two infant children.

M. works in a family member's business primarily selling poultry products in the local community. She has just started operating this business and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2002, M. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to expand her business.

M. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 6th loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Emilene

texts.en:
In 1986, Emilene N. started to plant "Calamansi" or citrus. She is 43 years old now and has four children. Her income from her farm helps her to renovate their house, pay the tuition of her children and buy the things they need.

Emilene would like to ask a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan buy fertilizers and pesticides. By doing so, she believes that she will be able to grow her farming business.

Through CEVI, she learned to manage a business. CEVI provides not only loans to their clients but training and insurance as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị is a 54-year-old woman living in the town of Ninh Giang, Vietnam. She is married and has 3 adult children. To earn a living, L. owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. The primary, though not exclusive, source of income for the business comes from from selling rice products to the local community. L. has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2004, L. joined the TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous loan from the TYM Fund. She used this previous loan to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. L. is now requesting a new loan of 10,000,000 VND, which she will invest in expanding her business. This will be her 6th loan taken out from the TYM Fund. L. plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand the borrower's business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business.

loans.name: Adedeji

texts.en: V. sells kerosene. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. As a widow with 3 children, life is not easy for her, she pays their school fees, feeds and clothes them. V. is 61 years old and she lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. V. is requesting for the loan amount of $950 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma P. is from the village of Dabong-dabong, Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 40 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Norma owns and operates a specialized retail business, primarily selling snacks like banana cue (plantain, fried in boiling oil and held on a skewer), camote cue (variations of cooked plantain rolled in sugar) and pancakes in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month. In July 2009, Norma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a member of the Semkini borrower group in Kihesa,Morogoro,she is 36 years old woman,she is single and a mother of 1 child,Her child is 17 years.

Rose started her own grocery business selling drinks like beer,soda,etc 2 years ago,she works 6 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Rose`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more beer,Soda.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Rose hopes to save money and expand her business

loans.use: To buy more drinks

loans.name: Victorino Ernesto

texts.pt:
Victorino nasceu em Inhambane tem 37 anos de idade vive maritalmente é pai de quatro filhos com compreendidas entre os 5 aos 12 anos, todos eles vão a escola. Não responsabiliza se por ninguém e consegue poupar por mês 1.000.00MT. 

Sai de Inhambane para cumprir o serviço militar obrigatório durante 2 anos é afecto em Matutuine concretamente Catuane como guarda prisional, mas devido à guerra ele abandona o emprego e passa a viver na Capital Maputo onde faz um curso de acção ambiental  e é afecto na Direccao da Agricultura no Município da Vila de Namaacha na Fronteira da Suazilândia, como agente de serviço na irrigação das plantas auferindo mensalmete 1.900.00MT.

Para alem de trabalhar na Agricultura, tem prestado serviços de jardineiro na Paróquia da Nossa Senhora de Fátima nas 2ª, 3ª e 5ª feira no período da manha auferindo 1.000.00MT e nas 4ª e sábados no mercado informal shoprite onde faz seus negócios de venda de material de construção de pequena escala tais como (prego, estribos, fios de energia, quadros e outros). Para aumentar o volume do seu negocio, aproxima se a hluvuku solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00MT.

Este é o segundo empréstimo de Victorino na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva. O primeiro de 6.000.00MT foi usado para reforçar o seu negocio ( comprando materiais de construção para vender) e estes 10.000.00MT serão usados para a mesma finalidade.

Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto porque conta com ajuda da sua esposa que acaba de ser empregada no conselho Municipal da Vila de Namaacha. e por ser ansioso esta confiante que dentro em breve construir a sua própria ferragem e uma capoeira em sua casa. Para tal, vai precisar de outros empréstimos.
texts.en:
Victorino was born in Inhambante, he is 37 years old and lives with his wife and their 4 children who are between 5 and 12 years old, all of them go the school. He doesn’t have any other responsibility besides his family and is able to save 1,000MT a month. He left Inhambane to fulfill the military service which is obligatory for 2 years and lived in Matutuine to be exact in Catuane as prison guard, but because of the war he leaves the job and went to live in the capital Maputo where he studied environmental action and obtained a job at the Direction of Agriculture in the Municipality of Villa de Namaacha in the frontier with Suazilandia, as agent of irrigation service for plants, obtaining 1,900MT monthly. Besides working in agriculture, he has been working as gardener at the Church of Nossa Senhora de Fatima on Mondays, Tuesdays and Thursdays in the mornings earning 1,000MT and on Wednesdays and Saturdays at the informal market he sells construction materials in small scale. To increase the volume of his business he approached Hluvuku requesting a loan of 10,000MT. This is his second loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. The first of 6,000MT was used to improve his business (buying construction materials to sell) and the 10,000MT will be used on the same way. He is confident he will be able to pay back on time because he also counts with his wife’s help who has been hired by the Municipality of Vila de Namaacha, and he is anxious and confident in the short he will be able to build his own hardware store and farm at his house. For this he will need other loans.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell construction materials

loans.name: Truthful Group

texts.en:
Rose, the leader of this group, is divorced with four children who are currently in school. She is a 40 year-old trader. Rose believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to minimizing poverty and for that matter she is very serious about her business. She trades in foods such as plantain. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of plantains in order to better serve her customers throughout the season especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She believes that with the loan she will be able to buy plantains directly from the farmers avoiding middlemen who retail to her at a high price.

Rose is the leader of a trust bank group called "Truthful" and is the one sitting in the group photograph. The members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and farmers. In this group, the members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To bulk buy plantains

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal “Gregoria Apaza” del centro poblado de Pusuyo del Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de el Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 05 hijos, vive en el centro poblado de Coraraca, estudio educación secundaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 1 año y medio, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de ganado menor.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar ganado vacuno para mejorarlos y luego ella los comercializa en las ferias zonales que se realizan una ves por semana.

Su mayor deseo es convertirse en mayorista de venta de ganado.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Gregoria Apaza Communal Bank in the Pusuyo community center in the Ilave district, Collao province, Puno department. She is 38, married, and has five children. She lives in the town center of Coraraca. She has a high school education. She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost a year and a half. She started with a loan for 300 PEN, which allowed her to increase the capital in her business of buying and selling livestock. She currently needs a new loan for 3,000 PEN, which will allow her to buy cattle. She will improve them and then sell them in the regional fairs that are held once a week. Her greatest desire is to become a wholesaler selling livestock. She likes the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn G. is from the village of Lurugan, Valencia City. She is 31 years old. Merlyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In April 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Ofelia tiene 36 años, vive con Wiler, su pareja de 31 años, y con sus 2 hijas; Sandra de 9 y Bárbara de 1 año de edad, en su casa propia.

Ella se dedica a venta de productos de belleza, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 2 años para proveer a su familia de todo lo que quiere ofrecerles. A Ofelia siempre le ha gustado sentirse independiente, es por ello que le gusta mucho su trabajo, aunque si bien le da ciertas libertades en los horarios, no quita que sea muy cansado recorrer las casas de sus familiares, amigas y vecinas para mostrar los catálogos y productos cada mes.
Lo bueno es que Ofelia gana cada vez más experiencia y esto logra que obtenga mejores ventas y mayor clientela. Para el futuro, desea tener una tienda (bazar) donde poder ofrecer, de manera más cómoda, todos sus productos.

Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP y siempre ha sido muy puntual en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza, que estén en oferta para tenerlos en stock.
texts.en:
Ofelia is 36. She lives with Wiler, her 31 year old life partner, and their two daughters. Sandra is 9, and Bárbara is 1. They live in their own house. She sells beauty products. She has been doing this for two years in order to provide her family with everything that she wants to give them. Ofelia has always liked feeling independent. That is why she likes to work so much. Even though it gives her a certain amount of freedom in her schedule, it does not mitigate how tired she gets from going to her family’s, friends’, and neighbors’ houses to show them the catalogs and products each month. The good thing is that Ofelia gets more experience each time, and this helps her get more sales and more customers. In the future, she wishes to have a store (bazaar), where she would be able to sell all of her products more comfortably. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She has always been punctual with all of her payments. She will use the money she is now asking for to buy a greater quantity of beauty products that are on sale in order to have them in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Masombo Group

texts.en:
Mohamed T., Abib M., Neneh J., and Aminata J. are small-scale entrepreneurs in the town of Magburaka, in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 2,000,000 SLL ($525), or 500,000 SLL each, to purchase more goods for their respective businesses. In this way, they will be able to generate more sales and, in turn, higher profits. Ultimately, the loan proceeds will enable them to better support their children in terms of food, clothing, and education.

Mohamed T. (pictured second from the left) is the leader of this group. Mohamed is twenty-three years of age, and was born in Magburaka town. He is single and has one child, who is not of school-going age. For seven years now, Mohamed has earned a living as a professional tailor. Indeed, he sews clothes for both male and female customers, and he sells his goods in and around Magburaka town. Mohamed will use this loan to buy sewing materials such as poplins, threads, zippers, etc.

loans.use: To purchase additional materials for the business, including poplins, threads, and zippers

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
El Señor Reynaldo R. T. tiene 29 años, el señor  Reynaldo se dedica a la producción de leche y su posterior venta a una empresa que elabora toda clases de productos lácteos, y acude por las noches a la universidad donde está a menos de medio año de graduarse de la carrera de Veterinaria, que él asegura que le dará buenos ingresos por que en la zona donde vive no hay un veterinario cerca.

El señor Reynaldo  vive en la zona de Machac Marca en Cochabamba,  es una zona bastante alejada de la ciudad y por lo tanto para ellos es difícil acudir a los bancos en busca de préstamo por eso fue que el Cidre tuvo la iniciativa de ir a esta zona y descubrimos que el estado en el que tienen su ganado no es muy bueno que a la mayoría les falta establos que en esta época de lluvia son muy requeridos por tanto el señor Reynaldo  utilizara este crédito para construir su establo y que sus vacas no sufran en la época de lluvia. 

El señor Reynaldo  nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es continuar con la producción de leche como siempre lo hizo, terminar su carrera y ser el mejor veterinario que pueda y de esta manera no solo ganar dinero si no también dar un servicio necesario a la zona donde vive.
texts.en:
Sr. Reynaldo R. T. is 29 years old and raises dairy cows for milk production. He sells the milk to a company that produces all types of dairy products. At night he attends classes at the university, where he is six months away from earning his degree in veterinary medicine. He says that he should be able to earn a good income because there are no veterinarians available who live in the nearby areas.

Sr. Reynaldo lives in the district of Machac Marca in Cochabamba. It is a fairly remote area of the city, so it is difficult for him to go to a bank in order to obtain a loan. For this reason, CIDRE took the initiative to come to this area. He says his cows are in bad shape because he lacks a stable to shelter them during the rainy season. With this loan, he will build a stable so that his cows are protected from the rain.

Sr. Reynaldo says his biggest dreams are to continue being a dairy farmer and to finish his degree. He wants to become the best veterinarian who can, not only make money, but also provide a needed service to his community.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a stable

loans.name: Maura Veronica

texts.es:
La señora MAURA VERÓNICA A. P. tiene 35  años, vive en el distrito deL PORVENIR, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal CARIDAD II. La socia presenta estudios hasta 5to de Secundaria, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2 dependen económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la crianza de pollos para su posterior comercialización en un mercado cercano a su domicilio.
Con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles pudo comprar pollos bebes.
Con este crédito de 800.00 nuevos soles comprará pollos y alimento balanceado al por mayor . Ella sueña con aumentar la crianza de sus pollos y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ms. Maura Veronica is 35 years old and lives in the Porvenir district in the Trujillo province in the Libertand area of Peru and is part of the Caridad II communal bank. She has a high school education, is in a live-in relationship and has three children, two of which depend on her. She raises chickens which are then sold in the market near her home. She used her first loan of 300 PEN (~$125 US) to buy chicks. She will use the 800 PEN ($300) from this loan to buy more chicks and nutritionally balanced feed. She would like to increase the number of chickens raised and thus increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “La Amistad” y viven en la ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Los socios se reúnen cada 30 días en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa. En el video se ve que la junta directiva esta verificando que la documentación de los socios este correcta.      

Nuestras socias alternan sus diversas actividades del hogar con la venta de boletos de pasajes, comestibles, llantas de autos y comida. Otros socios se dedican a brindar servicios como transportes y llamadas a celulares.     
La socia Fanny tiene 34 años y tiene que madrugar para atender a sus dos hijos y preparar desayuno de quinua para los transeúntes que se van a trabajar. La socia saca adelante a su familia pues no cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja, ella se dedica a la venta de desayuno en una esquina desde las 5 de mañana hasta la 1pm.  Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar más insumos como leche y quinua. 

Los socios requieren el préstamo para comprar más productos como comestibles, llantas, etc., así poder aumentar el capital del negocio y así tener mayores ingresos y darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
