She sells dairy products, such as milk and yogurt. T. has 9 years of experience. As her business is the only one source in her family she works very hard to keep in normal life conditions. She would like to expand her business and vary her production. Meat is very popular all across Azerbaijan. Azerbaijani people use meat almost every day and most of dishes consist of meat.  She would like to purchase three calves for approximately $300 and fodder for meat production. She has applied for a loan of $1000 .

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder for her livestock business

loans.name: Bimarhabo

texts.en:
Bimarhabo F. is 38 years old, and she is married with two children of school age.

Bimarhabo sells dried fruit in the central local market. She has been in this business for 6 years. In Tajikistan, people are extremely hospitable, and when there are visitors, most hostesses will serve the traditional bread “lepeshka”, tea, candies, and dried fruit. Bimarhabo tries to have a wide range of goods available and serves her clients with a smile. Her business is stable and generates a considerable income for the family.

Bimarhabo is requesting 1,000.00 US Dollars for a term of 6 months. The loan will be used to purchase dried fruit, such as raisins, apricots, almonds, pistachios, and peanuts. This will increase the range of goods available for sale. Having proved herself to be a reliable client, Bimarhabo promises to pay the current loan back in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchase dried fruit, such as raisins, apricots, almonds, pistachios, and peanuts in order to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga is 42 years old. She is a mother of three children. She has been dedicating herself to making textile art, dresses, lingerie and other things. Her constant labor has been has provided her with enough to be able to contribute to supporting her family. She has decided to move her shop to her home and wishes to someday start her own textile factory. With your contribution she will buy equipment that she needs to be able to make her beautiful clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Edith of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Olga de 42 años de edad, es madre de 03 hijos, desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica al arte textil y confecciona vestidos, lencería y otros, su continua labor le provee lo suficiente para que contribuya con la economía de su hogar. Hace poco ha decidió mudar su taller a su propia casa y tiene deseos de instalar en el una fábrica textil, con tu importante aporte comprará las herramientas que le hacen falta para su desempeño además de materia prima para la confección de sus bellos artículos.

loans.use: Equipment for her own little textile factory.

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Mrs. Thorn P. is 27 years old and lives with her husband in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She makes a living by selling various kinds of grocery products to the people in her area, and earns about $5 a day . Her husband earns about $3 each day working as a construction foreman. Mrs. Thorn P. has three children who are too young to attend school.  She has applied for a loan to buy a motor-bike that will allow her to transport grocery products to her food stand.

loans.use: To purchase a motor-bike for her business.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is a diligent young lady of 26 years of age. Her major wish is to become a professional and through effort and dedication she is at a point of realizing her dream. She is currently studying civil engineering in a private university in the city of Juliaca. Thanks to the support of her parents and the income that she receives from her business of selling clothing and shoes, she can cover the expenses of her education.

This hard working young woman gets her products in the city of Tacna, and sells them every two weeks in the district of Pinaya, a little town far away from her home in Santa Lucia. Since she is in the tenth cycle of her professional studies her expenses have increased substantially and that is why she wants to acquire more merchandise to increase her sales. Yolanda is sure that this investment will improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Yolanda, es una diligente joven de 26 años de edad. Su mayor deseo es ser profesional y con esfuerzo y dedicación está a punto de concretar su sueño; actualmente estudia Ing. Civil en una universidad privada de la ciudad de Juliaca , gracias al apoyo de sus padres y a las ganancias que obtiene con su negocio de venta de ropa y calzados puede cubrir sus gastos de educación.

Esta laboriosa joven adquiere su mercadería en la ciudad de Tacna y los oferta quincenalmente en el distrito de Pinaya, pueblito muy lejano de su natal Santa Lucia. Ahora que ya cursa el X ciclo de su carrera profesional aumentó sustancialmente sus egresos, es por ello que tiene pensado adquirir mayor mercadería para incrementar sus ventas, Yolanda está segura que esta inversión mejorará sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: Increase of capital in order to purchase a larger quantity of shoes.

loans.name: Firmes Y Bendecidos (Firm And Blessed) Bank Group

texts.en:
Cecilia had two children. One is 37-years-old and the other passed away. She is the proud grandmother of a 21-year-old and will probably live to be a great-grandmother in the near future. Culturally, people marry very young in the Dominican Republic. Cecilia´s business consists of sewing clothes to sell. In order to do this, she needs to be able to buy fabric. With the loan money, she can buy more fabric to grow her business and take better care of herself and her family. She dreams of living a better life and helping her grandkids live better than she has.

Note: This is a group loan. In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: To sew more clothes and support her grandkids

loans.name: Mu

texts.en: Mu F., 58, is married with 9 children. She has many years of experience in the cabbages, beans, green pepper, and pumpkin business. She sells to the general public and villages 3 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD). SPBD loans are Mu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be use to repair house. Her husband helps out to do the vegetable garden.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds

loans.name: Chhengkea

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhengkea H., 45, and her husband, Mr. Lieng Hun, 43, who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, married in 1990 and have four children, two sons and two daughters. All of their children study in local schools.

Chhengkea has been farming since she was young, a skill she learned from her parents. She grows many kinds of vegetables in a farm not so far from their home. Besides farming, she also raises pigs. Her husband has been a wooden house builder for three years. Currently he lacks some materials for running his business.

So, Chhengkea is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase construction materials for her husband's business.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for her husband

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of bedsheets and introducing window curtains to her small business

loans.name: Salaevalu

texts.en:
Salaevalu M., 42, is married with five children. She has many years of experience in the Beach Fales business. She sells to tourists and to the public seven days per week. She has had four previous loans with SPBD.

Salaevalu would like to have another loan to repair houses. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 800 Tala (~$333 USD). SPBD loans are Salaevalu's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To improve the business by repairing small houses

loans.name: Mrs. Mey Uok Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mey U. is the leader of a loan group with six members who all live in Pou Doh village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns two hectares to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Morn Ran, is a construction worker who earns a small income to support the family. Although Mrs. Mey U. and her husband have different businesses, they still live in poor conditions. Therefore, Mrs. Mey U. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She is 37 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a construction worker while the others attend the local school. 

One of the members in this group loan has an end-of-term loan, so this member is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Muqaddas

texts.en:
Muqaddas baji is 34 year old married lady and a mother of four children: three daughters and one son. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. She is a citizen of a city named Riwind, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 13 years. Muqaddas baji’s husband is a driver and drives a vehicle named “Shahzore.” He bought this vehicle on monthly installments and uses it to deliver items (fruits and vegetables) from one place to another.

Muqaddas baji has a clothes sewing business. She has been sewing clothes for the past 10 years. She successfully repaid her four previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to pay the installments of her husband’s vehicle.

loans.use: To pay the installments of vehicle named "Shahzore."

loans.name: Rubina Shakeel Ahmad Group

texts.en:
I am Rubina and I’m a 35 year old woman living in a city named Borewala, Pakistan. I have been living in this city for the past 5 years. I am an uneducated lady but I know the worth of education. It gives a good direction to people. My husband's name is S. A., who is a driver by profession and drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). He has 15 years of experience in this profession. I have four kids: three sons and one daughter. As I said before, I know the value of education, and that’s why I am delivering the same value to my children and giving them an education. My daughters read in 6th standard. My elder son is in 5th standard and my younger son is in 3rd standard.

I am a seamstress by profession. I do this work to pay for my children’s school fees. My husband bears the household expenses. I’m applying for a loan to repair my husband’s auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) so that he is able to continue his work and perform his duties efficiently. 

I am a group leader of few more women in my locality. Naseem akhtar baji wants a loan to buy leather and nails for her shoe making business. Rashidan baji wants a loan to buy ready made garments for ladies and gentlemen for resale. Asia baji wants a loan to buy spare parts for vehicles for resalel. Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk sales business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

loans.name: Mam

texts.en:
Mrs. P., 54, is a widowed rice farmer who lives in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice since 1988 because rice farming is the main source income for her family's living expenses. She cares for four children, all of whom are single and are living in the family home. One of her sons carves wood from the forest and sells to regular customers.

With a view to growing her son's business, P. would like to request a loan to purchase two buffaloes to use as transportation and with any remainder she would buy piglets to raise for extra income.

loans.use: to purchase two buffaloes to use as transportation and piglets to raise

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Tanzania! This is 39 year old Rukia G. from Mwanza. She is widowed with three children between the ages of 14 and 17 years old. Rukia has been running a business raising kuku. 

"Kuku" means chicken in Swahili, and raising them for sale is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially among SELFINA clients, for a number of reasons.They require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally. Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing, they produce eggs that can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. 

Rukia has had her business since 1999 and it is doing well. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 7 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Rukia currently earns about $150 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD to purchase more chicken for the business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Rukia thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia A., a 28-year-old young woman is married, blessed with two children, and is a very hard-working businesswoman. Both her children are in school, and Sylvia lives with her husband in a rented house. She enjoys selling and cosmetics sales has been her major source of livelihood for the past five years. She says selling cosmetics is lucrative and her experience in the market has enabled her to gain many loyal customers.

Her shop is located at a strategic place in the market. Fortunately her shop is the first contact to enter the community market where she sells. Sylvia believes that with the loan, she would be better able to purchase more stock of cosmetics and jewelry; she needs pomade, hair cream, lipsticks etc. to increase her inventory--and income for that matter. Sylvia belongs to a village bank called ‘Joy’. She hopes to receive GHS 500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cosmetic products

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.es: Desde que dejó su amado Ayacucho (ciudad de la sierra, al sur de Lima), Aquilina  no tuvo otra opción que buscar las mejores condiciones para vivir. Junto a su pareja y sus hijos lograron adquirir una casa donde habitan desde hace 12 años. Su meta al salir de su tierra natal fue ofrecer a sus hijos un futuro próspero. Y el esfuerzo de varios años de dedicarse al comercio la ayudaron, ya que en su inicio solo vendía algunas frutas en la puerta de su casa, pero poco a poco fue ganándose la simpatía de las personas quienes la motivaron en instalar una tienda y así hace 8 años tuvo la oportunidad de abrir una pequeña bodega que está creciendo por la gran acogida que tiene con sus vecinos. Aquilina espera seguir creciendo porque la meta que tiene es terminar de construir su casa y ampliar su local para incrementar su mercadería y surtir su negocio con nuevos productos, con la finalidad de que sea un negocio sostenible en el tiempo, para el bienestar de sus hijos. Es cliente de MFP hace 6 años, se encuentra en su onceavo crédito y siempre se mostró comprometida con el grupo, pues la organización que tienen es muy buena. Aquilina tiene la necesidad de ambientar su tienda y ampliarla con el fin de adquirir más productos y bajo estas metas solicita 3000 soles en préstamo.
texts.en:
Ever since leaving her beloved Ayacucho (a mountain city, south of Lima), Aquilina had no other choice than to look for better living conditions. Together with her partner and their children they managed to obtain a house where they’ve lived for 12 years. The purpose for leaving her native home was to offer her children a more prosperous future. Many years of hard work in commerce have paid of. She began selling a few fruits from her home, but little by little she gained the sympathy of some people who motivated her to open up a store, and 8 years ago she had the opportunity to open a small store, which has been growing due to the relationship she has with her neighbors Aquilina hopes her business continues to grow, as her goal is to finish construction on her home and to expand her store so she can increase her merchandise to stock it with new products, ultimately making it a sustainable business for her children’s benefit. She’s been a client of MFP for 6 years, is on her 11th credit cycle and has shown herself committed to the group, as her organization is very good. Aquilina needs to improve her store and expand it in order to get more merchandise, which is why she is asking for a loan of 3000 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise increase and improvement to her store

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa T. is 62 years old, married and the mother of ten children. All her children are fully independent and are working. She lives at Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana. Though Adwoa is old she is a very hardworking and lovely mother who encourages the youth to be serious in their God-given talents. She sells drinks in a wooden structured bar. She sells items like Coca Cola, Pepsi, Malta, Sprite, and any other assorted drink which is frequently demanded by her clients. Not long ago Adwoa started this business in order to take care of herself. She started this business and raised money by herself but has realized that it is not enough to buy more drinks. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy more assorted drinks to be able to provide for her sick husband. She would be grateful for your support. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Mpeasem’, which simply means I don’t want trouble.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks like Coke, Pepsi, canned drinks etc.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene S. is a vendor of different snacks such as rice cakes and also vegetables in their village. She also plants vegetables and morning glories which she also sells for extra income. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 9,000 for the development of her store.

Her husband Rex helps her gather vegetables that she can sell in the public market and in their village. They have four children who are all studying and who help them in their planting and selling, especially during school vacations.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is forty three years old. He is married with two children. He is an auto electrician and a taxi driver. John services all types of cars and vehicles that have electrical and battery faults. At the moment, he is training five young men, using his knowledge and skills to give them future job opportunities.

John wants the loan to buy more tools and work materia such as, scrap batteries, wires and car parts to provide his clients with better service and to increase his income. He wants to expand his workshop and provide for his family. The loan would also be used to maintain his taxi. He belongs to the community group called Prosper Trust Group. In this group, members provide guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To procure tools and work materials.

loans.name: Fazal Mohammad Group

texts.en:
Fazal M. is the leader of the Fazal M. group, which has four members. They have requested a group loan of 56000 Afghani.

Fazal M. wants a loan for his butcher shop. He will enlarge his shop. 

Pacha G. wants to take a loan for his business of mobile materials. He will expand and progress his business. 

M. Fazal wants a loan for his  vegetable business. He wants to buy necessary materials for his business. 

A. Qahar wants a loan to expand his general store. 

These four men say that these loans can be very useful because they provide a chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their businesses.

loans.use: Buy necessary materials for business

loans.name: Nasib

texts.en:
Nasib is the son of H. S. and lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 40 and married with four children. He has a restaurant in which he sells different kinds of things. He would like to have a more progressive business and so he has requested a loan of 50,000 Afghani to purchase all the essential things required in his restaurant.

Nasib is thankful to all lenders, especially Kiva, that provide small loans to entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To buy more materials for his restaurant

loans.name: Dima

texts.en:
Dima is a 27-year-old woman who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon.  She has owned a grocery store since 2004. Dima has requested a loan of $1200 from Al Majmoua to purchase groceries for her store. This is Dima's second loan cycle. 

One obstacle that she faced with the previous loan is that her store is a family business.  Her family is big, so it was hard to share the benefits among all and still concentrate on improving the business.  What helped her is that her father was the owner of the shop so there was no rent to pay. 

Dima's customers are friends and neighbors. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase groceries

loans.name: Dodarbek

texts.ru: Чононов Додарбек проживает в районе Шахритуза. Возраст 29 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена домохозяйка. Додарбек более 3 лет работал "медбратом". В данный момент он более 5 лет занимается сельским хозяством. Он выращивает арбуз, лук и морковь, а потом продает на рынке. Кредит просит для сбора урожая и нового посева.
texts.en:
Dodarbek C. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 29 years old, married and has 2 children. His wife is a homemaker. Dodarbek had worked as a nurse for over 3 years. Currently, he has been involved in agriculture for over 5 years. He grows watermelons, onions and carrots and then sells them at a market. He is requesting a loan for harvesting and new sowing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Harvesting and sowing fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Rusia

texts.en:
Rusia is a member of the Idunda borrower group in Kihesa,Iringa,she is 49 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 3 children.Her children are aged 29,19,16 years,she also cares for other 5 dependents.

Rusia started her own business selling cooking oil 20 years ago,she works 7 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 160,000 Tanzania shillings

This is Rusia`s first  loan from BRAC_Tanzania.she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more cooking oil for sale.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan,Rusia hopes to save more money,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil

loans.name: Jane

texts.es: Jane es madre soltera de 3 niños que ya están estudiando. Desde hace un año implementó un local al frente de su casa para la venta de comida, donde todos los sábados y domingos ofrece parrilladas (pollo asado acompañado con yuca y ají), bebidas gaseosas y cervezas, desde las 9am hasta las 4pm. Adicionalmente, de lunes a viernes, se dedica a la atención de un cafetín para los alumnos de una universidad cercana a su casa, labor que viene ejerciendo desde hace 6 meses. Jane dice que todo esto lo hace por sus hijos, a quienes tiene que darles lo necesario para salir adelante. Le gustan mucho sus actividades porque se distrae y se mantiene ocupada, además que ambas le son rentables. Lo bueno de su venta de pollo a la parrilla es que ella misma cría los pollos y procura que estén en un peso y tamaño adecuado para cuando los prepare, pues así la presentación en sus platos es más atractiva para el cliente, porque son grandes porciones a un precio adecuado. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su grupo es que entre todos se comprenden, se ayudan en sus diferentes negocios y son puntuales en sus pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más pollos y alimento para éstos. Por otro lado, Jane mandó a construir otro local en su casa adecuado para una bodega, entonces con lo que le reste de su préstamo comprará también comestibles para habilitar su tienda.
texts.en:
Jane is the single mother of three children who go to school. One year ago she set up a place in front of her house to sell food. Every Saturday and Sunday from 9 a.m. until 4 p.m. she sells grilled food (barbecued chicken with yucca and chili), soft drinks, and beer. Also, on Mondays through Thursdays she works in a small student cafeteria at a university near her house. She has been doing this for six months. Jane says that she does all of this for her children. She has to give them what is needed to get ahead. She likes her activities a lot because they entertain her and keep her busy. Also, both are profitable. The good thing about selling grilled chicken is that she raises the chickens herself. She makes sure they are the right weight and size when it is time to prepare them. This way her dishes are more appealing to her customers; they are large portions for a good price. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She likes working with her group. They understand each other, help each other in their different businesses, and are punctual with their payments. She will use the money she is now asking for to buy chicken and food for them. Jane will have another location for a store made in her house. She will use the rest of the loan to buy food for the store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens and invest in a new business

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing is 40 years old and divorced with two children. She sells foodstuffs like plantain, cocoa yam and garri (roasted cassava) in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Blessing hopes for the loan of N70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Margarita socia del Banco Comunal “Alto Alianza” del Distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil casada tiene 02 hijos, vive en el Jr. Franco Arce, estudio educación primaria incompleta ( 3er grado).

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace años no recuerda, inicio su préstamo con la suma de 300.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de zapatillas.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar zapatillas, además combustible gasolina que comercializa al por menor.

Su mayor deseo es poder poner una zapatería o de lo contrario un grifo para sacar adelante a sus hijos.

A ella le  gustan  las reuniones y la puntualidad

loans.use: Para la compra de zapatillas, combustible gasolina.

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel T. is from the village of Dullan. He is 31 years old. Arnel is married. To make a living, Arnel owns and operates a boat repair business where he provides repair services to local community members. Arnel has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Arnel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arnel has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Arnel is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be Arnel's 6th loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions.

About PMPC:\n\nPaglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.\n\n*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

loans.name: Cyril

texts.en:
Cyril M. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City. She is 25 years old. Cyril is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Cyril owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Cyril has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Cyril joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cyril is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Cyril from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en:
Arayik M. is 27 years old and lives in Sevan. His specialty is being a service organizer in hotels and tourism complexes, but because of his living conditions he has never worked in this sphere. He worked as a shop assistant in a food market, then he had a shop where he sold mixed products, and a year ago he opened a butcher shop. Every month Arayik has approximately $415 in income from which he pays $104 for shop rental.

Arayik lives with his parents. His mother is jobless and his father helps Arayik in his business. Arayik supports his family, thanks to the income from his business which he hopes to expand in the future.

Arayik wants to receive a loan of 800.000 AMD to buy 6-8 calves to raise and sell.

loans.use: To buy 6-8 calves to raise and sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria de 47 años de edad es agricultora y a la vez se dedica a la producción de leche, victoria es viuda tiene tres hijos que son pequeños. La mayor tiene 12 años el otro niño de 10 y el pequeño 7 años. Todos Viven el Zona de Machajmarca en la Ciudad de Cochabamba.

El esposo murió hace  tres años en un accidente en la carretera Santa Cruz - Cochabamba  en la empresa en la que trabaja no le dieron ninguna indemnización porque ellos justificaron que el señor se encontraba en estado de ebriedad y que el responsable era él, desde ese momento la señora Victoria es responsable de sus hijos ella se hace cargo de su educación  y trabaja mucho para  que los niños puedan terminar la escuela y poder estudiar alguna carrera como era el sueño del padre.

A la señora Victoria le sirve mucho el dinero que ella solicita porque ella comprara una vaca y aumentara su producción de leche y podrá tener un aumento en sus ingresos y podrá seguir ayudando a sus hijos. Ella no recibe ninguna ayuda solo es ella la que saldrá adelante con sus hijos y tratara de darles una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Victoria is 47 years old. She is a farmer and works with the production of milk. Victoria is a widow with three small sons. The oldest is twelve years old, the next one is ten and the youngest is seven. They all live in the Machajmarca Zone in the city of Cochabamba. Her husband died three years ago in a car accident on the Santa Cruz – Cochabamba highway. The company he worked for gave him no death benefits because they claimed he was drunk and so was responsible for his own death. Since this time Mrs. Victoria has been responsible for her children. She is in charge of educating them and she works very hard so that her children can finish their schooling and study a career. That would be their father’s desire. Mrs. Victoria could really use the money that she is requesting. She will buy a cow and increase her milk production. This will increase her income, which will allow her to continue to help her children. Victoria does not receive any help. She is responsible for the progress of herself and her children. She is trying to provide them with a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Adela Edith

texts.es: Adela Edith R. O. de 36 años de edad, reside en el pueblo de Cojutepeque, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella posee una tienda llamada “Milagro” nombre el cual le fue dado a su negocio hace diez años, ya que fue iniciado con la esperanza de poder mejorar la vida de sus hijos. Adela solícita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar una mayor cantidad de productos perecederos, ya que cuenta con un gran número de clientes, debido a  que es una persona la cual es muy conocida en el lugar y al mismo tiempo es una persona la cual es admirada por ser muy fuerte y trabajadora la cual vela por el bienestar de su familia, ella espera aumentar aún más sus ventas, pero para esto ella debe contar con una mayor cantidad de productos es por esto que solicita el préstamo.
texts.en:
Adela Edith R. O. is 36 years old and lives in the town of Cojutepeque with her husband and two children. She has a store called “Miracle”, which she named 10 years ago when she was starting out with the hopes of improving her children’s lives. Adela is requesting a loan to buy more perishable products. She has a large customer base because she is well-known in her area, and also admired by many for being so strong and hardworking. She hopes to increase her sales even further by with a greater quantity of products in her store, which is why she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishable products.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Bo Woho Mmoden Group

texts.en:
Margaret is 65 years old. She is divorced and a mother with three children. All of her children are now independent, but she occasionally takes care of her grandchildren when her children are on vacation. She operates a drinking spot where she sells all kinds of soft drinks such as canned malts, and canned and bottled drinks like Coke, Pepsi etc. She is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide for her business. She has been running the drinking spot for five years now, and she needs the loan to buy assorted drinks to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance.

Margaret is the leader of a trust bank group called 'Bo Woho Mmoden' which literary means 'strive in life'. She is the one standing second from the left in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders and food sellers, respectively. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access the loan and provide peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy assorted drinks like Coke, Pepsi and canned drinks to upgrade her inventory.

loans.name: Elsira

texts.en:
Elsira D. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 39 years old. Elsira is single. To make a living, Elsira owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells both food & daily use products in the local community. Elsira has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elsira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elsira is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Elsira from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Tabaldyeva Baktygul`s Group

texts.en:
Baktygul is leader of this group. She is 44 years old, married with 5 children. Her husband works as a builder in town. She has a livestock breeding business. Usually she fattens cows, bulls, and some sheep. She looks after them for about 3 months then sells them at the local market. Almost every Sunday, her husband goes to market and examine the livestock for sale. If he finds a suitable one, often he buys it. This loan will be used to buy a cow for breeding. Their monthly income is about USD 50.

Irsalathan, 38, is a married woman with 4 children: two daughters and 2 sons. At the present time, her husband is in Russia. He works there in a construction company as a builder. She hopes to buy 4 sheep with this loan. She has a little farm where she will look after them and when spring comes, the sheep will be sent to highland pasture.

Uulkan is 20 years old and a married woman. She has a 1-year-old son. Her husband is working in Moscow. Every month he sends home about 100 USD. Uulkan works in the animal sales business. Every week she goes to the local animal market. She sells about 2 cows per week. Her monthly income is about 150 USD. This loan will be used to buy a bull.

Kanymbu is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children. The elder son is in Russia; other two are still pupils. Her husband is a physics teacher and earns about 80 USD per month. Kanymbu sells different types of groats like buckwheat, millet and oatmeal and other food and necessary items in her own kiosk. This loan will be used to buy 50 kg of sugar, 50 kg of rice, 100 kg of pasta, soaps, detergent and cigarettes for her kiosk.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious, socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Meni Group

texts.en:
Meni Group is a group of five borrowers led by Majah B.. She is 39 years old and is married, with three children aged 13-25 years old. In addition to her children, she cares for a sibling. Majah did not have the opportunity to go to school due to poverty.

Majah’s business is the sale of used clothes at the Waterside Market, which is the largest market in Monrovia, Liberia. She has been running this business for ten years and hopes to open a shop in the future. She sells good quality clothes to customers and has a good business relationship with her customers in order to encourage them to continue buying from her.

Majah will use this loan to purchase more used clothes. She dreams of providing good living conditions for her family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Majah is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes.

loans.name: María Ana

texts.es: María Ana H. de 37 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador. Vive junto a cuatro hijos todos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar y el mayor de ellos le ayuda a María en el negocio por las tarde. María posee una venta de ropa para hombres mujeres y niños, la cual comercializa desde su propia casa, lo cual ha pesar de esto cuenta con muy muchos clientes a quienes les agrada ir a comprar donde María por los precios bajos y la calidad de la ropa. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar ropa por mayor de manera que pueda obtenerla a precios menores, lo cual la beneficia porque podrá obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales se vean reflejadas en la calidad de vida de sus cuatro hijos, los cuales dependen por completo de este negocio para vivir.
texts.en:
María Ana H. is 37 years old. She lives in the Ilopango municipality, which is located in the San Salvador department. She lives with her four minor children. They all go to school. The oldest child helps María with the business in the afternoon. María sells clothing for men, women, and children. She sells from her own house. She has a lot of customers who like to shop at her business because of the low prices and the quality of the clothes. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy wholesale clothes. That way she can get lower prices, which will help her get greater earnings. This will be reflected in the quality of life of her four children. They completely depend upon this business to live.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale clothing

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru: Сатаров Фуркат проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 30 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Живет вместе с родителями. Отец разводит скот. Брат занимается продажей мяса. Сам Фуркат более 6 лет занимается животноводством. Имеет небольшой коровник. Разводит скот у себя дома. Кредит берет для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Furkat S. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 30 years old, married and has 2 children. His wife is a homemaker. He lives together with his parents. Furkat's father breeds livestock, and his brother sells meat. Furkat has been involved in animal husbandry for over 6 years. He has a small cowshed and breeds livestock at home. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more local gin to sell

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Nine people make up this village bank loan, and they all live in Prey Mien village in Takeo province. Mrs. Mom H. is the leader of the group loan and has been selected by the members. Each member of this group will use their loan for different purposes.
Mrs. Mom H. is 38 years old and a mother of two children who both attend the local school. She and her husband, Mr. Sovannarith Chak, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, Mr. Sovannarith Chak is a wedding chef by which he earns a small income to support his family. With both these businesses, the couple still do not earn enough income to support their family. Therefore, Mrs. Mom H. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Natividad De Mercedes

texts.es: Natividad D. Mercedes F. D. R. D. 62 años D. edad, resiD. en Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador, vive en casa propio junto a un hijo. Natividad posee una tienda en la cual venD. granos básicos, sopas instantáneas, pan, café, leche y otros productos más los cuales son para el consumo diario y así mismo para el uso diario del hogar. Ella también se dedica a la venta D. ropa, zapatos y cosméticos como: perfumes, labiales, cremas y otras más. Natividad debe trabajar muy duro día con día para poder salir adelante, ya que no posee la ayuda económica D. nadie, es por esto que ella desea mucho poder obtener un crédito con Integral, para poder comprar mayor cantidad D. productos perecederos para la tienda, así mismo comprar más mercadería como nuevos estilos D. zapatos y una diversidad más granD. D. ropa. D. esta manera ella espera poder ver el crecimiento D. su negocio, y así contar con un negocio más estable el cual le brinD. la tranquilidad que Natividad desea para su vejez.
texts.en:
Natividad D. Mercedes F. D. R., 62, lives with her son in Soyapango, San Salvador department, in her own home. Natividad has a general store where she stocks basic grains, instant soups, bread, coffee, milk and other products common to daily household use. She also sells clothing, shoes and cosmetics like: perfumes, lipsticks, creams, etc. Natividad must work very hard every day in order to get ahead because she doesn’t get any financial support from anyone. This is why she very much wants to have a loan with Integral so that she can buy greater amounts of perishable items for the store as well as to buy new styles of shoes and a larger assortment of clothes. She expects to see her business grow and become more stable so that she can have the peace of mind she wants for her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishable items.

loans.name: Bassirou

texts.fr: Monsieur Bassirou Silla est  un habitant du quartier de Wakhinane. Il est Age  d’une quarantaine d’années. Il est marie sans enfants. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Baye laye depuis décembre 2008.Monsieur Silla est un chauffeur de profession dans le secteur du transport  en commun de la banlieue  de Dakar. Mais parallèlement il mène une activité  commerciale d’achat et de vente de produits  locaux depuis 2 ans. Auparavant il était apprenti  de car rapide et après sa maitrise il a obtenu son permis de conduire et trouvé un travail de chauffeur de minibus. Il sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour  l’achat de mil, niébé, destines a la vente. Ses bénéfices lui permettront  de compléter son salaire afin qu’il puisse subvenir a l’intégralité de ses besoins sociaux
texts.en:
Mr. Bassirou Silla lives in the Wakhinane area. He is around 40, married, but without children. He has been a member of our Baye Laye branch since December 2008. Mr. Silla works as a professional driver in the public transport sector of the suburbs of Dakar. At the same time, he has been buying and selling local produce for the past two years. In the beginning, he was a rapid transport (bus) apprentice; when he got his driver's license, he found work driving a minibus. He is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs to buy millet and niébé (a local seed), for resale. His profit will allow him to complement his salary so that he can fully support himself.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to his working capital

loans.name: Tasleem Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Tasleem akhtar lives in the city Multan, Pakistan with her family.  A talented lady, Tasleem operates a clothes-selling business to financially support her husband. She purchases clothes from her nearby market and sells them to different areas of the community. Earlier she sold her clothes by going door to door in the community. Now they have become her good customers and her son delivers their orders to their houses. She has been in this business for over five years.  

She has applied for a loan from Asasah (microfinance institute in Pakistan) to invest the loan amount in her clothes selling business.  She is hopeful that the loan amount will help her to complete her orders on time for her customers.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for reselling

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene M. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 36 years old. Arlene is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene raises poultry. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale. Arlene has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby chickens to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Arlene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby chickens

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce R. is 49 years old and a widow. She has five children and they do not go to school. Joyce is currently in the business of selling maize flour (measuring it with a cup) and is requesting a loan to stock more maize flour and rice to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

loans.use: To stock more maize flour and rice to sell

loans.name: David

texts.es: David A. C., tiene la edad de 28 años, está soltero, no tiene hijos. Vive con sus padres. El crédito lo quiere compra de  abono, fungicidas y semillas para granos básicos. La idea es  darle mantenimiento  al cultivo de granos básicos, específicamente para maíz y frijoles.   Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don David tiene varios años de experiencia en la agricultura y está seguro de que le va a ir muy bien en esta nueva oportunidad que se le presenta. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
David A. C., age 28, is single and does not have children. He lives with his parents. He wants the loan to buy fertilizer, fungicide, and seeds for basic grains. His plan is to give maintenance to his basic grains crops, especially corn and beans. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the terms of the loan. David has several years of experience in agriculture. He is sure that this new opportunity will go very well for him. In the future he hopes to give his family a better quality of life and greater financial stability. He wants to be able to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plant and maintenance of basic grains

loans.name: Andricus

texts.en:
Andricus O. A. is a married man but has no children yet. His business is located at Kisumu Bus Park Market, an area in Kisumu which is very busy. He sells phone accessories. He also does phone charging services and phone repair. He has been in this business for six years now and has one employee. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints on getting a bigger premises with adequate space. However he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy more phone accessories to provide good service to his customers. He hopes to grow his business in the next five years and become a big phone shop. He also has a dream to alleviate poverty through educating youths informally to engage in business activities. He describes himself as interactive, social and self motivated.

loans.use: Phone Accessories

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Hem V. has been spending most of her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparent when she was young. She is now married and has five children, three of whom are employed at different jobs. Her husband works in the farm fields, frequently alongside her.

Growing crops is an annual operation with which Hem V. has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons.

The farmland that Hem V. owns is located far from the water and the irrigation of her crops has been affected. To help solve this problem, she is looking for a loan to buy a water pump to deliver the water to her crops.

loans.use: To buy a water pump to irrigate her crops

loans.name: Pedro Socorro

texts.es:
Don Pedro de 40 años de edad es casado, tiene 2 niños de 15 y 12 años de edad los dos estudian, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar.  Pedro  trabaja para el Ministerio de educacion desde hace 16 años como docente de primaria, inicio dando clases a niños campesinos de manera gratuita por medio de la iglesia catolica, posteriormente logró conseguir una plaza de docente en el MINED pagado por el gobierno ya que su vocacion es la docencia.

Està solicitando su 2do credito para reparar dos paredes de su casa que se encuentran en mal estado de  su  casa ya que se encuentran en mal estado, su mayor sueño en la vida  es tener estabilidad laboral, que sus hijos estudien y sean hombres de bien y  mejorar sus condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Pedro, 40, is married and has two sons who are 15 and 12 years of age; both are students. His wife is a housewife. Pedro has worked for the Ministry of Education as an elementary school teacher for 16 years. He started out teaching rural children for free through the Catholic Church. Later on he was able to secure a paid teaching position with the Ministry of Education since his vocation is teaching. He is asking for his second loan to repair two walls in his house that are in poor condition. His greatest wish in life is to have employment stability, that his children study and become upstanding citizens and to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For wall repair.

loans.name: Isabel Julia

texts.es:
Isabel de 45 años, vende almuerzos de todo tipo y vive en una zona periurbana llamada Paraíso, caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y  ecología en disolución. 

Antes de comenzar a trabajar en su local de comida ella trabajaba en casa haciendo almuerzos a sus vecino pero como tenia mucha demanda de su comida deicidio agrandar su negocio y tener su propio local, hace tres años atrás comenzó a vender comida típica en su local. Trabaja de lunes a sábado  preparando y entregando almuerzos. Hace platos como caldo de bolas, caldo de patas, arroz con pollo etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una cocina industrial para hacer mejor las comidas, en el futuro quiere que su hija termine sus estudios con éxito y seguir construyendo su casa.
texts.en:
45 year old Isabel sells lunches of all types and lives in an area outside the central city called Paraíso, which is characterized by its dirt roads and deteriorating ecology.
Before starting to work in her food stand, she worked from home making lunches for her neighbors. But there was so much demand for her food that she decided to grow her business and open her own food stand. She has been selling typical regional dishes at her stand for three years. She works from Monday to Saturday preparing and selling lunches. She makes dishes such as plantain dumpling soup, potato soup, rice and chicken, etc.
She wants to use the loan to buy an industrial stove so that she can make her dishes more easily. For the future, she wants her daughter to finish her studies successfully and to keep building her house.

loans.use: To buy an industrial stove

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice D. is currently in the business of selling local Sudanese bread and other items such as, lagemat, taia and tea in the local restaurant. She is requesting a loan to stock more baking flour. Alice is 35 years old and single.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

loans.use: Stock more baking flour

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma comes from Gujranwala which is located in Punjab province and is famous  in Pakistan for its sweetmeats. She lives in a 3-room brick house with her family in the area called Farid town. She is a housewife, who stays at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. She is very active and receives great respect in the family for her supportive nature. She is married to M. I. who is a rickshaw driver. He provides transport services to his passengers and to school children and generates income for the family. As he is the only breadwinner for his family, this makes him even more responsible towards his work.  

Najma is the mother of a 3-year-old son. She spends most of her time taking care of him. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s rickshaw. He will invest the loan in repairing his rickshaw because its engine is creating a problem and if it never gets repair in time it might seize up.  After the repair work, he will be able to do his job more efficiently and provide better service to his passengers. 

Najma is hopeful that this investment will bring good results for her husband’s business and her family will be able to enjoy better living conditions. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and hopes that it will be a good experience for her. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Najma.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw

loans.name: Ariel Freddy

texts.es: El señor Ariel es comerciante desde muy temprana edad el le ayudaba  a su mama en la venta de maletas y mochilas, ahora que ya es mayor de edad el se hizo cargo de todo el negocio ayudando de esta forma a los gastos de la casa le va muy bien y esta  prosperando la razón del crédito es para abastecerse para fin de año ya que en estas fechas la demanda de sus productos incrementa ya que también le seguirá el inicio a clases, y necesita abastecerse de sus productos, es un joven trabajador y muy responsable, esta muy agradecidos con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ariel is a merchant.  When he was very young he used to help his mother sell backpacks and luggage.  Now that he’s an adult he took over running the entire business helping to meet household expenses.  He does quite well and is prospering.

The reason for the loan is to stock up for the end of the year because during this season demand for his products increases.  In addition, the school year’s beginning follows and he needs to stock up on his products.  

He is a hard working, very responsible young man.  He thanks the institution for the support given.

loans.use: To buy backpacks and luggage in quantity.

loans.name: Mann

texts.en: Mann S. is 41 years old, widowed, and has one child who attends 12th Grade. They live along National Road Number 5, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.  Mann has been a mason for almost 20 years. He is applying for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Los Girasoles Del Algodonal Group

texts.es:
Rosita tiene 33 años es parte del grupo “GIRASOLES DEL ALGODONAL”  cuando se inicio el grupo ella empezaba a incursionar en el mundo D. las ventas fue una representante D. una marca que la motivo para independizarse económicamente así fue alcanzando mas experiencia y pudo encontrar clientes nuevos a quienes ofrecía los productos que vendía como perfumes, talcos, lociones y maquillaje, en sus momentos libres también ayuda a su esposo que se dedica a la confección D. zapatos, con el tiempo rosita quiere tener un lugar donD. mostrar todos los productos que venD. para D. esa manera aumentar su clientela y sus ganancias, gracias a su trabajo ayuda a su esposo a solventar algunos gastos D. la casa, en esta oportunidad el dinero D. su préstamo le servirá para la compra D. productos surtidos  que ofrecerá esta campaña naviD.ña ya que son muy requeridos por estas fechas.

*Rosita es la 3ra sentada viste polo celeste.
texts.en:
Rosita is 33 years old and a member of the “Girasoles del Algodonal” group.  When she joined the group, she was just starting to break into the world of sales.  She was a sales rep for a brand which motivated her to become financially independent.  She gained more and more experience and managed to find new customers to whom she could offer the products she sold such as perfumes, talcum powders, lotions and make-up.

In her spare time, Rosita helps her husband who makes shoes.  Over time, she would like to have a place where she can display all the products that she sells so that she can increase her number of customers and her profits.  Thanks to her work, she helps her husband to cover some of their household expenses.  She will use the money from this loan to buy products with which to stock her business and which she will offer to her customers during the Christmas period since her products are very much in demand at this time of year.

In the photo, Rosita is the third person along (sitting down) and is wearing a light-blue top

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Teresita Elizabeth

texts.es: La Srita. Teresita Elizabeth Rodríguez, es una persona joven que vive en casa de sus padres, y ella hace mas de un año que inicio el negocio de la venta de ropa seminueva, y al paso del tiempo a hecho muchos clientes, por este motivo, ella nos ha solicitado un crédito, porque desea que su negocio crezca y comprar mas mercancía para tener que ofrecer una mayor variedad de mercancía  a sus clientes, ella piensa que al tener mas mercancía la gente la va a recomendar, y así  poco a poco  el negocio ira prosperando y además porque ella apoya económicamente a sus padres, ya que viven en la misma casa, aunque cuenta con el apoyo de su papa, pero como hija mayor ella siente que al aportar un apoyo a la casa, su padre no se vera tan presionado con los gastos.
texts.en:
Teresita Elizabeth Rodríguez is a young woman who lives in her parents' home.  She started her business selling lightly-used clothes over a year ago and, during this time, she has gained a lot of customers.  She is requesting a loan because she would like her business to grow and she would like to buy more merchandise so that she has a wider variety to offer her customers.  

Teresita believes that if she has more merchandise, people will recommend her business and this will mean that her business will gradually become more successful.  Teresita supports her parents financially since they live in the same house.  She has her father's support but as the eldest daughter, she feels that if she helps support the family her father will not be so pressured with their expenses.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a  45-year-old married man living in Nabatieh with his wife and 6 children. Hussein owns a shop where he has been selling chickens since 2005.  He has 11 years of experience in this field. Hussein works hard to improve his business because it's his only source of income.

Hussein is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy a bigger generator for his shop, since the electricity problem is becoming more  complicated day by day in the region. Hussein's clients are most of his neighbors, relatives and friends.  They state that his quality of products is better than competitors in the region. 

Hussein hopes to open a farm of his own where he can raise his own chickens to trade with.

loans.use: To buy a bigger generator for shop

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima L. is from the village of Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 39 years old. Zosima is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Zosima owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Zosima has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Zosima joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zosima is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Zosima from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Brgy.Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Elbegsaihan

texts.en:
Elbegsaihan, 48, is married and lives with his wife and four children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. His two older daughters attend college while the younger two daughters attend a local secondary school.  His wife is unemployed and helps him with his business. 

Elbegsaihan became a carpenter in 1984 and opened his carpentry business in 2001 after his family moved to the city from the countryside.  He makes mostly woodcraft items and customized wood furniture, and sells his products at a local market. He supports his family's needs and pays his daughters' tuition fees with the income from this carpentry business.

Elbegsaihan is a modest and hardworking person who says, "our wish is to work hard and take care of our daughters' education".  Elbegsaihan is requesting a loan of 700,000 MNT to buy timber and materials for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To buy timber and carpentry materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying cassava flour

loans.name: Shafqat Kanwal's Group

texts.en:
Shafqat kanwal lives in Kot Radha Kishen which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan and famous for its agriculture. She is 36 years old and has been living there with her family in a 3 room brick house for the past 10 years. 

She is married to I. H. who operates an optical store in the market. He keeps in his store variety of frames such as sun and eye glasses for his customers. He also provides eye testing facilities to his customers. He is the only money-maker in the family. 

Shafqat is a housewife, stays at home and takes care of her family and does her household work. She has given birth to 3 daughters and a son. None of them are able to get an education due to poor financial resources. 

Shafqat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who will utilize the loan money in buying more eyeglass frames for resale. He has been operating this business for past 5 years. Shafqat is hopeful that an investment will bring more profits to her husband which will enable her to educate her children in near future. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she has proved herself as a responsible client by paying her installments on time and attending every meeting. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shafqat kanwal”.

loans.use: to buy eyeglass frames for an optical store

loans.name: Giyosidin

texts.en:
S. Giyosidin lives in Isfara, Tajikistan. He is married and father of two children. Giyosidin has been engaged in an animal husbandry business. He has a good place for feeding livestock at home. Since 2002 he has been doing the cattle breeding business. Sometimes his wife helps him in feeding the cattle. Giyosidin feeds them and after 20 – 35 days sells them at a local market. From the profit of his business, he was able to repair his house. He would like to get a loan of 5000 Somoni for purchasing cattle.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase two cattle.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a twenty-six-year-old married man with two children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after the family. He sells used shoes for a living and has been in business for six years. The business is profitable despite the challenges in irregular sales due to the seasonal nature of the business.

Francis needs a loan to buy secondhand shoes to sell. His dream is to construct rental houses.

loans.use: To buy secondhand shoes to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nenita is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 57 years old and she has two children who are in school. She has a seaweed culture business in the Philippines and has been in this business for twenty years. 

Nenita requested a 17,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more seedlings of goso (green algae or seaweed) for the expansion of her seaweed culture business.  In the future, she would like to build and expand her business for the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more seedlings of goso.

loans.name: Danny Soledad

texts.es:
Danny  es una joven emprendedora de 24 años de edad que vive en casa de sus padres en el distrito de Olmos – Lambayeque. Olmos es una comunidad que en los últimos años ha crecido sustancialmente, debido a la puesta de un proyecto hidroenergético en la zona.

Las oportunidades en el distrito olmano han crecido junto al proyecto y Danny fue una de las personas que las aprovecharon. Ella trabaja como asistente administrativa en una empresa que brinda servicios de cable por televisión

Danny solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles que invertirá en su uso personal. Ella desea, arduamente, independizarse de sus padres y con el trabajo que hoy en día realiza esta dando sus primeros pasos para hacerlo.

A pesar de ser un cliente nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa, Danny muestra cierta capacidad y voluntad de pago. Ella quedará muy agradecida con dicho préstamo porque le será de mucha ayuda para su vida y para iniciar una línea de crédito.
texts.en:
Danny is an enterprising 24-year-old  who lives with her parents in the district of Olmos - Lambayeque.  Olmos is a community that has grown considerably over the last few years because of a hydroenergy project established in the area.

Opportunities in the Olmos district have grown with the project and Danny is one of the people who has taken advantage of the situation.  She works as an administrative assistant in a cable TV services company.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 500 PEN for personal use.  She is serious about becoming independent from her parents and with this job she has is taking the first steps toward that end.

Despite the fact that she is a new customer to Edpyme Alternativa, Danny displays a capacity and commitment to paying on time.  She will be very grateful for the loan since it will help her meet her goal and begin a credit record.

loans.use: for personal use: to become independent.

loans.name: Vianney

texts.es:
La señora Vianney vive en el estado de veracruz en el municipio de Tierra Blanca o mejor conocida como la novia del sol, la cual se caracteriza por ser una zona ganadera y sus abuandantes calores en verano  de hasta 54°c. Doña Vianney tiene la edad de 36 años solo estudio la primaria y esta casada con el señor Jose Gilberto el cual trabaja de obrero en la vidriera de dicha comunidad, ellos tiene 3 hijos de nombres Daniela de 16 años, Jesse de 14 años y Nancy de 12 años los ultimas dos asiste a la primaria.

Ella nos platica que hace un poco mas de un año tuve la inquiertud de ayuadar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que casa dia todo esta mas caro y el dinero no rinde, asi que desidio vender zapatos por catalogo y cosmetico de la marca Avon los cuales vende con sus amigas y vecinos de su municipio.

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de zapatos, perfumes, costmeticos y catalogos para poder realizar su venta, ella nos dice que primero lleva a mostrar sus catalogos a sus clientes, levanta un pedido, lo encanrga con sus proveedores y cuando llegan sus paquetes entrega sus productos a sus clientes y recibe el pago por sus productos.

Ella espera que con este credito su negocio cresca cada dia mas ya que desea darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y en un futuro estudien una profesion la cual les ayude a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Vianney lives in the town of Tierra Blanca, better known as the “Bride of the Sun”, in the State of Veracruz. The area is known for its livestock industry and the abundant summer heat that can reach as high as 54°C. Doña Vianney is 36 years old and only has an elementary school education. She is married to Sr. Jose Gilberto, who manufactures windows in the community. They have three children named Daniela (age 16), Jesse (age 14), and Nancy (age 12). The two younger children attend school.

Vianney says that a little more than a year ago, she became concerned about helping her husband with the household expenses. Everything was getting more expensive and the money was not there. At that moment, she decided to sell shoes through catalogs and cosmetics from the Avon brand. She offers her products to friends and neighbors in her town.

Vianney needs this loan to invest in the purchase of shoes, perfumes, cosmetics, and catalogs for making her sales. She says that she must first present the catalogs to her customers, take their orders, and then send the orders to her distributors. When her shipments arrive, she packages the products for delivery to her customers and collects payment.

She hopes that this loan will help her business grow each day. Vianney wants to give her children a better life and the opportunity to study so that they can pursue a profession in the future to help them get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Reymundo

texts.en: Reymundo, 39 years old, is married and blessed with four children. He has been growing corn for almost 20 years. He is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his farm. At the last cropping, his net income is 30,000 PHP. He hopes to continue taking loans to be able to achieve his dreams for his children through patience and hard work.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers for his farm

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees.
