For the past three years, she has operated a grocery-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Hadija faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation and seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business and selling wholesale in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables and fruits for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables and fruits for sale.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 49 years old and lives in Oroquieta City. She is married and does not have children. 

To earn a living, Angelina has a business of selling fish. She earns about 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Angelina has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Angelina has been a member of PMPC since just this year.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Msere

texts.en:
Msere, aged 62, is a widowed mother of three children. She has been selling milk for four years. The business earns her a monthly profit of KES 7,000.

This is Msere's second loan term with KADET LTD. She has successfully repaid her previous loan. Msere will use the funds to buy goats for resale. She hopes to sell the goats and milk to neighboring countries in the future.

loans.use: To buy goats for resale

loans.name: Petros

texts.en:
Petros is from the village of Heshtia, Ninotsminda District, in the southern part of the country. He is 23 years old and lives with his family: his parents, 21-year-old brother, 8-year-old sister and grandmother. Petros and his father work on the village farm as cheese specialists. His brother works in the same farm as a shepherd and his mother as a milkmaid. Petros’ sister goes to school.

Along with their job at the village farm, the family earns income from a family-run agricultural business. In particular, they have a milk cow. They produce cheese and sell it locally. At the same time, they own 1.5 hectares of the land.  0.5 hectare of the land is used to grow potatoes. Harvested potatoes are sold locally to the vegetable retailers. The rest of the land is used for mowing. One-half of the hay is sold locally and the other part is used on the family farm for feeding the cow. 

Petros requests a loan to purchase two additional milk cows. The family will have more milk and more cheese for sale. It will significantly increase the income of the family, which will enable them to purchase various household goods to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase two milk cows

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is a farmer from the village Sartichala, East Georgia. She is 38 years old, married and lives with her husband, Koba, and 15-year-old daughter. Manana is leading the dairy farm owned by the family. They have 2 milk cows. Manana produces and sells 40-50kg of cheese per month. Koba owns a truck. He brings svia from Rustavi (nearby town) and sells it in the village. 

At the moment the truck is out of order and Manana has requested credit to repair it. After repairing the truck Koba will re-start selling keri and the family will again get their normal income which equals 800 Laris per month.

loans.use: to pay for repairing the truck

loans.name: Gloria Auralila

texts.es: Gloria Auralila tiene 49 años, su actividad es la venta de comida y refrescos. Tiene 7 años en su negocio, cuando su esposo quien trabajaba en la empresa san Antonio le consiguió un permiso y ella estableció su negocio aquí. Actualmente tiene una gran cantidad de clientes que disfrutan todos los días los productos que realiza. El motivo del crédito es para invertir en la compra de bolsas, pajillas, frutas, azúcar, gaseosas, pan y otros productos.
texts.en: Gloria Auralila, 49, sells food and soft-drinks.  She’s been in business seven years.  When her husband worked for the San Antonio firm he got her a permit and she set up the business here.  Currently, she has a large number of customers who enjoy the products she prepares daily.  The reason for the loan is to purchase bags, straws, fruit, sugar, soft-drinks, bread and other products.

loans.use: to buy bags, straws, fruit, sugar, soft-drinks, bread and other products.

loans.name: Unidas Por El Amor Group

texts.es:
Doña Francisca es miembro y coordinadora del Banco Comunal Unidas por el Amor, tiene 56 años de edad, es viuda y madre de seis hijas y dos hijos, se dedica a la venta de abarroteria y reside en la comunidad del Rusio en el municipio de Juticalpa.

Desde hace 16 años atras Francisca tiene una pulperia y gracias a ello ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos menores. Inició su negocio cuando su esposo murió y ella se quedó sin ingresos para sostener a la familia, asi que fue comprando productos de la canasta basica y poco a poco fue surtiendo su pulperia. La pulperia se llama "Pulperia Yolani", y esta abierta desde las 6:00 am hasta las 6:00 pm, y cuando Francisca realiza los quehaceres del hogar o sale a comprar la mercaderia, una de sus hijas le ayuda a atender a la clientela.

El prestamo que solicita Francisca lo necesita para la compra de arroz, frijoles, manteca, jabon, aceite, pastas, salsas, condimientos, churros, refrescos, pan, carnes, embutidos, pollo, entre otros productos de consumo alimenticio. Con el apoyo de este prestamo ella podra surtir su negocio y su clientela no se ira a otro lugar a comprar porque tendra de todo un poquito en productos.

Su sueño es ampliar su negocio hasta convertirlo en un mini-mercadito y apoyar a sus hijos para que puedan terminar sus estudios academicos. Francisca tiene varios ciclos en FAMA y ha sido una clienta puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Doña Francisca is a member and coordinator of the communal bank Unidas por el Amor. She is 56 years old and a widow. She has 6 daughters and 2 sons. She sells groceries and lives in Rusio in the municipality of Juticalpa.

She has had a grocery store for the last 16 years and as a result has been able to raise her minor children. She started the business when her husband died and she was left without an income with which to support her family.  So she began buying staple products and little by little was able to stock her grocery store. The grocery store is called "Pulperia Yolani" and is open from 6:00 am until 6:00 pm. When Francisca performs the household chores or when she goes out to buy merchandise, one of her daughters helps her out by taking care of the customers.

Francisca needs the loan she is asking for to buy rice, beans, butter, soap, oil, pasta, sauces, condiments, doughnuts, soft drinks, bread, meat, cold cuts, chicken and other food commodities. With the support of this loan, she will be able to stock her business and her clientele will not go elsewhere to buy because she will have a little of everything among her products. 

Her dream is to grow her business into a mini-mart and support her children so that they can finish their academic studies. Francisca has had several loan cycles with FAMA and has been a client who is punctual with her repayments.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a 26-year-old married woman. She has two children who are between two and eight years old. She describes herself to be visionary. She operates a tailoring business where she provides a dressmaking service and sells material. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located within a shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenges to be seasonality and inflation. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase materials. Her business goal is to expand her business into wholesale within five years.

loans.use: To purchase materials (fabrics)

loans.name: Boniface

texts.fr:
Client de 65 ans, il se lance dans la vente des boissons il y'a de cela 25 ans, et il est aujourd'hui client de Hope Congo bientôt une année et il a déjà bénéficie de plusieurs cycles de prêts.
Il gère un dépôt de boissons gazeuses et boissons alcoolises.Il a des recettes de 200.000 fr a 500.000fr par jour.
Avec ce nouveau prêt , il va renforcer son stock en achetant une palette e boissons gazeuses, une palette de boissons alcoolises et de la boisson importée.Il fait la vente en gros et fait des livraisons dans les domiciles, les restaurants et bars.
Tres connu dans le secteur, gentil il est très fier de son partenariat avec Hope parce qu'il arrive a réaliser ses objectifs , avoir une autonomie , vendre ses propres produits au lieu de prendre a crédit les produits de la brasserie  et de récupérer  les benefices , alors qu'avec les différents prêts, il a son propre capital.Il compte aller jusqu'au bout avec Hope.
texts.en:
This client is 65 years old.  He started selling drinks 25 years ago and has been a client of Hope Congo for almost one year.  He has already benefited from several loan cycles.

The client manages a soda and alcoholic drinks warehouse.  He makes 200,000 to 500,000 francs a day.

With this new loan, he will strengthen his stock by purchasing a pallet of soda, a pallet of alcoholic drinks and some imported drinks.  He sells wholesale and delivers to houses, restaurants and bars.

The borrower is very well known in his neighborhood.  He is kind and very proud of his partnership with Hope because he is managing to achieve his goals, work independently and sell his own products instead of taking products from the brewery on credit and recovering the profits.  With these loans, he has his own capital.  He plans to go all the way with Hope.

loans.use: to buy a pallet of soda, a pallet of alcoholic drinks and ten cartons of imported drinks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 45 years old and married with six children, four of whom are still schooling. He is a resident of Muranga where he carries out his farming with the current output of fruit, tea and milk going to the local market.
 
Francis has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water pump at 35,000 KES and water pipes, which he will use to carry out irrigation on his farm. He says the rampant drought hinders adequate production. He adds that availability of the water pump will enable him to use his land effectively. 
 
He reiterates that pests and drought are really hurting the farmers' efforts.

loans.use: To buy a water pump and  irrigation pipes

loans.name: Bebita

texts.en:
Bebita, age 43, is married with 5 children. She lives in the Philippines.
Bebita is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years.She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer. Bebita has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Bebita hopes to see children finish college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Fransisco

texts.en:
Fransisco is a 31-year-old man who is married to Yuliana, 30. They have two sons: Putra, 6, and Justin, 5, both of whom attend kindergarten. Fransisco also supports his nephew, Ady, 21, who is studying at a university. 
Fransisco owns a car rental business. He has been operating the business for almost one year. Through the business Fransisco is able to support his family's needs, his children’s education, and Ady as well.
Now Fransisco is seeking a loan of 4,000,000 IDR to repair his car. He is hoping that Kiva partner TLM is willing to help him with this business loan.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to repair his car.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
Roberto de 63 años, es un hombre felizmente casado con Margarita, con quien vio crecer a 3 hijos. Actualmente vive solo con su esposa en Pueblo Pardo, en el distrito de Chanchamayo. Este hombre no descansa. El peso de los años no le han quitado las ganas de seguir trabajando en lo que más le gusta: la agricultura, actividad que lo sostuvo desde niño.  A los 20 años obtuvo sus propias parcelas, desde entonces se entrega a la labores del campo.
Cuenta con terrenos de cultivos propios donde siembra tanyarinas, carambolas, cacao, naranjas y una nueva producción de achiote. “El cacao siempre se mantiene en su precio de 6.50 soles el kilo y ahora el achiote está bien solicitado”, explica.
A la vez, se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa en las ferias de Santa Ana, San Ramón y La Merced. Para eso viaja hasta la ciudad de Lima para traer la mercadería de los mismos confeccionistas. En su labor como vendedor lleva 5 años, gracias a su hijo quien le enseñó las tácticas de mercadeo.
El campo no siempre será una actividad fácil de realizar, por tal razón piensa consolidarse y ampliar su el negocio de las prendas. Sería el préstamo número 7 que obtendría de MFP, se siente agradecido por todo el tiempo de apoyo, por ello se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Así también, muestra gran alegría por pertenecer a su banco comunal por el trabajo solidario que realiza.
Invertirá todo el dinero del crédito en la compra de ropa (pantalones, chompas, polos, casacas, etc.) para su venta en las ferias.
texts.en:
Roberto, 63, is happily married to Margarita with whom he watched three children grow up.  He currently lives just with his wife in Pueblo Pardo in Chanchamayo District.  This man never rests.  The weight of his years has not removed the desire to continue working at what he likes most: farming, an activity he’s done since childhood.  At the age of 20 he obtained his own parcels and since then has been working in the fields.

He owns fields where he grows tangerines, star fruit, cocoa beans, oranges and a new production of achiote [annatto].  “The price of cocoa beans is steady at 6.50 soles a kilo and now achiote is in high demand,” he explains.

At the same time he sells clothes at the Santa Ana, San Ramón and La Merced street markets.  To do so, he travels to the city of Lima to bring merchandise directly from the manufacturers.  He’s been in the selling business for five years thanks to a son who taught him the market techniques.

Working in the fields won’t always be easy to do so he’s thinking about consolidating and expanding his clothing sales business.  This would be MFP loan #7 and he feels grateful for all the time he’s been helped so he commits to be punctual with his installment payments.  He also exhibits much joy at being part of his communal bank because of the supportive work it carries out.

He will invest the entire loan in the purchase of clothes (pants, sweaters, t-shirts, jackets, etc.) to sell in the street markets.

loans.use: to buy pants, sweaters, t-shirts and jackets.

loans.name: Torobay

texts.ru:
Торобай  работает на шахте, занимаясь поставкой материалов для укрепления забоев.  Ему 45 лет, женат, воспитывает двоих сыновей и дочь.  Жена Гульнара домохозяйка.
	В 1995 году Торобай начал свой бизнес  в животноводстве, купив одну козу на сумму 600 сом, что послужило стартом его собственного бизнеса.
 Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Торобая имеются 2 дойные коровы, 2 нетели, 2 лошади, приносящее примерно 8,000 - 9,000 сом в месяц. Доходы от деятельности  позволили Торобаю купить легковой автомобиль для семьи. 
	
Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Торобай обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров. 
В будущем, Торобай планирует расширять поголовье скота за счет баранов и коз.
texts.en:
Torobay works at a mine, supplying materials for mine face reinforcement. He is 45 years old, married, and is bringing up two sons and a daughter. His wife, Gulnara, is a homemaker. 

In 1995 Torobay started his livestock breeding business, buying one goat for 600 som, which served as the beginning of his own business. Because of his persistent work, there are now 2 dairy cows, 2 heifers, and 2 horses on Torobay's farm, bringing in approximately 8,000 - 9,000 som a month. His business income has allowed Torobay to purchase a car for his family. 

In order to further develop his business, Torobay asked Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of dairy cows. In the future, Torobay plans to increase the number of livestock by acquiring sheep and goats.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Rosa Antonia

texts.es:
En la parroquia San Pablo de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Unión Y  Solidaridad.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos, cuatro de ellos ya son mayores de edad y una hija  de 11 años que estudia en colegio. Cuatro de ellos aún viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante. Ella es modista aprendió corte y confección  en un centro artesanal hace varios años.
 
Ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser ropa de todo tipo, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y también elabora ropa para niñas las mismas que coloca en una vitrina para la venta. Además de su taller de costura también tiene una papelería  en su mismo local el cual atiende al mismo tiempo que realiza sus trabajos. En estos días también está vendiendo ropa y zapatos para aprovechar la época de Navidad y Año Nuevo ya que las personas compran bastante estos productos. Lleva más de  5 años en su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar ropa, zapatos, telas, hilos y otros materiales para la costura. Lleva más de  5 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio.
 
Sus sueños son tener una boutique y un taller más grande con más máquinas y operarias.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank Unión y Solidaridad meet bimonthly in the San Pablo parish in the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarind Trees.  

Here we meet Señora Rosa who is 52 years old, married and from this marriage, has five children.  Four of them are adults and she has an 11 year old daughter who attends primary school.  Four of them still live with her.  Her husband is a merchant. She is a seamstress who learned her trade at a craft center several years ago.  

She has a small sewing shop in her house where she works sewing all types of clothing. She works based on her orders from individuals.  She also makes girl's clothing that she displays in a glass case to sell.  In addition to her sewing shop, she also has a stationary store in her home which she attends to while she is works in her shop.  Right now she is also selling clothing and shoes to take advantage of the Christmas and New Year season as people buy a lot of these products.  She has been running her business for 5 years and things are going well for her.  
 
She will use this new loan to buy clothing, shoes, fabric, thread and other sewing materials.  She has been a member of her communal bank for 5 years.  She likes it because she started her business with her first loan.  

Her dreams are to have a boutique and a much larger shop with more machines and operators.

loans.use: buy clothing, shoes, fabric, thread and other sewing materials

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Haruna would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when prices are at their lowest, in order to meet his immediate cash needs for things such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Haruna can now store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the harvest price.

As a Babban Gona member, Haruna will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare. Haruna is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize at harvest for low prices.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Madam Catherine T. was born in 1965 at Tsévié. Currently, she is living at Davié-Modji where she is doing her small trade of fish and ingredients. Married, she is a mother of five (05) children who are unfortunately abandoned to her as the husband has just taken his 3rd wife. Courageous and full of trusty, she has continued her activity thank to a second credit of $350. What allows her to point out a substantial income to her children elementary needs. Though illiterate, she manages in extraordinary way her activity and is always very correct in the repayment of her credits obtained. She is a trusty woman and deserves to be backed financially in view to growth her activities. This credit of $700 she requests will allow her to buy the cardboard boxes of freezer fish to make smoked fish and other vegetables, okro, tomatoes, etc. With this credit, her turnover could increase and she could invest more in her children education, health and literacy. Finance this woman is not only an act of economy, but rather a humanitarian act.

Madame T. Catherine est née en 1965 à Tsévié. Actuellement, elle réside à Davié-Modji où elle fait son petit commerce de poissons et des condiments. Mariée, elle est mère de cinq (05) enfants qui sont malheureusement laissés à sa charge car le mari vient de doter sa 3ème femme. Courageuse et pleine de confiance, elle a continué son activité grâce à un deuxième crédit de $350. Ce qui lui permet de dégager un revenu substantiel aux besoins élémentaires de ses enfants. Bien qu’analphabète, elle gère de façon extraordinaire son activité et est toujours très correct dans le remboursement de ses crédits obtenus. Elle est une femme de confiance et mérite d’être soutenu financièrement en vue d’accroître ses activités. Ce crédit de $700 qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre d’acheter des cartons de poissons congelés pour en faire des poissons fumés et d’autres légumineuses, gombo et tomate, de prendre. Avec ce crédit, son chiffre d’affaires pourra augmenter et elle pourra investir plus dans l’éducation, la santé et la scolarisation des enfants. Financer cette femme est non seulement un acte économique, mais plutôt un geste humanitaire.

loans.use: To buy the cardboard boxes of freezer fish and other vegetables

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Kraban Support Foundation has taught Margret proper record-keeping. She has also taken our TEACH Lending program. She needs a loan of $700 to support her business.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kun

texts.en: Mrs. Kun R. S. is a 22 year-old, very busy mother of one child. She lives with her husband in Kampong Chnag province, Cambodia. She and her husband sell pork at a local market and usually make over $100/day in revenue. Instead of raising pigs, they purchase pork from wholesalers or from private owners of livestock. S. is requesting a loan of $1000 to help fund her business cycle and to buy more pork. This expansion to her business will raise her family's standard of living. She also plans to build a new concrete house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase porks and fund a business cycle

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
Isidora is 69 years old. Since her husband died 18 years ago she has struggled to care for herself. Sadly, she never had a chance to bear children, though she has raised various godchildren in her care. Born to a poor family, Isidora has worked from a young age to support herself and her family. She emigrated to Argentina in search of work, sending back money to repay the loan she took out to finance the trip. Four years ago she returned to Paraguay and with the money she had saved up she set up a small shop in her home. In addition to tending the store, she also raises cattle and hogs. Isidora hopes to use this loan to purchase inventory for her store so she can increase her sales and support herself, now that she is too old to travel abroad in search of work.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Isidora tiene 69 años, enviudó hace 18 años y desde entonces ha tenido que luchar sola para salir adelante. Cuenta que desde muy joven tuvo que salir a trabajar para ayudar a su familia pues eran muy pobres, ella viajó a la Argentina en busca de mejores horizontes laborales y desde entonces ya recurría a créditos para poder llevar a cabo todos sus proyectos, enviando dinero para el pago de sus cuotas desde dicho país vecino. Con tristeza comenta que no tuvo la posibilidad de tener hijos pero que sí crió a varios ahijados que crecieron con ella y siempre los consideró como hijos suyos. Hace 4 años volvió para asentarse definitivamente en el Paraguay y con el dinero ahorrado montó una pequeña despensa en su casa con el fin de poder vivir de los ingresos que genera la misma. A la par de atender a la clientela que diariamente se acerca a su negocio, también cría cerdos y vacas. En caso de obtener el crédito lo invertiría en la compra de más mercaderías para surtir mejor su despensa y así atraer más clientela a la misma ya que por la edad se encuentra imposibilitada para viajar nuevamente al extranjero a buscar trabajo.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, oil and rice.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: With her children busy with their own businesses, 64-year-old Agnes from the village of Vailele helps out the family by selling ice cakes. Although her kids work to support the family as well, Agnes likes to be in charge of feeding her brood. Agnes makes and sells ice cakes to her fellow villagers 7 days a week, which provides her with a weekly profit of $180 after family expenses and weekly loan payments. She hopes to expand her business by adding new products such as pancakes and pies.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and for home improvement

loans.name: Saturnina Hermelinda

texts.es:
Saturnina is a single mother of 2 young daughters. A native of the district of Pukara, she has worked making ceramic handicrafts, including miniature animals, jewelry boxes, and nativities) for more than 15 years. She learned this craft from her mother, Pascuala, and she now creates these pieces with a lot a love and professionalism. Her young daughters are the daily motivation behind her efforts. She works very hard, from 4 in the morning until 7 in the evening. In their free time, her daughters help her with their enthusiastic support. The goal of this enterprising woman is to continue to grow her business. For this she is requesting a loan to purchase the material she needs to make these fine crafts, so she can increase production and meet the high number of orders she has. In the near future, she hopes to export her pieces to other countries.

Doña Saturnina es madre soltera de 2 niñas, natural del distrito de Pukará, desde hace más de 15 años está dedicada a realizar trabajos de cerámica en arcilla y yeso(Animales en miniaturas, alcancías, nacimientos), oficio que aprendió de su madre Pascuala y que ahora inculca con mucho amor y sumo profesionalismo a sus pequeñas niñas, quienes son el motivo de su esfuerzo día a día.Trabaja arduamente desde las 4:00 de la mañana hasta las 7:00 de la noche, en sus horas libres la apoyan muy entusiastas sus pequeñas niñas y el deseo de esta emprendedora familia es crecer aún más con su negocio, para esto desean adquirir materia prima (Yeso, Arcilla, Pintura) para mayor producción de sus artículos y así cumplir con la gran cantidad de pedidos que tienen y en un futuro no muy lejano exportar al exterior sus preciadas creaciones.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE THE NECESSARY MATERIALS AND PAINT TO CONTINUE GROWING HER HANDICRAFT BUSINESS, SO SHE CAN IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR HERSELF AND HER TWO YOUNG DAUGHTERS.

loans.name: Juliette

texts.en: Juliette G. has a restaurant in the Sassandra market. Sassandra is a rural city on the southwest Atlantic coast of Côte d'Ivoire. Juliette is married and has three children. She is 38 years old and has been in the restaurant business for years. Juliette's husband is a factory worker in the port of the neighboring city of San Pedro. He doesn't make enough money, so Juliette is then a key contributor to the household budget. Her restaurant is near the central market and most of the salespersons in the market take their breakfast and their lunch in her restaurant. She is very dynamic. Juliette's children all go to school in Sassandra. Her older daughter will take the baccalaureate to end her grammar school studies next year. Juliette is working hard in order to be able to pay for university studies for her daughter.

loans.use: To restock her restaurant with cold drinks and food

loans.name: Alahmad

texts.ru:
Alahmad was born in 1964, is married and has five children. His wife is a homemaker - she looks after the children. Alahmad’s oldest son helps him with his business selling DVDs. In order to attract more customers, Alahmad started selling computer games and other consumer electronics in addition to DVDs. He purchases his merchandise from suppliers from China.

Alahmad started his business to support his family. He rented a store and used all his savings to buy the first batch of DVDs. He built his business slowly and was able to purchase additional consumer electronics. Currently his business is stable, but he wants to buy a new batch of DVDs using the proceeds from his loan from KIVA.

Translated from Russian by Jamilya & Keith Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Алахмад 1964 года рождения, женат имеет 5 детей. Жена домохозайка, занимается воспитанием детей. Старший сын помогает по бизнесу,продает диски в месте с отцом. Для привлечения больше клиентов Алахмад также включил в свой ассортимент компютерние игры и прилежащую технику. Он закупает товар у поставшиков из Китая. После распада СССР он был вынужден найти работу для того чтобы прокормить большую семью. На сбережения он арендовал этот магазин и закупил первую партию дисков. Постепенно он начал закупать и технику. Сейчас его бизнес довольно стабилен и он просит у КИВЫ мах сумму займа на закупку новой партии новых дисков.

loans.use: Buying his next batch of goods.

loans.name: Odah

texts.en: Odah is 32 and married to H. with 2 children. They run a large vegetable farm where they plant vegetables and legumes. Every month they earn $20 a month with enough market picking and selling the vegetables at the market. Odah is a member of MBK and she is now requesting a loan of $100 to add to her business capital. She agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Add to business capital

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Mrs. Estela works selling fresh fish every day. With the help of her husband, Estela leaves home at the crack of dawn to buy her delicious fish directly from a pier in her city. She then sells them from a local market. Estela would really like to be the primary supplier of fish to the people of her city. With your help she will be able to turn this dream into reality.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

La venta de pescado fresco es la actividad diaria que desarrolla la señora Estela. Desde muy temprano y con la ayuda de su querido esposo se dispone a abandonar su casa para dirigirse al puerto a comprar estos deliciosos productos con el objetivo de ofrecerlos en su respectivo puesto de ventas en el mercado de su ciudad. Ella está muy deseosa de convertirse en la primera persona deseosa de ofertar estos productos al por mayor, con tu importante ayuda podrá convertir en poco tiempo este sueño en realidad.

loans.use: To offer a wider variety of fish

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi T. is 43 years old, married and has 3 children. She lives in Hanh Lam with her family. Her main income comes from farming, making bread and raising cows and chickens. She also has a milling machine, which provides her with additional income as well as some leftover bran. To take full advantage of this source of chickenfeed, she wants to borrow $750 to buy some calves and chickens.

loans.use: To purchase calves and chickens

loans.name: Mboga Safi Women's Group

texts.en:
Wilkista A. is an average Kenyan woman aged 46 with 3 children. She also lives with 1 orphan child of her late brother.

Wilkista started her business of selling vegetables and fruits 2 years ago after accumulating savings from her former work place in a local school in Busia district. She currently sells her vegetables and fruits at Busia Municipality market on a retail basis, but would like to expand her business and start operating on a wholesale basis to enable her to support her children and her husband, who currently has a low-paying job. With the help of her loan, Wilkista will be able to purchase more stock of different vegetables and fruits to enable her increase her business sales.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: To expand her business to wholesale

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en: Rustam S. lives in Asht, Tajikistan, and works alongside his fellow villages as a keeper of livestock.  He has cows and bulls, and also trades milk, and has been working in this field for five years.  Rustam also occasionally works in the collective farms, and has developed carpentry skills which supplement his income.  He is now applying for a loan of $825 for six months to open a trading station.

loans.use: To open a trading station.

loans.name: Teleni Lafaele

texts.en: Telemi Lafaele M., 34, is married with 3 children. She has 1 years of experience in the General Store business. She sells to the village people 6 days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD). SPBD loans are Telemi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All will be used to start her project. Her husband works on their plantation.

loans.use: to fund products need to start a shop

loans.name: Lilliam Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lilliam is requesting financing to invest in making repairs to her home such as adding ceramic to the floors. Lilliam is an assistant director at a school, and has been doing this for the past 14 years. Currently, she is studying to receive her Masters degree at the UCA.

She is characterized as being responsible, honest and with much desire for self-improvement. She has an 8-year-old daughter, who is in second grade at an elementary school, and her eldest son is 14 years old and in his second year in middle school. Her husband is the director at the Manantial radio station. They both share their household's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Lilliam está solicitando su financiamiento para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda como es ponerle ceramica a su vivienda. Lilliam labora como subdirectora de un centro escolar desde hace 14 años, actualmente está estudiando una maestria en la UCA. Se caracteriza por ser responsable, honesta y con mucho deseo de superación personal, tiene una niña de 8 añitos de edad, estudia su segundo grado de educación primaria y el niño mayor de 14 años estudia su segundo año de educación secundaria, su esposo labora como director de la radio Manantial, ambos comparten los gastos familiares.

loans.use: Adding ceramic to the floor of her home.

loans.name: Rehema's Tujiamini Group

texts.en:
Rehema is 29 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 14, 10, and 6 years old. She has been a clothes (khanga) seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Rehema is now requesting a loan to buy more clothes (khanga) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Khadija and Mtumwa.

loans.use: To buy more clothes (khanga) for her business

loans.name: Tinei

texts.en:
Tinei P., 43, is married with seven children. She has many years of experience selling fresh fish to the villagers and the public four days per week.

Tinei has had three previous loans with SPBD. The money from this loan will be used to purchase a fishing net for her business which her husband also helps to operate. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~83 USD). SPBD loans are Tinei's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing net

loans.name: Mohbiga

texts.ru: Каримова Мохбига проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст 39 лет. Замужем  и имеет троих детей.Имеет среднее образование  и занимается торговлей детской одежды.Занимается этим бизнесом уже шесть лет. Она планирует развивать бизнес , путем получения кредита . Кредит поможет ему завезти новый ассортимент и увеличить доход. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mohbiga K. lives in the city of Tursun-Zoda. She is 39 years old, married and has three children. Mohbiga has a high school degree and has been selling children clothes for the last 6 years. She would like to expand her business and for this purpose has applied for the loan. This loan will allow Mohbiga to purchase new clothes for sale and increase her profits. She is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent payment

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Five years ago, Nargiza started up her clothing business. Experienced and talented in the business, Nargiza has expanded her business into a successful trade and supports her family through this revenue. 

Throughout the last five years, IMON has provided ongoing assistance to Nargiza’s business through microfinance loans. Committed to growth and successful entrepreneurship, Nargiza has used each loan wisely and has repaid each with a perfect credit history. Currently, she is seeking a loan of 3000 Somoni ($ 900 USD) to replace the autumn inventory with winter clothing. With the rotation of supplies in her business, she plans to repay the loan within 2 months. The well-being of Nargiza’s family and her business are in your hands. Nargiza and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for business expansion and to replace her current inventory

loans.name: Najjanakumbi B -Justine Group

texts.en:
Justine N. is a polite and ambitious businesswoman. She is 27 years old and single. Justine is a loving and caring guardian to 7 orphans (her nephews and nieces). She runs a boutique offering trendy ladies' outfits, including some cosmetics. In good times, she can make daily sales of approximately Ush 150,000 from which she earns a weekly profit of approximately Ush 250,000. She is using the loan proceeds for purchasing some dresses to add to her stock of skirts and blouses.

At the university, Justine pursued a Bachelor's of Science in social anthropology. However, due to the the limited employment opportunities in the country, she opted for business and this has enabled her to provide for the children in her care.

Alice has big dreams, however! She looks forward to travelling one day to Dubai and Hongkong to purchase stock which she will in turn sell to retailers on a wholesale basis. She hopes that with a positive turn of business, she will see these orphans through school successfully.

loans.use: Purchase dresses for re-sale

loans.name: Melania Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Melania trabaja desde hace mucho tiempo en casas particulares dando sus servicios de domesticas, pues es un trabajo cansado pero tiene que apoyar a su familia, tiene 44 años de edad, y reside en el barrio de Memorial Sandino en la ciudad de Managua,  su esposo se desempeña como mecánico automotriz, sus planes es poder terminar de construir su casa, con las solicitudes que Afodenic le ha brindado han sido de gran beneficios ya que poco a poco ha ido mejorando su casa, esta es la novena solicitud la cual es para comprar materiales de construcción para terminar de hacer su vivienda ya que parte de la vivienda es de zinc y  quiere brindarle seguridad y bienestar a sus hijos. Sus planes es poder tener un negocio propio en su casa y a si ver mas por su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Melania has worked for a long time in homes, where she provides domestic services. It is hard work, but she has to help her family. She is 44 years old, and she lives in the neighbourhood Memorial Sandino in the city of Managua. Her husband works as an automotive mechanic. Her plans are to finish the construction of her home. With the loans from AFODENIC that have been a great benefit already, she has little by little improved her home. This is the ninth loan she has asked for which is to buy construction materials to finish making her home, and the part of the home is of zinc and she wants to offer safety and to benefit her children. Her plans are to have her own business in her home, and to see more of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to finish Melania's home

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary P. sells okra at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Mary is 25 years old, married with 3 children who attend school. Her husband is a business man.  A loan will help her increase her profits and allow her to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGO's measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand her business

loans.name: Elda

texts.es: La señora Elda de 48 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su dos hijos, quienes la apoyan en todo lo que les sea posible. La casa donde viven es propia. Su actividad es la venta de ropa de segundo uso, la misma que lleva vender a un caserío que queda a dos días de viaje en lancha por el río Ucayali, siendo un trabajo muy sacrificado, por las largas horas de viaje que tiene que pasar trasladando su mercadería. Ella vende sus prendas al contado y a veces llega a hacer trueques, cambiándolos por algún producto como pan, plátanos, yucas, maíz, entre otros, para saciar las necesidades de su hogar. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 3 años atrás, gustándole su trabajo, ya que a pesar de ser cansado el viaje por el río tambíen la desestresa y la ayuda a soñar en un futuro mejor, al mismo que conoce otros lugares como caseríos cercanos. Su negocio le es rentable porque su ropa salen como pan caliente, cuando ella llega, todos sus clientes se acercan a observar las prendas que vende eso le da esperanzas de que en un futuro pueda llegar a tener una tienda de ropa. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP y le gusta mucho trabajar con su banco comunal. Invertirá la cantidad que solicita comprando ropa de segundo uso, además quiere incursionar en la venta de zapatos.
texts.en:
Elda is 48 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, who help her in every way they can. The house where they live is their own. Her business is the sale of second-hand clothes, which she also takes to sell at a hamlet which is two days journey by boat away on the Ucayali river. It's a very self-sacrificing job because of the long hours spent travelling and transporting her merchandise. She sells her garments for cash and sometimes by barter, exchanging the clothes for products such as bread, bananas, yuca and maize among other things. She had been doing this work for the last three years, and enjoys it, because although the journey by river is very tiring, it also de-stresses her and helps her to dream of a better future, as well as passing through other closer hamlets. Her business is profitable because her clothes sell like hot cakes! When she arrives, all her customers approach to observe the garments she is selling, which gives her hopes that in the future she may be able to have a clothes shop. This is her fourth loan from MFP and she likes working with her community bank very much. She will invest the money she has asked for in buying second-hand clothes: she also wants to try and sell shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her stock

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen es socia del Banco Comunal Corí Soncco que significa Corazón de Oro en quechua. 
Carmen es casada, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Carmen se dedica a la crianza de cuy, actividad que realiza en la ciudad de Huanta para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de su hermana, tiene 8 galpones y los vende a los recreos de la ciudad de Huanta. 
Carmen necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de alimento balanceado.
Los sueños de Carmen son ser una empresaria y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Corí Soncco Communal Bank, which means "Heart of Gold" in Quechua. Carmen, 25, is married with one kid. Carmen raises guinea pigs, which she carries out in the city of Huanta and does with the help of her sister. She has eight sheds, and sells the animals to recreation parks in Haunta.

Carmen needs a loan of 1,000 soles, money that will be invested in buying feed. Carmen's dreams are to be a businesswoman and to offer a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of feed

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth O. is 45 years old. She is married with four children. According to her, one of them has just completed junior high school. The rest are still in basic school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing community called Aquase, near Cape Coast in the Central Region of Ghana.
She works hard to make some income to support her husband cater for the family. Elizabeth is a trader. She trades in provisions and all kinds of drinks – malt, fan milk, fan ice, etc. She procures the products from the wholesale dealers in the regional capital, Cape Coast, and sells in the community market. Elizabeth says she owns a shop in which she sells her products. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure the provisions and drinks in bulk.

loans.use: To procure provisions and drinks

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
“Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough”, says Julie S.. This is her guiding principle whenever she is in the middle of a problem or an economic crisis. She dreams of becoming successful and giving her children a better future. With the support of her husband, she has become more dedicated to her chosen business.

Charcoal production is her business. She sells it wholesale and retail to her customers. She and her husband are also engaged in farming. They plant rice and root crops. They have an average income of PHP 4,000 a month that they have to budget for the basic needs of their family and to pay for the education of their children. Julie then decided to ask for the loan amount of PHP 5,000 for her charcoal-making business. Her income from making charcoal is being used for the maintenance of their farm. Julie hopes to live a progressive life someday.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
In addition to being an entrepreneur in the grocery store business, Doris, 28, takes care of her four kids: two boys and two girls. Currently, all of them are pursuing education at the primary school. She wants to make sure that she is financially able to support all of her children to the highest degree of education possible. She lives with her children in a family house in a farming community in the Ashanti region of Ghana. 

Doris runs a grocery shop in her neighborhood to help her husband provide for the family. She sells products like evaporated milk, candies, toiletries, pomade, and bottled water. She has been in business for four years now. She also sells cosmetics to support her family with additional income.

Doris is expecting higher profits if she receives her loan. She will be adding more products to her grocery stall. Her grocery products sell very quickly after she purchases them. Also, she will be adding vegetables and spices to sell on a tabletop to diversify her trading. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
“Hard work paves the way to progress,” said Merlinda. She is engaged in the direct-sales business, selling NATASHA and AVON products that she purchases from nearby outlets and sells in their village. She is the industrious housewife of Salvie and the mother of five children. Two of their children are already college graduates while some are still in the tertiary and secondary levels of education. 

Merlinda is applying for a loan of PHP17,000 for her direct-selling business. Her husband works abroad and she wants to help him with meeting the needs of their family and with sending their children to school. She hopes that her business will become fruitful for their welfare. Merlinda believes that patience and hard work will pave her way to success.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca sells glutinous snacks in her village in San Agustin, Isabela. She is 57 years old and doing her very best to give her family a progressive living, despite her age. She is married to Felipe who is a farmer. Her family is planting rice which is their common livelihood to combat life difficulties. Rebecca even sells vegetables when she does not have glutinous products to sell.

She requests a loan of PHP5,000 to improve her business. Rebecca is very willing to develop her business more and she believes she can make it. She hopes that lenders will support her business and she will do her part as a borrower.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Shafaq

texts.en:
Shafaq H. is the mother of 3 children. Her salary as a schoolteacher wasn’t even enough to provide her children with basic needs. This fact motivated Shafaq to start her own business. And in 1996 she started selling office supplies from her home. A little while after, she decided to dedicate herself to expand her business and opened her own store near her house.

Due to the large demand for her typical office supplies, she wishes to increase number of items she sells. All this would allow her to generate a larger economic income for her family with the aim to elevate their quality of life and education. In order to carry this out, she is proposing to solicit a loan that will be invested in purchasing more supplies for her store.

loans.use: purchase more supplies for her store

loans.name: Sanamhol

texts.ru: Санамхол Худойкулова проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 44 года. Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Муж находится на заработках в России. Сама же клиентка занимается сельским хозяйством. она выращивает арбуз и рис. Кредит просит для сбора урожая и повторного посева. На полученную прибыль хочет отремонтировать дом и женить сына.
texts.en:
Sanamhol H. lives in the Shahrituz district. She is 44 years old, married and has 6 children. Her husband works in Russia. Our client is involved in agriculture. She grows watermelons and rice. Sanamhol is requesting a loan for harvesting and new sowing. She wants to use resulting profits to repair her house and marry off her son.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Harvesting and new sowing

loans.name: Violeta Lucas

texts.pt:
Violeta nasceu em Inhambane tem 48 anos de idade, estudou ate a 12ª classe não tem filhos. (nunca teve filhos) Responsabiliza se pela sua mãe e seu sobrinho que vive em Inhambane enviando lhes em cada três mêses uma sexta básica no valor de 1.000.00MT.

Violeta quando frequentava a 4ª classe teve oportunidade de ir à Alemanha (antiga RDA) graças à bolsa de estudos que conseguiu na sua Escola, onde fez uma formação profissional de datilografia.
 Apos a unificação das duas alemanhas, ela volta a sua terra natal Moçambique concretamente em Inhambane. Mas mais tarde, devido à falta de emprego, sai de Inhambane para o Município da Vila de Namaacha com sua tia. Esta consegue lhe arranjar um emprego na Escola Secundária da Namaacha como dactilógrafa onde trabalha a mais de 16 anos das 7:30 as 15:30h auferindo um valor mensal de 2.960.84MT e vive num quarto no internato da mesma escola.

O salário que recebe não satisfaz as suas necessidades porque está a construir a sua própria casa com o fundo solicitado no BIM (Banco comercial que opera na vila de Namaacha) no valor de 20.000.00MT. não conseguiu concluir devido ao elevado custo do material e aproxima se a Hluvuku e Kiva solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 8.000.00MT para dar continuidade da sua obra comprando material de construção.

Este e o segundo empréstimo de Violeta na Hluvuku e primeiro com Kiva. O primeiro de 5.000,00MT foi usados para compra de material para a sua obra e com o presente credito de 8.000.00MT será usados também para comprar material de construção para dar continuidade da sua obra. Está muito ansiosa em viver na sua própria casa. Confiante que vai pagar sem problemas e pedir um novo empréstimo para fazer manutenção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Violeta was born in Inhambane. She is 48 years old and attended school through the 12th grade. She doesn't have any children. She takes care of her mother and her nephew, who live in Inhambane. She sends them 1000 meticals every three months. Violeta had the opportunity to go to Germany (the former GDR) when she was in 4th grade thanks to a scholarship she received from her school, where she trained to become a typist. After the reunification of the two Germanies, she returned to Mozambique, specifically to Inhambane. But later, because of the lack of jobs, she left Inhambane with her aunt and went to the town of Namaacha. Her aunt got her a job as a typist in the high school in Namaacha, where she's worked more than 16 years from 7:30 to 15:30, earning 2960.84 meticals a month. She lives in a room in the dormitories there. Her salary is not enough to meet her needs because she is building her own house with funding requested from BIM, a commercial bank that operates in Namaacha, in the amount of 20,000 meticals. She couldn't finish it because of the high cost of materials, and approached Hluvuku and Kiva requesting a loan of 8000 meticals to continue the work, buying building supplies. This is Violeta's second loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. The first loan of 5000 meticals was used to buy building supplies, as will the current 8000-metical loan so she can finish her house. She is eager to live in her own home. She is confident that she will have no trouble paying off the loan and be able to request a new loan to do upkeep on the house.

Translated from Portuguese by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Rodolfo tiene 29 años, vive con su pareja y madre de su hija de 6 añitos, quien ya cursa estudios primarios, por el momento viven en la casa de sus padres. Él es un hombre muy trabajador que se dedica, a tiempo completo, al transporte de pasajeros desde hace 10 años y gracias a su esfuerzo en la actualidad es propietario de tres motocarros. La encargada de recibir y administrar las ganancias de este negocio es su esposa, pues él admite que ella lo hace mucho mejor que él. Para el manejo de 2 motocarros contratan a dos choferes y el otro lo conduce Rodolfo. Sin embargo, es tan grande su anhelo de seguir progresando, que en sus ratos libres aplica su arte manual confeccionando collares, pulseras, aretes y aros a base de materiales oriundos de una zona indígena de su región (selva peruana) y lo beneficioso es que vive en una zona turística, por lo que sus artículos tienen muy buena acogida, pues los vende de forma ambulante. Rodolfo se preocupa en ser una persona activa y sana para seguir adelante con sus labores y está muy contento con lo que hasta ahora ha conseguido en beneficio de su familia. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y desde su primer contacto con su banco comunal, está muy contento de trabajar junto a personas solidarias y muy responsables. Con el dinero que viene solicitando mandará a reparar y hacer mantenimiento mecánico a sus motocarros.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is a 29-year-old man who lives with his wife, his mother, and their 6-year-old daughter who is in elementary school. For the time being, they live in their parents’ home. He is a very hard-working man who has been providing public transportation services full-time for 10 years. Thanks to his efforts, he now owns three motorcycle taxis. His wife is the one who is in charge of handling the business finances because he admits that she is much better at it than he is. Rodolfo drives one of the motorcycle taxis, while he hired two other drivers to drive the other taxis. However, his wish to keep making progress is so big that he also utilizes his artistic skills in his free time by making necklaces, earrings, hoops, and bracelets out of local material in the indigenous zone (the Peruvian jungle). He has an advantage because he lives in a tourist section, which means that his jewelry sells well because he is a street vendor. Rodolfo is concerned with being an active and healthy person so that he can continue with his work. He is very pleased with what he has managed up to now for the benefit of his family. This is the first time that he requests a loan with MFP. Ever since he first got in touch with his microfinance institute, he has been happy to work with people who are united and responsible. With this loan that he is requesting, he will have his motorcycle taxis repaired and maintained.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair motorcycle taxis

loans.name: Muhaiyo

texts.en:
A. Muhaiyo is 41 years old. She is married with two children. With the purpose to help her husband in supporting the family, Muhaiyo is running her own business. She is selling jewelry. Muhaiyo has been in this business for more than 16 years. Initially she started with the working capital in the amount of $1,000 US. Currently the turnover capital increased.

Today Muhaiyo requests $2,700 US to purchase new items of jewelry like earrings, rings, bracelets, and chains in order to enlarge the range of goods for selling. This is the eleventh loan for Muhaiyo and she promises to observe all the procedures concerning the payment of the loan as she used to do with previous loans. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new items of jewelry to enlarge the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Otila

texts.en:
Otila F. is a 29 year-old woman living in the town of Tufulele. She is married and has four school-aged children. Otila's main source of income is a general store that she owns and operates. She has been running this business for over five years and earns approximately $1250 WST a month.

In 2005, Otila joined SPBD to access their financial services with the goal of improving her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Otila has successfully repaid a previous SPBD loan in the amount of $2250 WST. She used that loan to expand her business. Otila is now requesting a new loan of $3000 WST, which she will use to purchase additional inventory and to have working capital on hand. This loan will be Otila's fifth from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to have working capital on hand.

loans.name: Uldarico

texts.en:
Uldarico J. T. is a 45-year-old married man from the village of Bliss, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur, in the Philippines. He has 4 school-age children. To earn a living, Uldarico owns and operates a business venture in the food sector. Specifically, he runs a "carenderia" -- i.e., a mini restaurant. At the carenderia, his income is primarily derived from serving a variety of different meals to customers from his local community. Uldarico has been engaged in this business for over 2 years, and he earns approximately 5,500 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2008, Uldarico joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services and to thereby help improve his living situation as well as his ability to engage in business activities. Notably, Uldarico has already successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC in the amount of 20,000 PHP, which was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Uldarico is now requesting a new loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP ($450), which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the mini restaurant. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Uldarico from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated as a result of this loan to improve and expand his business and to pay for his children's school tuition.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices, covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is mostly comprised of farmers, fishermen, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase food and drinks for his restaurant

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn M. is 21 years old and lives in the rural place of Barangay General Balao Solana, Cagayan. She is married to Victor M., age 25, who is a local farmer in their community. They are blessed with a child named Vhie Jhay who is three years old.

Jonalyn raises hogs to earn good profits. She sells her pigs to the slaughterhouse every three months when they are big enough to be sold. Jonalyn is a responsible mother and neighbor and she wants to increase her income through her business. Jonalyn is applying for a loan of PHP 5,000 from the KIVA lenders to buy more piglets for her small piggery. The loan will help to improve their family finances.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Mustafokul

texts.en:
T. Mustafokul is 51 years old, married and has two children. Mustafokul was born and raised in Shahristan, Tajikistan, where he has grown up cultivating wheat and different kinds of vegetables. He has worked for agriculture for 20 years and gained much experience. His family helps Mustafokul with his business.

Mustafokul hopes to invest a loan of 8500 TJS in buying seeds and fertilizer for the upcoming planting season of wheat. Mustafokul feels that with the loan he can earn more to make his dreams come true. With your collaboration he’ll be able to improve his living conditions.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
44 year-old Jocelyn J. lives in the village of Brgy Batang, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. Her husband, Larry, is a fisherman and they are blessed with 4 children who are between 18 and 24 years old. Her dream is for her children to earn their college degrees and get a good job, so that they can enjoy a comfortable life.

To help her husband achieve this dream, she sold her husband's daily fish catch either within their community or in the nearby villages. Her hard work and perseverance bore fruit so that she needed new capital just to maintain her sales volume. This inspired her to join NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1991 so that she could continuously access new capital for her business.

With new capital, she was able to expand the product lines in her general store; her business activities have been a big help in supporting all of the needs of their family, slowly improving their living conditions. As her business improved, she also engaged in food vending, which she put up in front of her general store. Now she earns about PHP 19,200 per month, which she adds to her revolving working capital and she saves most of her income for the education of her children.

Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 contributed a lot in developing her business and even her performance in NWTF-PD, maintaining her good credit record. The said amount was fully paid on-time without any delay. As Center Chief, her good credit performance makes her a good example to her members. Now in her 19th cycle, she is borrowing the same amount of PHP 19,500 to be used to obtain additional capital for her general store and for the repair of her pumpboat.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To obtain additional working capital for her general store.

loans.name: Bertha Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Bertha Lucia N. es madre soltera de 2 niños y vive con su madre la cual la apoya moral y económicamente.
La señora es un cliente distinguida de nuestra Institución la cual anteriormente solicito un crédito para empezar la construcción de un cuarto en su hogar para mayor comodidad, y ahora es para terminar la construcción del cuarto para ampliarse y brindarle mayor espacio a su familia.
texts.en:
Bertha Lucia N. is a single mother of two children; she lives with her mother, who supports her emotionally and economically. She is a distinguished client of our Institution, who was granted a previous loan to start construction of an additional room in her house, for more comfort. Now, the requested funding is to complete the construction; to enlarge it so that the family can have more living space.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete a room addition.

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es: El Sr. Benedicto tiene su salón de billar en la zona de Pampahasi, se dedica ya siete años a esta actividad, su esposa tiene su restaurant en Villa Salome donde el Sr. benedicto le ayuda por las mañanas, y por las tardes atiende el salón, tiene una pequeña hijita que tiene un año, ambos se apoyan para los gastos de la casa y tiene muchos proyectos para el futuro, uno de ellos es abrir un restaurant en la Plaza Ergueta ya que con esta actividad les va muy bien. El crédito será invertido en la compra de una mesa de billar que le están ofreciendo a menor precio.
texts.en:
Benedicto has a pool hall in the Pampaza area. He has had this business for seven years. His wife has a restaurant in Villa Salome. Benedicto helps her in the mornings, and in the afternoons he works in his pool hall. He has a small, one year old daughter. Both he and his wife help with the household expenses. He has many projects for the future. One of them is to open a restaurant in the Plaza Ergueta because this type of work is going very well for them. The loan is to buy a pool table that is being offered at a lower price.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a pool table

loans.name: Kanikan's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Kanikan C. is 38 years old and she is the village bank president for a group of 24 people in Prey Prasat Village, Kandal Province. All of the group members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Kanikan C. earns her living as a grocer. Since her business is making less income, she wants to expand it, and so she is applying for a loan to buy more groceries to re-sell. Her husband, Mr. Sandarp P., is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Kanikan C. is the mother of five children. One of them is employed in the garment factory, another is too young to stuD. or work, and the others are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to re-sell.

loans.name: Mich

texts.en: Mrs. Mich L. is 52 years old and lives in Spueu village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Phorn Phann, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare field to grow plants and rice. In order to support their crop, Mrs. Mich L. is applying for a loan of 1,300,000 Riel from AMK to buy fertilizer. Mr. Phorn Phann is also a construction worker who earns a small salary to support the family. Mrs. Mich L. is the mother of five children. Two of her children work in the garment factory, one is a farmer who helps with the farming business, and the other two are students in the local public school. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her crops.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom C. is currently in the business of selling cooked food in the hotel and is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell.  Tom is 35 years old and a widow with two children who go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more foodstuffs to be cooked and sell.

loans.name: Jussely

texts.es:
Jussely tiene 25 años, es una joven madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Roger de 27 años y su hija de 5 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos.

La actividad a la que se dedica es el cultivo de choclos, papas, alverjas, etc, en las chacras que heredó de sus padres. Ella trabaja todos los días arduamente, para que al llegar la temporada de cosechar sus productos sean grandes y pueda venderlos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene en el desempeño de su labor, ya que ella decide qué es lo mejor para sus cultivos. Lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que la mayoría de veces le es muy difícil conseguir un carro que quiera llevarla. Para más adelante, espera tener un puesto en el mercado, ya que está segura que así mejorar sus ingresos económicos.

Este es el sétimo préstamo de Jussely con MFP y sabe que tiene que ser puntual en sus pagos, como la ha sido en sus anteriores créditos. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y está muy comprometida con el desarrollo de sus compañeros. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará semilla de alverja, ya que este producto está teniendo bastante demanda en el mercado.
texts.en:
Jussely is 25 years old and a very hard-working young mother of a family. She lives in her own house with her husband Roger, who is 27, and her daughter, who is 5. They are the motive for all her efforts. The activity she dedicates herself to is cultivation of corn, potatoes, peas, etc., on the farms she inherited from her parents. She works arduously every day so that when harvest season comes, her products will be mature and she can sell them in the wholesale market at Tarma. What she likes best about her work is the freedom she has in carrying out her labor, since she decides what is best for her crops. Jussely has been doing this for 8 years and the task she considers most difficult is transporting her products to market. Most of the time, it is very difficult to find a cart driver that is willing to do it. In the future, she hopes to have a post in the market. She is sure that this will improve her economic income. This is Jussely's 7th loan with MFP and she knows that she has to be punctual in her payments, as she was with her previous loans. In her communal bank she is known for her solidarity and she's very committed to her companions' development. With the 700 New Sols requested she will buy pea seeds, since this product is experiencing plenty of market demand.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PEA SEEDS TO SOW

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy bags of charcoal and corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more palm oil and ground-nut oil to sell.

loans.name: Lakot

texts.en:
Lakot C. sells foodstuffs like rice, beans and bread in her restaurant. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice and beans to cook and sell in the restaurant. Lakot is 43 years old and is widowed. She has 6 children who do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice and beans to cook and sell in her restaurant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba M. operates a provisions shop where she sells almost anything customers request at Abura.  Araba has attained senior high level in education.  She is married and has five children. Her husband is a secretary of a company. 

Araba has been selling provisions for quite some time now. She provides a helping hand to her husband by clothing her children. Her loan will be used to buy other goods customers are asking for such as groceries and stationery. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to establish another shop.

loans.use: buy other goods such as groceries and stationery

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more food for resale

loans.name: Lila

texts.en:
Lila G. is from the village of Catohugan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 32 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $50 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Lila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI.
