She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Senia Patricia

texts.es:
Senia tiene 38 años D. edad, ResiD. en la Ciudad D. Usulután, es casada, vive con el esposo y dos hijas D. 15 y 14 años D. edad, tiene un negocio D. venta D. lácteos.
El negocio lo inicio hace 14 años por iniciativa propia, tiene una empleada y la hijas le colaboran atendiendo el negocio, su horario es D. 6:00am-6:00pm es una persona con experiencia en el negocio, ella solicita un préstamo para compra D. productos, queso, crema, cuajada, quesillo, esto contribuirá a cumplir con las expectativas D. los clientes. 
Las aspiraciones son tener un local propio y amplio, mejora las condiciones D. vida D. la familia.
texts.en:
Senia is 38 years of age, is married, and lives in Usulután city. She lives with her husband and 2 daughters (15 and 14) and has a dairy sale business. Senia began her business 14 years ago on her own initiative. She has one employee and her daughters help her in the shop, which is open from 6am to pm. Senia is experienced at this business and is seeking a loan to purchase products such as cheese, cream, curd, sot cheese to assist in meeting her customers' expectations. Her aspirations are to have her own expanded premises and to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheese, cream, curd and soft cheese

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria Magdalena A. A., tiene 37 años.  Es soltera y vive con los hijos,  vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 5 hijos, Estefani (1), Maribel (20), Mayra (16), Angi (12) y Jose (22).

Maria  es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz y maíz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en la ciudad de Ventanas y las vende en la misma localidad a precios muy convenientes.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra semillas de  arroz y maíz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños comprar una casa y ponerse un negocio en la ciudad de Ventanas. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades.

Le gusta vender productos AVON y YAMBAL y le gusta observar como hacen deporte las personas de la localidad donde vive.
texts.en:
Maria Magdalena A. A. is 37 years old. She is single and lives with her children. She lives in Ventanas, in Los Ríos province. She has 5 children, Estefani (1), Maribel (20), Mayra (16), Angi (12) and Jose (22). Maria is a member of the “Valle Alto” ["High Valley"] rural solidarity group, which is located in the neighborhood of Voluntad de Dios, an hour and a half from Ventanas. There are 23 members in all, most of whom work in agriculture. This is their second loan with the San José Cooperative. Maria works in agriculture, growing rice and corn. She makes her purchases every month in the town of Ventanas, and she sells her products in the same place at very favorable prices. She is requesting the loan to invest in buying seeds for rice and corn. She thinks that the loan is an opportunity to get ahead. Her dreams are to buy a house and set up a business in the town of Ventanas. Some of the challenges she confronts are plant pests and diseases. She likes to sell AVON and YAMBAL products, and she likes to watch the people in her neighborhood playing sports.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying rice and corn seeds

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria A. is from the village of Calamagui 1st, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 52 years old, married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used again to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Gloria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alissone

texts.pt:
Alissone M. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, pai de 5 filhos de idades entre 9 a 19 anos de idade, todos vão a Escola. Fez somente 6ª classe não continuou devido a guerra de desestabilização. Vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém para além dos filhos.

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, trabalha numa instituição que também funciona como orfanato é tratorista ha mais de 20 anos na empresa e tem um salario de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum em sua casa.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas que também são clientes da instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (carne, cerveja, refrescos, vinho, água e outros) para iniciar um actividade comercial para a sua esposa.
 
No futuro gostaria de pedir um novo empréstimo para aumentar e diversificar ainda mais a minha mercadoria para satisfazer a demanda da clientela.
texts.en:
Alissone M. was born in the Boane district, in the Maputo province, which is in the south of Mozambique. He is the father of 5 children, who are between 9 and 19 years old, all of whom attend school. He attended through 6th grade himself but did not continue his studies because of a destabilizing war. He lives in his own home and doesn't support anyone else beside his children.

He has never left his native land. He works for an orphanage where he drives a tractor, which he has done for more than 20 years. He has a monthly salary of 4,000MT, which he uses to pay for his household expenses and he saves some as well.

He has never taken loans from other banks. He came to know Hluvuku through some colleagues who are also clients of the institution. This is his first loan, for the amount of 15,000MT, which he will use to purchase products like meat, beer, snacks, wine, water, etc. to launch a business with his wife.

In the future, he would like to seek a new loan to increase and diversify his merchandise even more to satisfy the demand of his clients.

Translated from Portuguese by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products (meat, beer, snacks, wine, water, etc.)

loans.name: Rafaela Del Socorro

texts.es: Rafaela Del Socorro tiene 56 años, ella es una mujer que no se deja abatir por las consecuencias. Ella tiene 1 hijo menor de edad, que está a su cargo. Ella se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, todos los días sale a comprar sus productos como perfumes, cremas, tratamientos, sabanas, toallas. Ella busca la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, pues sale todos los días a recorrer las diferentes calles en donde obtiene muchos clientes que le solicitan diferentes productos. Este crédito lo solicita para la compra de materia prima necesaria para su negocio.
texts.en:
Rafaela Del Socorro, 56, is a woman who refuses to be crushed by adversity. She has a young son in her care. She sells general merchandise. Every day she goes out to buy products such as perfumes, creams, treatments, sheets and towels. She is looking at ways to boost her income, and by being out and about every day she obtains many customers who order different products. She requests the loan to buy raw materials needed for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Mrs. Lim A. lives in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She is married with one school-aged kid. Her husband helps take care of their family by working as a company security guard. 

Mrs. Lim A. always buys small pieces of clothing in bulk at the lowest price from garment factories and weaves it by her hand into furniture to sell. Her finished products are cradles and floor mats, which she then sells to her regular customers. 

Mrs. Lim A. is concerned that she goes to sell her items by taxi or walks because she doesn’t have her own vehicle for traveling. Mrs. Lim A. has planned to buy a vehicle many times but she never had sufficient money to buy one. Therefore, Mrs. Lim A. would like to take a loan to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for her transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motorcycle for transportation

loans.name: Mirtha Emelania

texts.es:
Mirtha Emelania T. P. tiene 49 anos. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Mirtha es socia de la ventanilla rural El Placer de Ser Amigos, que está ubicada a 20 minutos de la parroquia San Jose del Tambo. Son 15 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican al cultivo de cacao o tienen sus propios pequeños negocios.  

Mirtha se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra arroz y maíz en un terreno arriendado. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos aquí en la provincia. Todavía no se ha vendido su maíz este ano. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar los líquidos y seguir cultivando el arroz y maíz. También le gustaría comprar y criar unos pollos. Con el apoyo del préstamo, podría mejorar sus cultivos y ayudar a su familia. Su sueno para los próximo 5 anos es que sus hijo siga estudiando- ya esta en sexto grado. Dice que todo este bien con sus cultivos, pero un familiar recién tenía una operación pero se fue bien. 

Trabaja en la agricultura todos los días, pero a veces sale los fines de semana.
texts.en:
Mirtha Emelania T. P. is 49 years old and lives in the canton of Chillanes in the Bolívar province with her common-law husband. She has three children.

Mirtha is a member of the El Placer de Ser Amigos communal bank, which is located 20 minutes from the parish of San José del Tambo. There are 15 members in total, the majority of which work growing cacao or have their own small businesses.

Mirtha works in agriculture, growing rice and corn on a piece of rented land. She makes the purchases and sales of her products in the province. She has still not sold her corn this year.

She is requesting the loan to buy liquids and to continue growing rice and corn. She would also like to buy and raise some chickens. With the help of the loan, she will be able to improve her crops and help her family. Her dream for the next five years is for her children to continue in school – one is already in 6th grade. She says that all is well with her crops and a relative recently had an operation, but it went well.

She works in farming everyday but she sometimes goes out on weekends.

loans.use: To buy liquids for farming and continue growing rice and corn.

loans.name: Leonilyn

texts.en:
Leonilyn C. is from the village of Kinangay Norte Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 22 years old. Leonilyn is single. To make a living, Leonilyn owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating a motor transport service. Leonilyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leonilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonilyn is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Leonilyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her  family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Jaime; el tiene 22 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; el socio tiene un negocio de compra y venta de carne el compra a menor precio para luego revenderlo y distribuirlo a la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado, a la vez el socio es obrero de construcción pero por ahora esta mas dedicado al negocio de la carne.

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de más carne para su pequeño negocio.   

El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Jaime belongs to the “Sumac Puririsun” community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Jaime is 22 years old and lives with his partner.  He has one child.  Jaime has a business buying and selling meat.  He buys it at a lower price to later re-sell it and distribute it in the city of Puerto Maldonado.  He also works as a construction worker but right now is more engaged in his meat business.

He is requesting this loan to buy more meat for his small business.

He is grateful to those who are taking part in his dream by funding his loan and he pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy more meat for his small business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing poultry and a water tank

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 57 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el sector Saltur del distrito D. Zaña, una zona agrícola situada aproximadamente a media hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en la crianza y venta D. animales desD. hace cinco años. Ella cría animales menores en algunos corrales ambientados cerca a su domicilio. Los alimenta D. granos y pastos naturales y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donD. resiD.. Esta actividad le permite ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. la economía D. su familia.

Alejandrina desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para lograr que sus ventas aumenten y así obtener mayores ingresos. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is 57 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and three children in Saltur sector of  Zaña district, an agricultural area located approximately half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Alejandrina has been raising and selling animals for five years.  She raises young animals in some pens that she has near her home.  She feeds them grains and natural fodder and when they have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to the traders who usually visit her area.  This business allows her to help her husband to financially support their family.

Alejandrina would like to acquire more animals and balanced feed in order to increase her sales and make more profits.  To achieve her goal, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To acquire more animals and balanced feed in order to increase her sales

loans.name: Teresita De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresita de Jesús E. García, es originaria de  Coapilla Estado de Chipas México, es casada  y tiene cuatro hijos a  su responsabilidad y son: Víctor Manuel de diecinueve años,  el otro es Lázaro de  diecisiete años, Mariza del Rosario de quince y el más pequeño es Luis Antonio.
        Esta vez que solicitó el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de productos por catálogos de las marcas "AVON y Fuller", ésta es una actividad que ella quiere empezar, ya que una amiga la invitó a vender éstos productos pues con ello tendrá buenos ingresos.
        Ella decidío empezar una actividad económica para poderle ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ya que en ocasiones no es suficiente con el dinero que le da su esposo, nos comenta: "Necesito una actividad que me permita obtener ingresos pero sin descuidar a mis hijos, ya que ahora son adolescentes y ésta es la etapa más dificil, una mamá debe de estar muy cerca de sus hijos adolescentes para que los guíe, no puedes descuidarlos".
        De lo que vaya obteniendo de su primera venta lo estará  ahorrando para que con ello mismo siga trabajando su actividad de venta de catalogo.
texts.en:
Teresita de Jesús E. García is from Coapilla in the state of Chiapas, Mexico.  She is married, and she has four children under her care.  Víctor Manuel is 19 years old, Lázaro is 17 years old, Mariza del Rosario is 15 years old, and the youngest is Luis Antonio.

She requested a loan this time to buy Avon and Fuller brand products by catalog.  This is a business activity that she wants to start.  A friend invited her to sell these products because she will have good earnings.  She decided to start this business activity in order to be able to help her husband with the household expenses.  

Sometimes her husband does not have enough money to cover expenses.  She says, “I need an activity that will allow me to get income without neglecting my children.  Now that that they are adolescents and in the most difficult phase, a mother should be very close to her adolescent children in order to guide them.  You cannot neglect them.”

She will be saving what she gets from her first sale in order to continue working and selling by catalog.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics like perfume, lipstick, deodorant, and others

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita P. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 44 years old. Benita is married. To make a living, Benita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Benita currently earns 4000 PHP from rice farming. She hopes to improve her income.

Benita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Benita is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a 60-year-old widow who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000. Loreta is borrowing PHP 13,000 in order to purchase more inventory to sell. This will be her 8th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Loreta hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team at Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: additional working capital

loans.name: Mary Isabel

texts.es:
La Sra. Mary Isabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Solidarias II”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 40 años y es madre de 01 hijo, que aun dependen de ella. 

Lleva mucho tiempo  dedicándose a la Venta de Joyas, bañadas en oro y plata.  Se inicio con un capital de 500 Nuevos Soles y poco a poco, fue comprando e implementando más su negocio. Gracias al Movimiento Manuela Ramos y a su empeño de salir adelante, ya es muy conocida por sus clientes, se encuentra ubicada en su misma, pero por las tardes ella visita a sus amistades para ofrecer sus productos. Se dedica también a la venta de cosméticos de la línea Esika, nos cuenta que sus ventas y pedidos diarios, son muy buenos. En la actualidad continua con los dos negocios y le va muy bien.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará Joyas, bañadas en oro y plata como: aretes, collares, pulseras, anillos, en diferentes modelos y dibujos. También invertirá comprando cosméticos, para aumentar su stock como: Colonias, perfumes, talcos, desodorantes y cremas, tanto para damas y caballeros. Es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante para el bienestar de su familia y de ella misma. 

Mary Isabel, manifiesta su más gentil agradecimiento al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como empresaria y Mujer y apoyar a otras mujeres que también quieren salir adelante.
texts.en: Mary Isabel belongs to the "Las Solidarias II" community bank in the district of Tarapoto, province and department of San Martin. She's 40 years old, married and has one son, who is still a dependent. For a long time she has made a living selling jewelery coated in gold and silver. She started with 500 Nuevos Soles of capital and little by little she started buying items and better implementing her business. Thanks to Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos and Mary Isabel's desire to make headway, she is now well known among her customers. She runs her business out of her home, but in the afternoons she visits friends to offer her products. She also makes a living selling Esika-brand cosmetics and tells us that her daily sales and orders are very good. Currently she is continuing on with both businesses and it is going very well. With this loan of 1,200 Nuevos Soles, she plans to purchase more gold and silver jewelry such as earrings, necklaces, bracelets and rings in different models and designs. She will also invest in the purchase of cosmetics for men and women, such as colognes, perfumes, powders, deodorants and creams, to increase her stock. Mary Isabel is a woman with a strong desire to make headway for her family's well-being and her own. She expresses her greatest appreciation to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a businesswoman and a woman, and supporting other women who also want to make headway.

loans.use: Purchase gold and silver jewelry, and cosmetics

loans.name: Sagia

texts.en:
Sagia is currently in the business of selling alcohol. She is 26 years old, married to a soldier, with two children. Neither of them goes to school. Sagia took out a loan to stock more alcohol to sell.

In the future, Sagia hopes to buy land with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: stock more alcohol to sell

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Djantoyerela, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Warassala, sous préfecture de Fana, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de savons, de bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois.                                                                                                                             
Les femmes du groupe Djantoyerela sont à leur seizième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments, des savons, des bois de chauffe et des  sacs de charbon de bois.                                                                         
SITAN D. compte acheter des condiments au marché de Fana auprès des grossistes de la place. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement, à la maison et au marché de Fana, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 45.000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en:
The women of the group Djantoyerela are all married and average 42 years of age and four children all living in traditional extended families in the village of Warassala, subprefecture of Fana, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. And they do commerce in condiments, soaps, firewood, and charcoal.

The women of the group Djantoyerela are on their 16th solidarity loan, which will be used for buying condiments, soaps, firewood, and sacks of charcoal.

Ms. SITAN D. plans on buying some condiments at the Fana market from local wholesalers. Accepting cash or credit, she makes her sales each day at the house and at the Fana market. Her customer base is composed essentially of women

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA that will be used to make the loan payments and to cover the cost of helping with societal events. The rest of it will be reinvested in her business selling condiments.

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia N. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Sylvia has a beauty salon, which she has had for four years.         

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more oil and braids for the hair for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sylvia hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself.  In the future, Sylvia hopes to become a doctor after completing her studies.   

Sylvia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by being able to learn how to read and write.

loans.use: to purchase more oil and braids for the hair for resale.

loans.name: Benrogers

texts.en: Benrogers is 35 years old and married with two children.  He runs a retail shop so as to earn a living.  In addition, he is a water vendor.  Over the six years he has been running his business, he has witnessed an upward growth since he joined Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future.  He has requested 40,000 Kes to buy sugar, salt, maize flour, and sodas.

loans.use: To buy sugar, salt, maize flour, and sodas.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna M. is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an RTW (Ready-To-Wear) clothing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy more stock for her business.

Edna has been in this business for three years. Edna earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “AMANECER ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosario; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de animales como chanchos y ganados y lo vende en las distintas ferias que se realiza en el distrito de Anta y la provincia de Urubamba ,la socia también se dedica a la agricultura, ella tiene terrenos de cultivo donde siembra maíz, papa y haba y también lo vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de animales y la agricultura. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chanchos y fertilizantes para la tierra de cultivo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank called “AMANECER ANTEÑA.”  The bank is located in Anta District, which belongs to Anta Province and Cusco Department.

The member is Sra. Rosario.  She is 39 years old, married and has 3 children.  She divides her time between regular daily activities and her animal sales business.  She sells pigs and livestock in the different markets and fairs in Anta District and Urubamba Province.  This member also earns a living in agriculture.  She has farm land on which she grows corn, potatoes and beans.  She sells these products on the street.  Sra. Rosario wants to expand her businesses selliing animals and produce.  She is requesting the loan in order to purchase pigs and fertilizer for her farmland.

The member is happy to have the loan and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and fertilizer for her farm land.

loans.name: Susana Zoila

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac; en la provincia de Cusco,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia  Susana,  tiene 58 años de edad y La socia es casada; La socia  tiene 3 hijos, de 33, 29, 26 de edad;  La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la administración y atención personal de su tienda de abarrotes, la socia suele cada 4 meses comprar diversos productos como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, aceite. y ahora ella desea implementar su tienda de abarrotes con la compra de productos de primera (leche, arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite). 
 
La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Susana, 58, is a member of the “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS” (Let’s Walk Together) communal bank.  She lives in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.

She is married and has three children who are 33, 29 and 26 years of age.  She alternates her daily chores with running and tending to her grocery store.  She wants to stock the store and be able to buy basic need items like: rice, sugar, noodles, milk and oil. 

She values and is infinitely grateful for the loan she’ll be granted which will allow her to improve her quality of life.  Similarly, she commits to repay her loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to stock her grocery store with rice, sugar, noodles, milk, and oil

loans.name: Margaret Njeri

texts.en:
Margaret is a 56 year-old widow. She has been growing pineapples for a period of 10 years with an income of about 13,000 KES. a month.

This is her fourth loan with KADET LTD, after successfully repaying the previous loans. She hopes to own a bigger pineapple plantation to have more supply to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy farm fertilizer.

loans.name: Sinakahle Group

texts.en:
Zimiphi is 45 years old and single with 5 children between the ages of 14 and 27. 3 of her children attend school. She runs an agricultural business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni in South Africa. In the photo, she is pictured raising her hand.

She has been in this business for 4 years, selling fermented milk and plants that she grows. Zimiphi requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy fermented milk and seeds. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her life by sending her children to school. Zimiphi faces a lot of customers who take her stock on credit and fail to pay on time. In future, she would like to see her business grow and end up having a shelter for her business.

loans.use: to buy fermented milk and seeds

loans.name: Ath

texts.en:
Ath is a 51-year-old domestic rice farmer in the Kompong Spue Province. She has many years of experience in this sector and is earning around $2.50 in profit a day. She can use her existing fertile farm at least twice a year, rainy season and dry season. She has a life partner with her husband who generates some income by working as a Khmer teacher in the community where he has a specific salary every month. 

As her house is getting old, it is not safe for Ath and her family to live in, so she is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 to repair their old house. She has five children, three of whom are married and are working in a factory. They always distribute some of their income to Ath to use for daily expenses.

loans.use: to repair their old house.

loans.name: Mbega

texts.en:
Mbega is a divorced man with two children, one girl and one boy. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, he has operated a matatu (motor vehicle) business. His potential customers are passengers. His major challenges are the high costs of fuel and competition from other motor vehicle operators. He dreams of establishing a business selling second hand clothes.

With the KSHS 20,000, he wants to establish a second hand clothes business and purchase bundles of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To establish a second hand clothes business and purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Ablavi est une femme âgée de 38ans .Elle est mariée à un chauffeur .Elle est mère de trois enfants.
Ablavi est revendeuse depuis 2001,Ablavi travaille comme revendeuse d’insecticide  et de charbon de bois et s’approvisionne dans son commerce au Grand marché de Lomé puis à Anié.
Ablavi a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon de bois et des insecticides.
texts.en:
Ablavi is 38 years old, married to a chauffeur and the mother of three children. Since 2001, she has been working as a retailer of insecticide and charcoal. She obtains her supplies at the Grand Market of Lomé and in Anié. 

Ablavi has requested a second loan from WAGES in order to buy charcoal and insecticide.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Cliber

texts.es: Cliber, de 39 años, es un hombre soltero y trabajador que vive en compañía de su mamá Clara y su padre Magno; a quien protege y cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). Como técnico Agropecuario, él tiene muchos proyectos, su mayor deseo es mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos, con miras a la exportación, pues su especialidad son proyectos productivos. Eso lo demuestra en sus cultivos de café, donde aplica todos sus conocimientos. Cuenta que, para renovar y mejorar sus plantaciones, necesita un promedio de 8 mil nuevos soles. A él le falta poco para conseguir granos parejos y de buena calidad. Por ello en cada cosecha vende su grano a la cooperativa de Alto Palomar, donde es asociado y está en busca del mejor grano. Asimismo siembra plátanos como un producto alternativo, asegurando así su economía; cada 15 días recoge los frutos maduros para comercializarlos. Ya tiene 20 años dedicándose a esto, pero según menciona antes no tenia el conocimiento que ahora posee, por ello está seguro que logrará su objetivo, como también; el de comprar más terrenos cultivables. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Prestatarios de la unión palomar” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para lograr sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con las cuotas. Cliber de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales, para distribuirlos en sus cultivos y viveros de café que piensa realizar dentro de algunos meses.
texts.en: Cliber is 39 years old. He is a single, hardworking man who lives with his mother Clara and father Magno. He protects and takes care of them in his own house located in the community of Unión Palomar (central Peruvian jungle). As a farmer, he has a lot of projects. His greatest wish is to improve the quality of his crops with plans for exportation. His specialty is productive projects. He demonstrates this with his coffee crops, where he applies all of his knowledge. He relates that, in order to renew and improve his plantings, he needs an average of 8 thousand nuevos soles. He needs a little more to have even, good quality beans. That is why at every harvest he sells his beans to the cooperative of Alto Palomar where he is a member. He is looking for a better bean. In addition, he is planting plantains as an alternative crop, to ensure his income. Every two weeks he picks the ripe fruit to sell it. He has been doing this for 20 years, but states that before he didn't have the knowledge that he has now. That is why he is sure that he will attain his goal, buying more arable land. He belongs to the “Prestatarios de la Unión Palomar” [Borrowers of Union Palomar] community bank and this is his second loan with MFP. He hopes to have all of your support to attain his goals. He also promises to make his payments on time. If Cliber receives your support, he will invest the money he has asked for in buying various sacks of natural fertilizer to spread on his crops and coffee fields, which he plans on doing in a few months.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Bwamukama Development Group

texts.en:
No room for laziness has been 26-year-old Francis' business precept for 6 years now, as he gives a hardworking account of himself in his electronic sales business in Lugazi.  This assiduous father of 3 has a strong belief in his own worth. His confidence, optimism and self esteem are all sky high.

Francis is happily married. He supplies the deficiencies in his income with more income from his job in one of the country's biggest manufacturing companies. For Francis, owning a business is the way to go. Some of the electronics he sells are top drawer.  Finding his bearings in this business was not an easy feat. At issue, he did not have solid start-up capital.  When he started his business, the competition was also cutthroat.  Francis'  biggest stock in trade was believing he could succeed.  Weekly, his business gross sales income is a total of 120,000 Uganda shillings. 

Francis's group is on its 4th loan cycle now. He intends to use his Kiva loan to purchase more electronics to resell

loans.use: to purchase more electronics to resell

loans.name: Gema Asunción

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a Gema, ella tiene 20 años  de edad, está soltera y estudia el segundo semestre de secretariado ejecutivo en la Universidad Técnica de Manabí. Vive en casa de sus padres.
 
Ella y su papá tienen un puesto en el mercado  de Picoaza en el cual venden todo tipo de mariscos como: pescado enteros o por libras, camarón, conchas, cangrejos, entre otras variedades que son muy consumidos por los clientes, trabajan todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 15h00, sus productos compra se papá todos los días en la madrugada en la ciudad de Manta ya que allá consigue de todo y más barato. Ella lleva dos años pero su papá ya lleva como 15 años en estas actividades.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pescado, camarón, conchas, cangrejos, entre otras variedades de mariscos. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con estos créditos ella puede ganar lo suficiente para sus gastos personales y de estudio. 

Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y llegar a ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
The Mujeres de Lucha [Women of Struggle] Communal Bank meets twice a month in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. This place is known for being a commercial zone and for its traditional Saint Peter and Saint John festivals and for the happiness of its people.

We meet Gema here. She is twenty years old, single, and in her second semester of executive secretarial studies at the Technical University of Manabi. She lives with her parents. She and her father have a position in the Picoaza market where they sell all types of seafood such as fish, whole or by the pound, shrimps, scallops, and crabs and other varieties that people eat. They work every day from 6:00AM until 3:00PM. Her father buys everything early in the morning in the city of Manta as everything is cheaper there. She has been doing this for two years, but her father has about fifteen years of experience. 

This loan is to buy fish, shrimp, scallops, crabs, and other varieties of seafood.

This is her third cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because the money she borrows allows her to earn enough in order to cover personal expenses and to study. Her dream is to complete her studies and become a good professional.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, scallops, crabs, and seafood

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en:
Arcelie is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Arcelie has a retail shop that buys and sells coconuts for copra (dried coconut meat). She has had this business for one year. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy coconuts for copra.
Arcelie is a new member of Kiva partner, HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts for copra.

loans.name: Vilma Ester

texts.es:
Vilma vive en Ciudad del Este, tiene 20 años, ella está estudiando Licenciatura en lengua. Ella tiene 3 hermanos que también están estudiando en la facultad. Comenta que sus padres trabajan en una empresa familiar.
Vilma actualmente trabaja en la universidad donde estudia. Ella tiene muchos deseos de terminar su carrera, para poder trabajar en su profesión y de esa forma poder ayudarse a si misma y a su familia.
Ella solicita el préstamo para un gastos de materiales para poder culminar sus estudios. Vilma agradece a la Fundación ya que le ayudará en su estudio.
texts.en: Vilma, 20, lives in Ciudad del Este.  She’s studying towards a  Bachelor’s in Language.  She has three siblings who are also enrolled in the university.  She comments that her parents work in a family business.  Vilma currently works at the university where she attends classes.  She very much wants to finish her coursework to be able to work in her profession and thus help herself and her family.  She is asking for the loan to cover some educational expenses and be able to complete her studies.  Vilma is grateful to the Fundación because it will help her with her studies.

loans.use: to buy educational materials.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Teofila; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de ganados,ella sigue vnediendo carne poero tambien se dedica al negocio de venta de ganados que lo realiza en las distintas ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta,ella sigue sacando adelante a sus hijos por medio de estos negocios,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar los negocios de venta de ganados y negocio de venta de carne . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar carne al por mayor y ganado.
                                                     
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is Señor Teofila; she is 39 years old and in a live-in relationship.  She has three children.  The member divides her time between her daily activities and her cattle business.  She is still selling meat, but also works selling cattle at the various markets in Anta district.  She is still moving her children ahead in life by means of these businesses.

The member would like to expand and improve her business selling cattle and her business selling meat. The member is requesting this loan to purchase meat at wholesale and cattle.

The member is happy about this loan and commits to complying with her repayments.

loans.use: to purchase meat at wholesale and to buy cattle.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She lives in Kampala, Uganda. Kevin lives in a rented house and her family has no access to electricity and running water. For the past five years, Kevin has run a restaurant. She works seven days a week and her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent. Kevin’s major business challenges are seasonality and transportation.


Kevin is requesting a 300,000 UGX loan from MCDT SACCO to buy bananas, rice, and beef. Her aspiration is to own a fully stocked restaurant and also to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy bananas, rice, and beef

loans.name: Norgel

texts.en:
Norgel is 33 years old and lives in Helen Village, Larena, Siquijor.  She is a single mother of three children.

To earn a living, Norgel runs a food stall business.  She has had this business for 16 years.  She earns about PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase more stock for her business.

Norgel has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for seven months.  In the future, Norgel hopes to expand her business and to be able to save the income for the future of her children.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her food stall

loans.name: Sopha

texts.en: Sopha, 34, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Sopha and her husband sell fish. She is requesting a loan of 750 USD to purchase a plot of land to build a house for her family. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to build a house.

loans.name: Cecilio Efrain

texts.es: Don Cecilio, es un pequeño agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe, gracias al apoyo que obtuvo de Kiva, logro sacar un buen cultivo de piña lo que le permitió reunir entre los vecinos un poco dinero para instalar tuberías de agua potable ya que es un problemas de años que ah venido viviendo; ya que este es un vital liquido tanto para los seres humanos a como es para las plantas, ahora el necesita un financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes , canastos , urea , hijos de piña , entre otros productos para la siembras ; ya que va renovar parte del cultivo piña , su sueños es poder diversificar cultivos ya sea plantaciones de limones , naranjas , papaya , pitahayas y cocos .
texts.en:
Ceciliois a small farmer in the Ticuantepe area. Thanks to the support he obtained from Kiva, he managed to get a good crop of pineapples. 

This allowed him to collect from among his neighbors a bit of money to install a potable water system. This is a problem he has been experiencing for years, as this is a vital liquid, both for human beings and for plants.  

Now he needs a loan to buy fertlizers, crates, urea, pineapple plants, and other products for planting, as he is going to renew part of his pineapple crop. 

His dream is to be able to diversify his cops, be it lemons, oranges, papaya, pitahaya (dragon fruit) or coconuts.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Nyiel

texts.en: Nyiel, a 35-year-old  married mother of five children, two of whom are in school, has had a business selling charcoal in Bor South Sudan for the past two years. Now requesting a loan of $375 through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more charcoal, Nyiel will use the resulting extra income to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Cheam

texts.en: Cheam, 63, is widowed and resides with four children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Two of her daughters are employed as garment workers. Due to low income from her daughters' salaries, Cheam would like to request a loan of USD 500 in order to run a new business by purchasing groceries to sell from home in order to generate more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to purchase rice to resell and  to build a fence and a toilet.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell from home.

loans.name: Nzingo Mugoja

texts.en:
Nzingo Mugoja is a 40-year-old livestock-keeper in Mariakani. She is a married mother of six. She is has been selling livestock and livestock products for the last two years and she is doing great.

This is Nzingo’s third loan from KADET. She plans to purchase more goats, cows and sheep. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. She hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats, cows and sheep.

loans.name: Sergio Leónidas

texts.es: Sergio reside en la zona occidental del país. Junto a su madre. Se dedica al cultivo del plátano y así ha sido desde hace 3 años. Es un joven trabajador y honesto que siempre a tenido como principal objetivo darle un mejor futuro a su mamá. Es agricultor y también desempeña la labor de jornalero como segunda opción , para ayudar un poco en los ingresos familiares. Sergio necesita incrementar sus cultivos es por eso que solicita a INTEGRAL un prestamo para comprar insumos basicos como abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros, que permitan dar los cuidados necesarios a sus matas para que éstas den buen fruto. Espera mejorar sus ventas y a su vez obtener mejores ganancias y cumplir su sueño que es darle una mejor vida a su madre y a su vez solventar la deuda adquirida antes del tiempo acordado.

loans.use: para comprar insumos basicos como abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
ANA ROSA tiene 45 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con el conyugue y el hijo en la CIudad de Ventnaas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la Ventanilla 5 de septiembre, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los plátanos, Pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

ANA ROSA se dedica a la agricultura, además cría animales cómo pollos, cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, insecticidas, urea y dos cerdos.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes para las siembras y el animal para criarlo y venderlo. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. El sueño es comprar un terreno para construir una casa. En el tiempo libre le gusta arreglar y cuidar la casa..
texts.en:
Ana Rosa is 45 years old and in a common-law marriage.  She has one child and lives with her husband and son in the city of Ventanas, Los Ríos Province.
She is a member of the 5th of September communal bank, located in the banana precinct, which is part of the Ventanas canton, where people work in agriculture and livestock.
Ana Rosa works in agriculture. In addition, she raises animals like chickens and pigs. She is requesting the loan to buy seeds, insecticides, urea and two pigs. 
With the help of the loan, she will be able to buy the fertilizers for the sowing and the animal to raise and sell. She will make the purchases in the city of Ventanas. Her dream is to buy a plot of land to construct a house. In her free time, she likes to tidy-up and take care of the house.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides, urea and two pigs.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia makes cleaning products like disinfectant, soap, detergent, shampoo, etc. She has been working in this business for about 2 months. She took a course at the Mifex MERIT Centers that taught her basic chemistry and gave her the skills to make her own cleaning products. This type of business is very lucrative in this sector because the manufactured versions of these products are usually too expensive for most to afford. Therefore, Sonia can make her own products at home and sell them to other businesses. Sonia is also a seamstress. As a complimentary source of income she makes different types of clothes that she sells.

She needs the loan in order to invest the chemicals necessary to maker her products. She also wants to invest in cloths for her sewing operation.

Sonia has 4 children, 2 of which are studying in college. Her husband helps her in many of her activities, but he is much older than she is and cannot work much anymore. Part of her home is made out of cement but the other part is still made only of bamboo like wood.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: She needs the loan in order to invest the chemicals necessary to maker her products. She also wants to invest in cloths for her sewing operation.

loans.name: Fiordaliza

texts.en:
Fiordaliza A. E. lives with her husband, Fabio Cruz, and their three children in a house attached to the back of her store. She sells fresh fruit and vegetables that she has brought in from larger outdoor markets outside of her town. Along with produce, Fiordaliza sells beverages, canned food and even some cleaning supplies such as soap and detergent. She has requested this new loan to purchase basic cooking ingredients and essential food staples from salt and sugar to rice and beans as well as replenish her inventory.

A large portion of her sales come from miniature orders such as one green pepper, a cookie, four slices of bread or a few grams of salt. Selling staples consumed in larger quantities such as rice and beans will increase her profit and round out her inventory so she can cater to individual purchases as well as family-sized orders.

NOTE: As with most Esperanza loan recipients, Fiordaliza is a member of a solidarity group, which receives and pays back equal shares of one loan. This $750 loan will benefit four other entrepreneurs and their businesses along with Fiordaliza’s. They formed their "Banco de Esperanza" (Bank of Hope), went through business training and will repay their loan together. If one person is struggling to pay on time in full, their group will help to make up the difference.

loans.use: Replenish inventory and pay expenses

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is married with four children; she had ten but six are deceased.  She has not undertaken any training. Her husband is insane.  She started her business in 1974, and has specialized in selling onions. She gets them in bulk from the town stores and sometimes from the farmers during harvest season and sells them retail.  With a loan from PEMCI, she intends to increase her stock.  Her business has enabled her to educate all of her children and give medical care to her sick husband.  She has also been able to develop her farm where she plants maize for her domestic use.

loans.use: To increase her business

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Business Description

Olga used to drive a school bus. Her car broke down. Then she looked for help through her sister to find funds to reach the dream to have a diner. This was possible and the business started three years ago. She started with a dining table in her house. Little by little she has adapted her diner. Together with her mom she works from Monday to Saturday in a schedule from 6 a.m. to 3 p.m. And until 11 p.m. on the weekends.

Loan Use

The loan will be invested in purchasing food to prepare meals. As well as, in repairing a little used car to deliver lunch downtown. This way she will be able to provide a better service to her clients.

Personal Information

Olga is a single mother. She is 43 and has 4 children. 3 study and one of them helps her with her business, besides delivering lunches downtown. Her house is made of cement. Her wish is to have a big diner to accommodate the demand she currently has. People like her because of her sazon (seasoning of the food she prepares) which is really good.

Translated from Spanish by Claudia Welch, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Olga se dedicaba ha realizar expreso escolar. Su carrito se le daño. Por lo que busco mediante una hermana capital para cumplir su sueño de tener un comedor. La cual le facilito y comenzó con el negocio hace tres años. Comenzó con la mesa de comedor de su propiedad. Poco a poco a adecuado su local. Junto a su mama trabaja de lunes a sábado en horario de 6 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m. Y los fines de semana hasta la 11.p.m.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en compra de víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Y también poder reparar un carrito de segunda que tiene para poder repartir los almuerzos por el centro de la ciudad. De esta manera podrá brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Olga es madre soltera. Tiene 43 años y 4 hijos. 3 estudian y uno le ayuda en la atención del local. Además de entregar los almuerzos en el centro. Su casita es de cemento. Su deseo es poder tener un amplio local debido a la demanda que tiene en estos momentos. Las personas la buscan por su sazón que es muy buena.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries and car repair

loans.name: Nive

texts.en: Nive T., 56 years old, is married with 3 children, and lives in Saletele Fagaloa. She is pictured here in her retail shop. With the assistance from SPBD she was able to start a retail shop and this has meant a lot of help for her and her family. Before SPBD came along, she had no way of starting a retail shop for the financial institutions in town did not easily lend money to people like herself with no formal employment. With SPBD’s assistance, she not only has a retail shop, she can also support her own children, whereas before she relied a lot on her relatives overseas to send remittances for everything. She is also grateful for the assistance from SPBD which has helped her come this far in terms of development for herself and also for her whole family.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: I Wayan Rampen

texts.id:
Raising and breeding cow is one of Wayan Rampen's daily routines. He has done this business since 2 years ago. He bought 1 cow which cost Rp. 3,300,000 (about $365) and fed it for 4 months. By spending Rp. 9,000 (about $1) per day, he earned Rp. 850,000 (about $94) of profit after he sold the cow. Thank to this business, he can cover his family's expenses, including his children's education fee. His son, Dionisius is a junior high school student and his daughter, Tasia is a first-year elementary school student. The increasing daily needs and expenses have motivated him to expand the business because the business can help his family go through the tough economic situation. With the loan from DINARI, he is more encouraged to work hard so that the business will become better.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Memelihara dan merawat sapi merupakan kegiatan rutin yang dilakukan oleh Wayan Rampen. Usaha beternak sapi ini sudah ditekuninya sejak 2 tahun lalu dengan memelihara 1 ekor penggemukan yang dibelinya dengan haga Rp. 3.300.000,- dan dipeliharanya selama 4 bulan. Dengan mengeluarkan biaya Rp. 9.000,- per hari Wayan Rampen mendapat keuntungan Rp. 850.000,- setelah sapinya dijual. Dari hasil usahanya inilah Wayan Rampen menanggung semua biaya hidup keluarganya, termasuk untuk menyekolahkan dua orang anaknya yaitu Dionisius yang masih SMP dan Tasia yang masih kelas 1 SD. Kebutuhan hidup yang semakin meningkat membuat Wayan Rampen berusaha keras untuk bisa mengembangkan usahanya karena lewat usaha inilah keluarganya bisa bertahan dalam situasi ekonomi yang sulit. Dengan adanya pinjaman dari DINARI Wayan Rampen lebih bersemangat lagi dalam menjalankan usahanya supaya bisa lebih berkembang lagi.

loans.use: To purchase cow and cow food

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
The most valuable thing for a mother are her children and the care that they deserve specially when they are very small; therefore Marisol is always paying attention to the needs of her children. She works hard at a small farm that produces Mangoes, and whenever it’s possible she takes her kids with her in order to look after them herself. Maria and her partner work in their own land every day sowing for the different seasons and taking care of the production to then sell it. Marisol will be able to cover her requests and to extend her perspectives if we support her with a loan, let's help with this noble cause.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Lo más valioso para una madre, son sus hijos y el cuidado que estos merecen son lo más importante principalmente cuando estos están muy pequeños, es por ello que Marisol siempre está pendiente de las necesidades de sus hijos y para esto trabaja muy arduamente en la chacra de producción de mangos y siempre que puede prefiere llevar a sus pequeños con el propósito de observarlos. Tanto ella como su pareja día a día, trabajan en sus tierras sembrando por temporadas y cuidando su producción para luego ofertarlos. Marisol podrá cubrir sus requerimientos y ampliar sus perspectivas si la apoyamos con un préstamo, colaboremos con esta noble causa.

loans.use: Buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nansana West I B(Ii) D Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Cotrida is marreid with seven children. She sells fresh foods and raw foods in the market. She intends to use the extra business profits to provide necessary services to the children, such as food, education, and medical care.

loans.use: To buy more fresh foods

loans.name: Mugungu A(Iv) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Angella M..  She is currently in the hardware business and is requesting a loan to add stock to her hardware shop. Angella is 42 years old and is married. Her husband owns a retail shop. She has 5 children ranging from age 10 to 18, and her children go to school. 

Each week, Angella makes approximately UGX 50000 (about $30 USD) in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children. Angella has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before, in the amount of UGX 500000 (about $290 USD), to invest in her business, and she paid the loan back on time. 

Angella is joined in her small group by Elizabeth A., Harriet N., Grace K., and Sylvia W..  Elizabeth A. has a business selling dry cassava and wants to add to her business.  Harriet N. sells dry maize and wants a loan to purchase more maize from villages.  Grace K. operates a business selling dry maize and wants to add to her maize business. Sylvia W. currently sells dry cassava and is requesting a loan to expand her cassava business.

loans.use: Add in the business and increase stock in hardware shop.

loans.name: Esdras

texts.en:
Esdras J. P. is a friendly and outgoing 43-year-old man who lives with his family in the town of Los Alcarizzos, just outside the capital of Santo Domingo. He is asking for this loan so that he can open a Christian library/bookstore in his community.

This is an excellent business idea for many reasons. First of all, Esdras’ community does not currently have any sort of library, so the need for one is great. Secondly, Esdras says there is a strong Christian community in Los Alcarrizzos that has expressed interest in having a Christian library; he is very excited to be able to provide them with this service. Esdras is asking for this loan so that he can buy the books he needs to start his library/bookstore. He hopes to expand the library over time.

He recognises that it will be a challenge “to realize a Christian Library in the big Haitian community in Los Alcarrizzos and to meet the needs of the churches and leaders there.” He plans to both sell and rent his books out.

In his free time Esdras loves to write, read the Bible, and teach his fellow community members. On behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, thank you for your interest and time in supporting Esdras!

loans.use: Purchase books for a community library/bookstore

loans.name: Chou

texts.en:
Chou H. is 47 years old and is living in Kampong Cham province. She works raising pigs and cultivating a small rice paddy while her husband breeds ducks. They support their five children on a combined income of approximately $6.50 USD per day. The children stay at home and help their parents with the livestock.

With her loan she wants to purchase more ducks for her husband to breed. He takes their eggs and sells them at the local market to make the majority of his profit. Her husband, Sem Nung, and their small boy, appear in the photo.

loans.use: To buy ducks.

loans.name: Nesto

texts.en: Nesto is a medical assistant who works with a dispensary in Kariakoo, Dar es Salaam’s busiest trading center. Apart from his work, Nesto runs a small brick laying factory where he employs three people to help him. He is in need of a loan to help buy another brick laying machine, so as to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his brick laying business

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Mrs. Savy P., 44, and her husband, Mr. Vannoun Moeung, 46, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.  They were married in 1986 and have four children, three sons and one daughter. Two of their children weave silk at home and the other two are in local schools.

Mrs. Savy has been a silk weaver since 1980, having learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh, while Mr. Vannoun has been a policeman since 1989.

Now Savy is requesting a loan of US$200 to purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving

loans.name: Filomena Jorge

texts.pt:
Filomena Jorge M. is 34 years old and was born in Catembe. She is completing the 10th grade and will be taking her exams in July. She is single and has a 16-year-old daughter in the 9th grade and a 14-year-old daughter in the 7th grade. Filomena also supports her father and 2 brothers, who live with her. She has never left Catembe.

Filomena has been an administrative assistant at the Primary School of Catembe since 1997. Her work hours begin at 7:30 a.m. and end at 5:30 p.m. She learned her work from other co-workers and from over 10 years of experience.

Filomena lives in her own house, and has benefited from 2 loans. The first she used to buy basic goods, and the second for building materials. She found out about Hluvuku through friends and colleagues.

In the future Filomena intends to finish her studies and build a solid house.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

Filomena Jorge M., nasceu na Catembe tem 34 anos, tem frequencia da 10ª classe e em Julho próximo vai realizar exames extraordinários.

Solteira tem duas filhas sendo que a mais velha tem 16 anos de idade e frequenta a 9ª classe e a mais nova tem 14 anos e está na 7ª classe.Sustenta também o pai e dóis irmãos e vivem com eles e relata que nunca saiu da catembe.

Atualmente é assistente administrativa efectiva na Escola Primária Completa da Catembe desde 1997, entra as 7:30 e sai as 15:30mn. O trabalho que faz aprendeu com colegas de profissão e fá-lo a mais de 10 anos.

Vive em casa própria e já teve dóis empréstimos o 1º foi pra compra de bens de consumo e o 2º para compra de materiais de construção e conheceu a Hluvuku atravéis de colegas e amigas. No futuro pretende concluir os estudos e construir uma casa de material convencional.

loans.use: To buy materials to build family house

loans.name: Nasrullah

texts.en:
Nasrullah K. is 46 years old, married and has 11 children. He has lived with his family in Jalalabad since 2001. Before that time he lived in Pakistan, where he worked while away from his family. Now his four sons have graduated from school and are taking additional computer courses. In their free time, they help their father in his business.

When Nasrullah was about nine years old, he began working with his father, who was a tailor. After five years as an apprentice, he became a full-fledged tailor. He continued to work with his father until he got married. At that time, he opened his own shop. 

Nasrullah worked hard, and in just a few months had many customers and was able to hire some employees to work with him. Because his income was good, he was able to enroll his sons in private courses in addition to their schooling. 

Nasrullah has applied for a loan to expand his business by selling cloth as well as tailoring services. He will buy the cloth in Pakistan, expand his small company and become a well-known and respected businessman. He wishes to thank his lenders in advance for their support.

loans.use: To buy cloth to sell from his shop

loans.name: Mariam's Mungu Tusaidie Group

texts.en:
Mariam R. is 26 years old. She is married with1 child aged 6 years old. She has been a shoe and clothes seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Mariam R. is now seeking a loan to buy more clothes and shoes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mariam S. and Rehema R..

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes for her business

loans.name: Savalia

texts.en:
Savalia F. is 72 years old and married with eleven children. She has 5 years of experience running a general store. Her shop is open seven days a week to the public and local villagers.

Savalia has benefited from four previous successful SPBD (South Pacific Business Development) loans. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~$187 USD). SPBD loans are Legatasi's only access to capital, because she is not able to qualify for a traditional bank loan. She will use her loan to purchase a new freezer for her store, as well as buy sacks of sugar, rice, and salt, and cases of lamp chops and chicken thighs to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer for her general store and to increase her stock of food items to sell.

loans.name: Gulzaran's Group

texts.en:
Gulzaran baji is a wife of S. A.. She owns a two-room brick house in Arifwala, Pakistan, where she has lived for the past 19 years. She is the mother of three sons, all of whom are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Gulzaran baji’s husband has a grocery shop in the community, which he has run for the past five years.

Gulzaran baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy more groceries for her husband’s grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Gulzaran baji is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Razia baji wants a loan to buy beams and rope for her shuttering business. Sakeena baji wants a loan to repair her tractor. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy wires and switch boards for her electric shop.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery shop

loans.name: Teagbanlin

texts.en:
M. Teagbanlin was born in Ouidah in 1970. She married Wassi Adeagan and has 3 children, 2 in school. She has worked selling scrap metal for the past 3 years and lived in Midombo for 3 years. She is now applying for a second loan to buy more stocks of scrap metal.
 
Née à Ouidah vers 1970, elle est mariée à ADEAGAN Wassi (commerçant). Mère de 03 enfants dont 02 en apprentissage et un scolarisé, elle mène cette activité depuis 03 ans et réside à Midombo depuis 03 ans. Avec le premier crédit où elle a vu son activité accroître, elle sollicite un crédit de 150000 pour satisfaire à la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle.

Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $1,500 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.

loans.use: Purchase of scrap metal

loans.name: Annet Kalyesubula Group

texts.en: K. Annet is a member of Busuyi lending group in Jinja, Mayuge. She is a hardworking lady with a fish selling business where she buys fish from Busuyi landing site and sells from her home plus taking it to other markets for sale. She says that before the loans, she used to sell fish in very small quantities but now she has plenty to sell and as a result, her profits have increased. She is happy that now her children go to school with ease, there is food since she has the money and generally her family’s standard of living has greatly improved. Annet needs another loan to buy more fish for sale.

loans.use: More fish for sale.

loans.name: Lao

texts.en: Mrs. C. is a 37-year-old farmer who grows rice and other fruits and vegetables, such as watermelon, pumpkin, and green beans, to sell. Her husband, Mr. Sang, 46, provides musical speakers for wedding parties and ceremonies in his area (pictured here). They have three young teenagers, who all attend school. To increase the family's income, C. requests a loan to expand the number of crops she grows, and to buy piglets to raise.

loans.use: To grow more crops and buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Christina R. from Mwanza. She is married with one two-year-old child. Christina has been running a shoe business since 2008. Her business is to sell women's shoes. She works at the business for eight hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by one employee. Christina currently earns about 130 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase more shoes for resale. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Christina thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit through micro-leasing in Tanzania. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women and uses the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for resale

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.es:
Leonardo  se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche la comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). 
También  trabaja en la recolección de arena en un río cercano a su población; dicha arena la vende a comerciantes del transporte que compran para la  posterior venta en la construcción de viviendas.
 
Vive. en la comunidad Vilaque de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposa quien le colabora en los quehaceres de su hogar y cuidado del ganado. 
 
El crédito lo destinará en la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2007.
texts.en:
Leonardo works raising cattle, and he sells their milk to the PIL Andina (the Andean Milk Processing Plant). He also works in the collection of sand from a nearby river; he sells the sand to transport merchants who buy it to then sell for home construction. He lives in the Vilaque community in Los Andes, La Paz, Bolivia which is located about 3 hours from the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife who helps him with the household chores and in caring for their cattle. The loan will be used to purchase another milking cow to increase their production of milk and, by that means, their income. This is his second loan through Impro; his evaluation has helped to qualify him for this loan. He has been a customer of Impro since 2007/

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a milking cow to improve the amount of milk he produces

loans.name: Julio Francisco

texts.es: El Señor Julio Francisco D. C. tiene la edad de 36 años, su estado civil es casado. Don Julio tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian.
