La actividad económica de Don Julio es venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que comenzó con la ayuda de su Mama. Los propósitos de Don julio son de satisfacer a sus clientes con la calidad de sus productos. Es por eso que solicita un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo con esto podrá comprar calzado, ropa y camisetas. Sus deseos son de proporcionarle mantenimiento a su vivienda para que en un futuro esta no tenga problemas y este acondicionada de la mejor forma. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 9.900 córdobas.
texts.en:
Mr. Julio Francisco D. C. is thirty-six years old and married. Julio has two children and they are both students. His business is general retail sales. He has been in this business for over 15 years since he started with his mother's help. Julio's main objectives are to satisfy his customers with quality products. This is why he requests a loan for work capital, as this will allow him to purchase shoes, clothes and shirts. He desires to provide his residence with maintenance so that in the future it will not have problems and will be in top condition. The amount he requests is $500 USD.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To fix up her cafeteria

loans.name: Tolib

texts.ru:
Толиб работает преподавателем в средней школе. Ему 53 года, женат, трое детей. Так как со здоровьем у Толиба в последнее время стало хуже, он стал меньше преподавать. Его старший сын работает на заработках в России и присылает на содержание семьи денег. Но чтобы прожить нормально Толиб решил завести домашний скот и на деньги, вырученные от откорма скота содержать семью. Постепенно поголовье скота увеличивается, а вместе с ним и доход. С МикроИнвест он сотрудничает больше года и получил 2 раза кредит. Сейчас услышав о КИВА он решил подать заявку и планирует приобрести бычка и корм для него. 
(на фото дочь Толиба)
texts.en:
Tolib works as a high school teacher. He is 53 years old, married, and has three children. Tolib’s health has recently declined, and so he has been teaching less. His elder son works in Russia and sends the family money. In order to afford a normal life, Tolib has decided to buy livestock and support his family on the money he earns from fattening cattle. Gradually, as the herd increases, so will the income it brings in. He has been working with MicroInvest for more than a year and has received loans twice. Now that he’s heard about Кiva, he has decided to apply for another loan and plans to buy a calf and feed. (The photo is of Tolib’s daughter.)

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a calf

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: El señor Jorge Alberto vive con su esposa la señora María Teresa, la señora se hace cargo del hogar y de la familia, el trabaja en una Institución Medica en el área de alimentación como manejador de alimentos, ellos por el momento tienen varios proyectos a realizar pero el primordial es construir la barda lateral posterior de su casa, para brindarle mas protección a su familia; es por lo que están solicitando este crédito
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto lives with his wife, María Teresa. She takes care of the home and the family. He works in a medical institution in the field of nutrition as a food driver. They currently have various projects, but the primary one is to construct a side wall in back of their house. They want this in order to provide more protection to their family. That is why they are asking for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct a side wall in back of their house

loans.name: Oyinlola

texts.en: Oyinlola is 40 years old and married with 3 children. She sells planks to make a living. She hopes for the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A. is thirty-eight years old, married, and has given birth to three children: one boy and two girls. All are currently in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Margaret is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice and stew. She sells on a table by the roadside from morning to evening. She buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for fifteen years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Joseph Mwema

texts.en:
Joseph Mwema is married to Judith Achieng and is the proud father of one child. He has been selling secondhand clothes for the last three years. 

Joseph was introduced to KADET by a friend who is a client. Joseph operates his business in Huruma estate in the outskirts of Eldoret town and near to bigger towns as well. With this first business loan from KADET, he intends to purchase assorted men's, ladies' and children's wear.

In future, Joseph hopes to grow his business to a wholesale outlet fully equipped and diversified with even school-boarding facilities. He also wishes to improve his living standards by buying a permanent residential plot for his family.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purchase assorted men's, ladies' and children's wear

loans.name: Adakouvi

texts.fr: Cette femme  est divorcée de son époux dans le quartier tokoin à Lomé avec son seul enfant. L’activité génératrice de revenu qu’elle exerce et qui lui permet de subvenir à ses charges et à celle de son enfant est le commerce de tubercules. Faisant face à  une réduction de stock, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 20 sacs d'ignames.
texts.en:
This is a divorce woman who lives in the Tokoin neighborhood in Lomé with her only child. Her business consists in selling yams, and enables her to support herself and her child. Her stock is currently low, and she wants to resupply. This is why she's seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 20 sacks of yams.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 sack of yams

loans.name: Miriam Isela

texts.es:
Miriam es madre soltera de tres hijos de 15, 13 y 10 años de edad, trabaja en el magisterio por las mañanas y por las tardes trabaja como secretaria, es su principal fuente de ingreso que sirve para cubrir  la manutención de toda la  familia. Vive en la casa de su madre ubicado en la Zona Villa Esperanza de la ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de una computadora para facilitar los trabajos escolares de sus hijos. 
 
Es el cuarto  crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite aprobar otro préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Miriam is a single mother of three children (ages 15, 13 and 10). In the mornings, she is a teacher and then works as a secretary in the afternoons. Her work is the only source of income to cover her family’s living expenses. She lives in the house of her mother, which is located in the district of Villa Esperanza in the city of El Alto.

Miriam will use her loan to purchase a computer to help with her children’s homework. This is her fourth loan with IMPRO. Her excellent payment history enabled her to be approved for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a computer to help with her children's homework

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia is twenty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to three children: one son and two daughters, who are all still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Afia is a trader, trading in foodstuffs such as cassava, plantain, maize, etc. She procures the goods from nearby communities and sells in her community and also supplies to other food vendors. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy food items in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs in bulk to expand her business

loans.name: Maimua

texts.en:
Maimuna is a member of the Lami borrower group in Ilala, Iringa, she is 38 year old woman she is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 22, 19, 15 years old. 

Maimuna has owned a  charcoal business for 10 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 180,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Maimuna`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Maimauna hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To  buymore charcoal for sale

loans.name: Ghullam Saewar Group

texts.en: This is the G. Saewar group. There are three members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their businesses. Rayhana and G. Sarwar want to take a loan for their business of embroidery to buy necessary materials for their businesses. And Samya wants to take a loan for her husband’s business of general store. And also they want to complete their necessary materials for their businesses. They want to say that these loans to help businesses progress and make businesses larger are very useful. They all want to thank Kiva for making possible the process in Afghanistan to support poor people.

loans.use: their improve their business

loans.name: Lhagviilha

texts.en:
Lhagviilha G. is 25 years old and lives with his wife and 4-year-old son in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home. His wife is currently unemployed and looks after their son when he isn't at kindergarten.

G. operates a hair salon out of a rented apartment in his town. He started his salon in 2008 with capital of 80,000 tugrugs (~56 USD) and has progressed his business in a short time. Today, he is well established in the local business community and his working capital exceeds 200,000 tugrugs (~140 USD).

For the future, G. hopes to have his own building for his salon and dreams of becoming the best hairdresser in town. G. works very hard and uses his earnings to support his family and improve their quality of life. He is requesting a 300,000 tugrug loan to purchase more tools and hair products for his salon.

loans.use: To purchase more tools and hair products for his salon

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina M. is from the village of Batangan,Valencia City. She is 47 years old. Rosalina is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosalina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruit salad and  flavored icebars in the local community. Rosalina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosalina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase the raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rosalina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Pauline Akossiwa

texts.fr: K. Pauline Akossiwa est née en 1979 à Athiémé, non loin de la frontière du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. Pauline Akossiwa est mariée à GBEKE Christophe, un agent commercial. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Pauline Akossiwa vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son conjoint au quartier Cocotomey à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, depuis huit ans. Pauline Akossiwa vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Ayant arrêté l'école au cours primaire, Pauline Akossiwa exerce le métier de coiffeuse depuis six ans déjà. A côté de cela, Pauline Akossiwa vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques dans son atelier se trouvant à Cocotomey. Pauline Akossiwa a déjà bénéficié d'un crédit à ALIDé qui a été bien remboursé. En vue d'accroître son activité et de satisfaire plus sa clientèle, Pauline Akossiwa sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
K. Pauline Akossiwa was born in 1979 in Athiémé, not far from the border of Togo, a country neighboring Benin.  She is married to GBEKE Christophe, a commercial agent.  The couple has two children who are all in school.  For eight years, Pauline Akossiwa has been living in the Cocotomey district in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, where she still does, together with her children and husband.  She comes to her husband's aid in meeting family expenses.  Having dropped out in primary school, she has been working in the hairdressing trade for six years already.  Aside from this, she sells hair extensions and cosmetics in her shop located in Cocotomey. She has benefited from an ALIDé loan before, which has been repaid.  With the aim of growing her business and satisfying her customers further, she's requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 boxes of cosmetics and 3 dozen hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem S., 27, is a humble villager who earns a living as a local farmer. She plants various crops on her farmland and typically earns about $60 a month to help provide her family’s food needs. She is a married woman and the mother of a young child, who attends school. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver. Sem S. has requested a loan to buy a cow, that will help her plow her farmland. She hopes this cow will also provide her with many offsprings in the future.

loans.use: To buy a cow to plow her farmland

loans.name: Carmen Del Rocio

texts.en:
Carmen Del Rocio P. M. is 43 years old and runs a home restaurant in the Isla district of Guayaquil. Eight years ago, Ms. P. began making and selling encebollado (a local fish soup) out of her home on the weekends.  She loved cooking and preparing food so much that she decided to open a restaurant out of her mother´s home. 

Ms. P. is married and has 3 children ages 21, 23 and 24. With the help of her mother, sister and daughter-in-law, Ms. P. works every day from early in the morning until 2 p.m. serving lunch for $1.50 to people who work in the area.  Her husband has been in Spain for 7 years now, but he provides support when possible.

Ms. P. is requesting a loan to buy chairs, tables and a stovetop for her restaurant.  In the future, she hopes to buy a shade to protect her customers from the hot sun and cement to create proper walls within the restaurant.  She thanks you for any support you may be able to provide her business so that her family may prosper!

loans.use: chairs, tables and a stovetop

loans.name: Roling  Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Roling Antonio E. R. es trabajador de la fabrica de puro Nicaprosa ubicada a un kilometro de Estelí, Roling va usar el crédito para pagar mano de obra de remodelación de su vivienda.
El espera que con la remodelación de su casa se va sentir bien ya que su vivienda anteriormente estaba un poco deteriorada.
Roling es soltera pero tiene su conyugue y un hijo a su cargo.
Este es su primer crédito con Ceprodel y espera seguir trabajando con  Ceprodel.
texts.en:
Roling Antonio E. R. works at the Nicaprosa cigar factory, which is located a kilometer away from Estelí. Roling will use his funds to pay for labor costs to remodel his home. He hopes that the home remodel will help him feel better since his home is in a pretty deteriorated condition. Roling is single but has both his life partner and a son dependent on him. This is his first loan with Ceprodel and he hopes to continue to collaborate with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay home repair labor costs.

loans.name: Matea

texts.en:
Matea P. is from the village of Westfield Iponan, in Cagayan de Oro City. She is a 58-year-old widow with three school-age children. To earn a living, Matea owns and operates a business venture in the services sector. More specifically, her income is primarily derived from hairdressing and beauty services she provides to local community members. Matea has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month on account of these activities.

In 2009, Matea joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. As a result, she was better equipped to engage in business activities and to improve her family's standard of living. Notably, Matea has already successfully repaid a prior loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to expand the services she could provide to her customers. Matea is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 8,000 PHP ($175), which will be used to further expand the business. This loan would be the second loan taken out by Matea from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and seeks to assist the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To expand and improve her service business

location.town: Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary P. sells frozen fish in Elmina. Mary has received a senior high education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a fisherman. Mary has been selling frozen fish for some time now. She is responsible for supporting her husband in the payment of school fees, bills and other family expenses.

Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to be frozen by way of preserving it for resale at a later period. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and to improve her capital to enable her to increase her stock.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to be frozen for resale

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 40 years old and he is still single. He lives in Nyarugenge district, one of the districts of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.

Moses has been in the business of selling a variety of beers for about ten years and the hours of his business are from 10 a.m. until late in the evening hours.

Moses needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding his business through adding a large quantity of beers so that he can satisfy the demand of his customers.

Moses also plans to start roasting meat, bananas and Irish potatoes in his bar so that his customers can get something to eat while they are drinking. Through the use of this loan, Moses has a hope for a better future.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of additional beers

loans.name: Fanny Virginia

texts.es:
Fanny C. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres de Combate, vive a unos 10 minutos a las afueras de la Ciudad de Cuenca en la parroquia  Baños en la comunidad de Huizhill, se caracteriza por la belleza de sus parajes naturales andinos,  sus bosques y su cercanía al centro turístico  Baños le han ubicado como una de las localidades mas visitadas principalmente por turistas extranjeros.

Fanny tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera vive en casa de sus padres donde ayuda a su mamá en los quehaceres del hogar, estudia derecho en la Universidad Estatal de Cuenca y hace seis meses en sus ratos libres trabaja  como consultora de belleza de la linea de productos de belleza Yanbal, su papá es  sastre de profesión.

  Ella es una de las socias mas jóvenes de éste banco y éste es su primer crédito que realiza en la fundación y espera incrementar su negocio, con el dinero que recibirá va adquirir perfumes, cremas, tratamietnos, y cosmeticos en general para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.

Su meta es incrementar cada dia mas su negocio y surtirlo con varios productos para toda la familia.
texts.en:
Fanny C. is a member of the Mujeres de Combate Microfinance Institute. She lives some 10 minutes away from the city of Cuenca, in the Baños parish of the Huizhill community, which is renowned for its beauteous Andean landscapes, its forests, and its proximity to the Baños tourist spot. It is one of the most visited places in the country, mainly by foreigners.

Fanny is 18 years old, single, and lives with her parents, helping her mother with the household chores. She is studying law at the Universidad Estatal de Cuenca. Six months ago, she started working as a Yanbal beauty consultant during her spare time. Her father is a tailor.

She is one of the youngest group members in this bank, and she is requesting her first loan with the hopes of expanding her business. With the loan money, she will obtain fragrances, lotions, facial treatments, and several other cosmetics in order to fill her customers' orders.

Her goal is to increase business every day and stock up on various products for the whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Yanbal fragrances, facial treatments, and other cosmetics

loans.name: Mrs. Sarin Yan Village Bank Group

texts.en: The 10 people who have applied for this loan live in Preaek Bak village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sarin Y. is a village bank president who has also been chosen to lead this group by its members, each of whom who will use his or her portion of the loan to improve their family's living conditions. Mrs. Sarin Y. owns a general store in local village and her husband, Mr. Lat Seng, is a motorbike taxi driver. Since her business is growing, she wants to expand and has applied for this loan to buy more groceries to sell. She has one child, who is studying in local public school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Help We Group

texts.en:
Here are small-scale businesswomen from the township of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They named their group “Help We” and chose Jeneba S. (who is pictured second from right) as their leader. They are applying for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each in the group in order to further expand their businesses.

30-year-old Jeneba was born in Kono, eastern Sierra Leone. She is married and has four children: two in secondary school and two in primary school. Jeneba sells market-food such as magi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, sugar, etc. She has been running this business for five years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy magi, salt, and sugar at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy magi, salt, sugar at wholesale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 41 year old single mother of four children. She lives in Dagoretti area within Nairobi. She normally sells beaded items like baskets, necklaces and handcrafted table decorations  at two different and famous markets (Maasai market and the Kenyatta market). She mainly sells to tourists and the Maasai natives in Kenya. She has done this for the past year. 

Agnes has applied for a loan which she plans to use to buy more beads to increase her stock in order to meet the market demands. She has never borrowed from other financial institutions before.

In the future, she hopes to be a supplier to other bead makers so she can increase her sales and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To increase her stock of beads to meet her sales demands

loans.name: Wilmer Patricio

texts.es:
Wilmer de 52 años, tiene dos hijos que estudian en colegios fiscales, ellos viven en una casa de cemento. A Wilmer desde pequeño le gusto ser comerciante, vendía ropa, y artículos personales a sus amigos. Pero cuando se casa necesitaba ingresos que sosteniera económicamente a su familia fue hay que con sus ahorros compro papelería, cuadernos, plumas etc. 

Por esa buena decisión el construyo en la parte delantera de su casa un pequeño local para ubicar su mercadería y venderla. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 20h30pm todos los días, su esposa le ayuda. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, plumas, papelería para su negocio. En el futuro el quiere tener otra papelería.
texts.en:
Wilmer, 52, has two children enrolled in public school; they all live in a cement house. Ever since he was a little boy, Wilmer has enjoyed being a merchant; he used to sell clothing and personal articles to his friends. When he got married, however, he needed income that would support the family and that was when he used his savings to buy paper goods, notebooks, pens, etc. That good decision on his part led to his building a small store in the front part of his house to place his wares for sale. He is currently open for business from 7am until 8:30pm every day; his wife helps him. He will use the funds to buy notebooks, pens and paper goods for his store. In the future he would like to have another stationery store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For notebooks, pens and paper goods.

loans.name: Tania Gabriela

texts.es:
La señora Tania es una habitante del sector Los Corrales es una localidad perteneciente al cantón Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, nuestra socia está casada, a sus 18 años ya es madre de un  niño de apenas un mes, está dedicada a su hijo y al hogar, quien se encarga de trabajar es el esposo, tiene un negocio de tagua,  él se encarga de comprarla en el puerto de Manta, una vez que la compra la tiene que secar, tratarla dándole un corte para que esté lista y luego el siguiente paso es venderla a los distribuidores quienes se encargan de exportarla a otros países donde esta materia prima se convierte en botones, aretes y demás accesorios.

La señora Tania con este nuevo crédito podrá facilitarle al esposo el dinero para que invierta en tagua, los días que el esposo no tiene material, el  no se queda con los brazos cruzados ya que también trabajar de chofer en una volqueta que lleva fletes de arena y piedra. Nuestra socia nos comento que le gustaría terminar sus estudios y graduarse de estilista le gusta mucho esta profesión.
texts.en:
Sra. Tania is a resident of Los Corrales sector, an area that is part of the Montecristi canton in Manabí Province. She is 18 years old, married, and already a mother of a one month old child. She is dedicated to taking care of her son and her home. Her husband has a business processing “tagua” (the hard white coating of a specific palm seed that is used as a substitute for elephant ivory), which he buys at the port of Manta. After the tagua is dried and treated, it is then cut and ready to be sold to distributors who export it to other countries where it is used to make buttons, earrings, and various accessories.

With this new loan, Sra. Tania will invest in tagua for her husband since he does not have any to work with at the moment. This does not mean he has been sitting around with his arms crossed. He also works as a truck driver and is responsible for hauling shipments of sand and gravel. Tania says she wants to finish her studies and graduate from beauty school to become a stylist since she would very much like to have that profession.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase "tagua" (a substitute for elephant ivory)

loans.name: Nimer

texts.en:
Nimer is a 32 year old married Lebanese entrepreneur. In 1975, Nimer’s father opened his grocery store. He used to help his father after school, on weekends, and on holidays. Therefore, in 2000, he took after his father and decided to operate and manage his father’s grocery store in his town. Nimer has good experience in trading and he is is very well known in his region since the shop has been open for 35 years now. His family has always supported him in developing and improving his work. He offers food products, dairy products, breads, cereals, drinks, canned food, bread, candies, and more products to his clients. 

Today, Nimer is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise to stock his shop in the hopes that this will increase his sales and, therefore, his income.

loans.use: for store inventory

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a Lebanese entrepreneur. He has been selling coffee from his trolley since 2000. Khaled is very well known in his region since he passes by all the streets and is very sociable. He likes talking to people and is very welcoming. Today, Khaled has chosen to take a loan of $1000 to purchase a juice machine for his work. Since the summer season is here, he wants to start offering juice to his clients. He hopes that this will allow him to increase his sales and, therefore, his income.

loans.use: To purchase a juice machine

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: El Señor Rolando es la primera vez que trabaja con emprender,  llego a la institución por recomendación de sus Padres,  es joven y sus padres indican que es muy responsable en su trabajo, se dedica a la confección de balones desde hace ocho años,  tiene clientes fijos que les compran en  las Ciudades de Santa Cruz  y Cochabamba,  este crédito es para la compra de cuero, lona y otros materiales para la confeccion de sus productos. El señor vive en casa de su padres, es soltero y ayuda a su familia con los gastos del hogar, ya que el es único que trabaja, sus padres están muy orgullosos del Sr. Rolando ya que le va muy bien en su trabajo.
texts.en:
This is the first time that Mr. Rolando has worked with Emprender and he came to us following his parents’ recommendation. He is young and his parents tell us that he is very responsible with his work. He’s been making and selling balls for the past eight years. He has regular customers from the cities of Santa Cruz and Cochabamba. He will use the money from this loan to buy leather, canvas, and other materials for manufacturing his products. [Rolando] lives in his parents’ home, he is single, and helps with the household expenses, as he is the only one in the household who works. His parents are very proud of Mr. Rolando, because his business is doing well.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana tiene 52 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos de los cuales uno reside con ella, su vivienda se encuentra ubicada en el sector La Primavera de la ciudad de Chiclayo,una ciudad bastante conocida por su movimiento comercial y de transporte, es la capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace tres años tiene instalada en su vivienda una bodega en la cual ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes y bebidas, el negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a que pone al alcance de la mano de sus clientes diversos productos de consumo diario por los cuales tendrían que dirigirse hacia el centro de la ciudad para adquirirlos. Como es la unica fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta, Juana trata de brindar a sus clientes un buen servicio.

Su clientela ha ido aumentando progresivamente y ello ha hecho que ella piese en ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda que posee. Para lograr su meta ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Juana es una mujer alegre y entregada a su familia, el desear que sus hijos se superen hizo que se esforzara al máximo en su trabajo y ahora se encuentra orgullosa, ya que ambos son buenas personas. Ella ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Juana, 52, is separated and has two children one of whom still lives with her. Her home is in the La Primavera sector of the city of Chiclayo, a city that is well known for its commercial activity and as a transportation hub; it is the capital of Lambayeque region. She has had a grocery store installed in her home for the last three years. She stocks all kinds of basic needs items, groceries, beverages. The store is well received because it puts several basic items within reach of customers who would otherwise have to travel downtown to get. Because it’s her only source of income Juana tries to provide her customers with good service. Her customer base has been gradually growing and this has led her to think about expanding her business adding more products to her stock so that she can meet growing demand. To reach this goal she has thought it convenient to request a 1200 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa. Juana is a cheerful woman who is dedicated to her family. Her wish that her children get ahead in life motivated her to exert the maximum effort in her work and now she is proud that both of them have become upstanding citizens. She has collaborated with our Institution in the past and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with regards to her repayment obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima G. is from the village of Sta. Isabel Norte, Ilagan. She is 30 years old and married with 4 school-aged children.

To make a living, Prima raises pigs for fattening and sale. Prima has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Prima joined ASKI to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from ASKI which she used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.

Prima is requesting her second loan from ASKI, for 6000 PHP, which she will use to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

About ASKI

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
This is Lilian S., 38, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Julisto S., a foreman, and they are blessed with strong physiques which enable them to work hard for their family and their future together.

Lilian operates a tailoring business. She mainly offers curtains, bed sheets, blankets, and other home trapping. There is also seasonal demand for clothing like uniforms and such, and she does repairs and alterations. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 200 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more raw materials such as fabric, thread and newspapers for patterns. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.
  
Lilian dreams of being able to give all her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy more raw materials such as fabric, thread and newspapers for patterns

loans.name: Fe Retuya's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Fe R. is from Ozamis City. She is 47 years old and is married with two adult children. She is the group leader of this four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Fe R.’s Group. Fe owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for twenty-five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Fe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. Fe is now requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her fifth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nanci Yousaf's Group

texts.en:
Nanci lives in Faisalabad which is Pakistan’s third largest city and is famous for its textile industry. She lives in a two-room brick house with her family in the area named Medina town. She is a 49-year-old widow and lost her husband few years ago. It was a very difficult time for her and her family but she never lost hope. She raised her children with great care. Now both her sons sell sanitation supplies in the market and earn well from this business. Both of them respect their mother a lot and care for her the way she cares for them.  

Nanci is satisfied now that her sons are settled and operating their business. She has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her sons’ business. With the loan amount, her sons will buy sanitation supplies such as taps, water pipes, etc. to increase their sales. She is hopeful that her sons' business will improve and her family will have a better standard of living.
 
She wants her eldest son to marry and she hopes that she will be able to help him do it very soon with the help of profit from the loan. She is a new loan applicant and hopes that it will be a profitable experience for her family. 

Note: In the photo, Nanci is the lady who is raising her hand.

loans.use: To buy sanitation supplies to sell

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam wants a loan to complete paying for his plot of land for construction of a rental house. He is a 22-year-old man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda, in his own house. He dreams of turning his grocery into a wholesale shop; thus, improving his source of income. Sam sells domestic items in his grocery and says so far he has had no big challenges.

loans.use: To complete payment for a plot of land for the construction of a rental house

loans.name: Gema

texts.en:
Gema S. is from the village of Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Gema is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates motorcycle transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gema joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Leslie Hindira

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC PURIRISUN”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Leslie; ella tiene 30 años de edad, conviviente  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de refrigerio en El Paraíso(es un lugar comercial donde venden todo tipo de celulares , ropa , productos para la casa , ollas entre otras cosas mas ) , la socia tiene un puesto en este establecimiento siendo su horario por las tardes ella vende café , mates , leche ,hamburguesas , tortas .

la socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más insumos para su negocio como azúcar , leche , café entre otros.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank “Sumac Puririsun”.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province and department of Cusco.

The member is Mrs. Leslie, she is 30 years old. lives with a partner and has 2 children.  She splits her time between her daily activities and a business of selling refreshments at El Paraiso ( a commercial center where cell phones, clothing, household goods, pots and pans and other items are sold).  She has a stand at this center. Her hours are in the afternoons and she sells coffee, mate, milk, hamburgers and cakes.

The member is requesting a loan to buy more supplies for her business, such as sugar, milk, coffee and others.
She thanks all that participate in making her dream come true and promises to comply with the loan installments in the established time.

loans.use: The associate is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her business, such as sugar, milk, and coffee among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix A. is from the village of Cabisera 27, Ilagan, Isabela. He is 41 years old. Felix is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Felix plants and harvests rice to sell. He has been engaged in his business for over twenty-five years and earns approximately $188 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Felix joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 17,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be his 1st loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Fany

texts.es:
Fany es una madre de familia de 38 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola de clima semitropical que produce principalmente frutas como el mango, la maracuyá y el limón. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega que se encuentra instalada en su domicilio. Ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de consumo diario a sus clientes, los cuales prefieren su negocio debido a que siempre encuentran productos de calidad y son atendidos amablemente. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a su familia.

Fany desea ampliar su bodega adquiriendo más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Fany is a mother and is 38 years old; she lives with her husband and two children in the district of Tambogrande, an area with semitropical climate, characterized by its fruits like mango, lemons, and passion fruit. It belongs to the Piura region and it is located some four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Fany sells basic household goods and groceries in a store that is located in her home. She offers her customers different products for daily use, Fany’s customers prefer her business nice they can always find quality products and are treated with kindness. The income that Fany receives is used to help her husband get their family ahead.

Fany wishes to expand her business by getting more products that will help her meet her customers’ demands, which is why she has asked for Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva’s field partner) help for a loan of 800 nuevos soles that will help her meet her goals.

loans.use: To expand her business by getting more products that will help her meet her customers’ demands.

loans.name: Yashar

texts.ru:
Yashar M. 48 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Odin iz yeqo detey uchistya v kolledje a druqoy v shkole. Yashar Yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione.

On uje 10 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji pishevix produktov, Yashar ranshe ne imel svoy lichniy maqazin on bral pomesheniye v arendu no 5 let kak on imeyet sobstvennoye pomesheniye(magazin), Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi rasshirit svoyo pomesheniye dlya razmesheniya novix tovarov.
texts.en:
Yashar M. is 48 years old. He is married and has two children. One of his children is going to college and another one goes to school. Yashar is a locally displaced person and has relocated from the town of Fuzulli and now lives in the Fuzulli region. 

He has been in the business of selling food for ten years. Yashar did not have own store before and rented out a space, but since five years ago he has his own store space. Right now he needs 2000 AZN to expand the space of the store to include and offer new items.

loans.use: To expand store space

loans.name: Sarath

texts.en:
Mr. Sarath P., 29, is a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Sreylai Chueng, 28, is a garment factory worker. They have been married since 2005 and have one young son.  

They are currently living with his parents in a village along National Road Number Two, about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh City. He now wants to live in his own home and is asking for his first loan of $500 for build a house for himself and his wife.

loans.use: To add to his own money to build a house for himself and his wife

loans.name: Faith Wanjiku

texts.en:
Faith Wanjiku D. is 39 years old, single and the mother of three children. She lives with her family in Kipsongo, on the outskirts of Kitale. She has operated a dry cleaning (laundry) shop in the same area for one year and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000.

This will be Faith's first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use it to buy a bigger dry cleaning machine so that she can serve her customers better and faster. In the future, she wants to educate her children to the highest level and to own the best dry cleaning place in Kitale.

loans.use: to buy a dry cleaning machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy firewood for a bakery

loans.name: C5611 Terimbere Group

texts.en:
Martha is 40 years old and is a widow with two children, 12 and 15 years old. She is the representative of a group which is called "Terimbere" in the local language. Martha owns a small shop which sells shoes and clothes and she has an experience of five years in her business. She employs one person in her business as a helper so that her business runs well. Martha is the second person in the white shirt on the left side. 

Martha and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to buy more cloth, shoes, African-print cloth, etc. With her increased profits, Martha hopes to build her own house and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional shoes and clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child.  Her child is currently in school.  Ruth has a business selling clothes, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Ruth hopes to generate greater profits and take better care of herself.  In the future, Ruth hopes to open up a retail shop.   

Ruth is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning more on how to protect herself from diseases like HIV/AIDS.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es: Clotilde de 30 años, natural del distrito de Santa Rosa, es una mujer muy  trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Teodoro de 34 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Junto a su esposo Clotilde trabaja todos los días en sus tierras, que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y siembra de todo un poco, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de calidad. Ella principalmente siembra cacao, café, palillo y hojas de  coca, productos que tienen mucha demanda en el mercado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga de insectos que pueden afectar sus plantaciones, ya que en otras ocasiones no lograba cosechar suficiente y sus ganancias eran menos. Lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta la ciudad de San Francisco, pues es ahí donde vende sus productos. Para el futuro de su negocio, espera juntar el dinero necesario para comprar nuevas tierras. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es una socia, muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy orgullosa. Comprará con el crédito solicitado, trampas, e insecticidas para combatir  los insectos quienes para combatir la plaga de insectos que afectan sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Clotilde is 30 years old and a native of the District of Santa Rosa.  She is an extremely hardworking woman who lives in her own home with her husband Teodoro, age 34, and their three beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better life.  Clotilde and her husband work together every day on their land.  Through much effort, they have been able to make their land productive so that they can grow a little bit of everything.  They know that whatever they produce will be of quality.  Clotilde grows primarily cacao, coffee, turmeric, and coca leaves.  These products are in great demand at the market.  What she enjoys most about her work is protecting her crops from plagues of insects that could negatively impact them.  On some occasions, she is not able to achieve a sufficient harvest and thereby earns less income.  Clotilde has been farming for twelve years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her crops to the city of San Francisco to be sold.  In the future, she hopes to save the necessary funds to buy additional farmland.

This is the fifth loan Clotilde has received from MFP.  She feels that this loan will be a great help in developing her business.  Clotilde is known in her Communal Bank for being a very responsible member, a distinction of which she is proud.  The loan she requested will be used to buy traps and insecticides for combating pests that are attacking her crops.

loans.use: To purchase traps and insecticides for combating pests.

loans.name: Aitbubu

texts.en:
Bai Tushum and Partners expresses gratitude to all Kiva lenders who helped Aitbubu J. obtain her first Kiva loan, which was used as intended and repaid.

Aitbubu J. is a 63-year-old farmer who lives in the high-mountain Ak-Tala region in Kyrgyzstan. She is married and has six children. Her family has been engaged in cattle breeding for the past 17 years. It is their only means of subsistence. Today Aitbubu has six cows, twelve goats, four horses, and fourteen sheep. To reduce expenses for the livestock's foraging, she pastures her livestock in the mountainous areas with native grasses. Aitbubu is also engaged in cultivating wheat and holy clover, part of which she sells to local customers. With the revenues from these activities, Aitbubu managed to help her daughter to buy a car. Now Aitbubu is applying for a loan of 25,000 Kyrgyzstani som (KGS) to buy bull calves. With the revenues, she plans to broaden her business by means of breeding. 

Bai Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Manuel Alejandro

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre soltero de 21 años de edad, vive en casa de sus padres, la cual  es propia y cuenta con todos los servicio ( agua, luz y desagüe) en el distrito de Tambogrande, ubicado a una hora del departamento de Piura.  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Manuel  maneja su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas) desde hace 1 años aproximadamente, está actividad lo realiza en su mismo distrito, apesar de la gran cantidad de personas que realizan el mismo trabajo, el trata en lo posible desde muy temprano movilizar una buena cantidad de pasajeros a sus diferentes destinos, y así tenga mayor cantidad de ingresos para solventar sus gastos y necesidades.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1500 nuevos soles y su destino será para el mantenimiento y cambio de algunos repuestos que necesita su mototaxi para seguir brindando un buen servicio a su clientela y mejorar la calidad de vida de él y la de sus padres.
Manuel es una persona responsable y conocido en su distrito  por ser trabajador  y buen hijo por estar al pendiente de lo que le hace falta a sus padres.
texts.en:
Manuel is 21 years old and single.  He lives in his parents' home which they own and which has access to all services (piped water, electricity and sewerage).  It is located in Tambogrande district, one hour from Piura department.  The residents of this district work in farming, livestock raising and handicrafts.

Manuel has been driving a motorcycle taxi (a mode of transport that is used for traveling short distances and which holds a maximum of three people) for approximately one year.  He carries out this work in his own district.  In spite of the large number of people who carry out the same work, Manuel tries to get up very early so that he can transport a large number of passengers to their different destinations in order to make more income which he can use to cover his expenses and needs.

Manuel has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He will use this money to have maintenance work done on his motorcycle and also to buy some spare parts that it needs.  In this way, he will be able to continue providing a good service to his customers and improve his own, and his parents', quality of life.

Manuel is a responsible person who is well known in his district for being hard working and a good son who is always alert to his parents' needs.

loans.use: to have maintenance work done on his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Phalla, age 28, is married and resides with her children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. 

Phalla is employed at the factory, earning an income of $3 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband, who is a driver, earning an income of $5 per day. 

The standard of living has been improved since the family has had these businesses. 

She is requesting a loan of $800 to finish the construction of her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to finish the construction of her house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 52-year-old married man living with his wife. He is from Lebanon. He is an experienced construction worker. He has been involved in the construction field for the past 31 years. In 1985, he started to work independently, sticking with multiple construction projects. Because of his large experience, there are lots of customers and construction entrepreneurs asking for his services. So, he had to hire three part-time employees in order to get all the work done.  

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to replace his old van with a new one. He says that the new van will allow him to facilitate his transportation directly to the projects where he works, especially with the heavy equipment that he carries. In the future, he looks forward to working on bigger projects.

loans.use: to replace his old van with a new one.

loans.name: Fayza

texts.en: Fayza is a 27-year-old mother from Jabalia refugee camp. Her husband is a taxi driver. Fayza has two sons and two daughters. Fayza's husband bought his car three years ago. He paid 50% of its price to the owner and promised the rest after three years. Now that he has to pay the second 50%, he needs $1,500 added to the savings he has. Fayza took out a loan for that amount from FATEN so that her husband can pay for the car. Fayza is a conservative woman, therefore her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: To complete paying for his taxi

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Eduardo owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice to sell. Eduardo has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately PHP 5,000 a month.

Eduardo is requesting a new loan of PHP 16,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure and seeds to grow on his farm. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

In the future, Eduardo hopes that his farming business will improve in order to gain more profit and improve their living situation and ability to engage in business activities.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Milagros, tiene 60 años y vive con su esposo y cuatro de sus cinco hijos.  El mayor de sus cuatro hijos, tiene 18 años y esta estudiando administración de empresa en la Universidad Alas Peruanas. Ella utilizará su préstamo para su negocio de productos de belleza de Unique.  Julia le hace pedidos a el negocio y luego le vende a conocidos, amigos y a instituciones. Empezó a trabajar con la empresa hace cinco años cuando ella se unió a FINCA Perú.
Dice que lo que mas le gusta de la organizacion es que le han inculcado mucho la importancia de la puntualidad. Ella es una socia invicta, lo que significa que nunca llega tarde a las reuniones. Dice que le parece tan importante la puntualidad, que también le ha enseñado a su esposo y a sus hijos. Las charlas y capacitaciones que ofrece FINCA Perú han educado a Julia a ser una mejor madre y esposa. Eventualmente, Julia quiere poder depender de su propia capital y nunca tener que pedir un préstamo de nuevo.
Su meta es terminar de construir su casa y que todos sus hijos tengan carreras profesionales.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the “Milagros” (Miracles) Communal Bank. She is 60 years old and lives with her husband and 4 of their 5 children. The eldest of these 4 children is 18 years old and studying business administration at the Alas Peruanas University. 

She will use her loan for her Unique beauty products business. Julia orders from Unique and then sells the products to people she knows, and to friends, and institutions. She began to work with Unique some 5 years ago when she joined FINCA Peru.

Julia says that what she likes most about FINCA Peru is that it has inculcated in her the importance of punctuality. She is an 'unconquered member,' which means that she has never been late for a meeting. She says that punctuality seems so important to her, that she has taught it to her husband and children. The talks and training offered by FINCA Peru have educated Julia to be a better mother and wife.

Eventually, Julia would like to be able to depend upon her own capital and never have to request a new loan. Her goals are to finish building her house and for all her children to have professional careers.

loans.use: to buy beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is from the village of Nakurdevi, in the southern part of the country. He is 36 years old, married and lives with his wife Anzor, two sons (13 and 11 years old) and brother-in-law. The children go to school. The family lives bellow the poverty line and they receive financial assistance from the state. Nana's brother-in-law is a person with disabilities and he receives social assistance from the government. The average monthly income of the family including the state assistance is 600 Laris. 

Nana and Anzor are leading the agro business for the family. They have three milk cows and sell approximately 60 kg of cheese per month. In addition, they grow potatoes and haricot on a family-owned 1.25-hectare plot of land. Harvested vegetables, as well as cheese, are sold in the village and in Akhaltsikhe (nearby town) open market. 

Nana requested a loan from Credo to purchase a milk cow. He will have more milk and will be able to produce and sell more cheese. Nana and Anzor plan reinvest the increase in profit in family farming activities, in order to expand it.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Donatila

texts.es:
Donatilda, de 47 años, es una mujer entusiasta y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Deonicio de 48 años y sus 03 queridos hijos a quienes desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Donatilda desde muy niña trabajaba en las tierras de sus padres, con sus ahorros acumulados mas la herencia que heredó de sus padres hoy tiene 04 hectáreas de terreno y los trabaja con mucho ahínco, por lo que  ha logrado volverlas muy productivas. Entre los productos que cultiva, son: el cacao, café y hojas de coca, productos que luego los lleva a vender hasta los centros de acopio situados en la ciudad de San Francisco y Quimbiri, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus frutos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse y cubrir con los gastos familiares, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, ya que se siente muy feliz haciéndolo, lleva 23 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros donde secan los frutos, por ello contrata jornaleros para que le apoyen en el traslado. Con el crédito solicitado comprará más plantas de cacao para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en corto tiempo. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este será su crédito numero 12 con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para poder cumplir con sus objetivos, Por otro lado se compromete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en su anterior crédito. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos los integrantes son personas responsables.
Con los 3,000 nuevos soles comprará plantas de cacao para posteriormente injertarlos y sacar buena ventaja de sus frutos en menor tiempo.
texts.en:
47-year-old Donatilda is an enthusiastic and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her partner, 48-year-old Deonicio, and her three beloved children who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.  Donatilda worked on her parents' land from a very young age.  With some savings that she had and her inheritance from her parents, she now owns four hectares of land which she works diligently and has managed to make very productive.  

Amongst the crops that Donatilda grows are cacao, coffee and coca leaf.  She takes her produce and sells it wholesale to middlemen in the towns of San Francisco and Quimbiri.  Her crops have provided her with the income she needs to support herself and cover her family expenses.  What she most enjoys about her work is caring for her crops as she feels very happy doing this.  She has been in this business for 23 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her crops from her farm to the warehouse centers where they are dried.  For this reason, she hires laborers who help her transport her crops. 

Donatilda will use the loan she has requested to buy more cacao plants which she will graft and thereby profit from their fruit quickly.  In the future, Donatilda would like to buy more land so that she can increase her crops.  This will be her 12th loan from MFP and she hopes to receive this small loan so that she can achieve her goals.  For her part, she pledges to make her repayments on time as she did with her previous loan.  

Donatilda enjoys being part of her community bank because all of the members are responsible people.  She will use the 3,000 Peruvian soles to buy cacao plants so that she can graft them and thereby profit from their fruit more quickly.

loans.use: to buy cacao plants

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.es:
Doña Eufemia tiene 69 años de edad a pesar de su edad es una mujer muy trabajadora y constante a diario ella vende corundas en la mañana y por la tarde vende elotes preparados con mayonesa, queso y polvo de chile. Ella tiene haciendo sus corundas (comida regional de su localidad) hace aproximadamente 18 años dice que antes vivía en la ciudad de México pero que su esposo que en ese entonces vivía se la trajo a la población donde vive ya que ahí el le pudo comprar a ella un terrenito donde hicieron su casa. 

Ella a diario se despierta desde muy temprana hora a hacer las corundas que son como tamales rellenos de carne y bañados en salsa de tomate y por las tardes ella se pone a coser sus elotes para salir como a las 6 y venderlos en su colonia en una canasta que ella tiene. 

Doña Eufemia esta pidiendo un crédito para seguir comprando elotes, maíz, leña, ingredientes para hacer las corundas y para preparar los elotes. Ella esta muy agradecida con la financiera por el préstamo por que si tendrá los ingredientes necesarios para vender sus antojitos.
texts.en:
Eufemia, 69, is a very hardworking and persevering woman in spite of her age.  Every day she sells "corundas" (triangle-shaped tamales) in the morning and corn on the cob prepared with mayonnaise, cheese, and chili powder in the afternoon.  She has been making her "corundas" (a regional dish of her town) for approximately 18 years.  She used to live in Mexico City but her husband, who was alive at the time, brought her to the town where she lives now since he was able to buy her some land there, where they built their house.

Every day Eufemia gets up very early to make the "corundas," which are like tamales stuffed with meat and covered with tomato sauce.  In the afternoon she begins to cook her corn on the cob so that by around 6 p.m. she can sell it from a basket in her neighborhood.

Eufemia is requesting a loan to continue buying ears of corn, corn, firewood, and ingredients to make the tamales and prepare the corn on the cob.  She is very grateful to the bank for the loan because she will have the ingredients necessary to sell her snacks.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make "corundas" (tamales) and corn on the cob.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Sonia tiene la edad de 22 años, estudio hasta la secundaria, esta casada con el señor Ramon el cual trabaja constructor de obra, ellos tiene un hijo que estudia el preescolar, ella y su familia viven en una comunidad que se caracteriza por estar en zona cañera.

Ella nos platica que desde hace casi 3 años decidio iniciar con su negocio de venta de sandalias (plastico) porque vio que la situacion economica esta muy dificil asi que penso en ayudar a su esposo con los gasto de su hogar.

Doña Sonia realiza su venta de Sandalias, saliendo a caminar casa por casa con sus amigos y vecinos, tambien nos comenta que en ocasiones levanta pedidos de sus sandalia porque ya es muy conocida en la comunidad y se surte y despues sale a entregar sus pedidos, ella nos dice que gracias a Dios sus productos se venden muy bien.

Ella nos necesita este credito para la compra de sandalias de platicos y posteriormente realizar sus ventas.

Doña Sonia espera que con esta inversion sus negocio prospere pues espera sacar adelante a sus pequeño hijo ofreciendole en un futuro una profesion.
texts.en:
Señora Sonia is 22 years old, and studied up to secondary school level.  She is married to Señor Ramon, who works in construction.  They have one son who attends pre-school, and they live in a community that is characterized by being in a sugarcane area..

She shares with us that she decided about three years ago to start her business selling plastic sandals, because she saw that the economic situation was very tough, and so she thought to help her husband with the household expenses.

Doña Sonia sells her sandals by going door-to-door to her friends and neighbors.  She also tells us that on occasion she takes orders for her sandals, as she is very well-known in the community.  She then fills the orders and delivers them.  She tells us that, thanks be to God, her products sell very well.

She needs this loan for the purchase of plastic sandals that she will later sell.

Doña Sonia hopes that her business will prosper from this investment, and she also hopes that she will be able to move her young son ahead in life, providing him with a profession in the future.

loans.use: to buy plastic sandals that she will later sell.

loans.name: Lito

texts.en:
Lito is a 29-year-old fisherman living in Panglao, Bohol. Lito works hard to support his family of a wife and three children.

He is asking for a loan to purchase a boat engine and fish nets, which will help him continue running his fishing business.

In the future, Lito hopes to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase boat engine and fish nets.

loans.name: Gaby

texts.en: Gaby is a 25-year-old, married man from Lebanon living with his wife. He has been working in the architectural field for the past five years and, at the same time, pursuing his education. Today, he is an experienced architect. His work consists of providing customers with precise external surfaces. He cooperates with his wife who works as a teacher to  meet the family's needs. Today, he is requesting $1100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to be able to purchase his own stamp. He states that this stamp will help him proceed with his business operations independently and will allow him to better promote his services. In the future, he plans to open his own office.

loans.use: to purchase his own stamp

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more stock for the shop

loans.name: Leyiomet

texts.en:
Leyiomet has practiced farming in Naivasha town for the last 7 years. Besides raising livestock as his primary activity, he also operates a quarry business. Leyiomet is 37 years old, and single.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy livestock for zero-grazing and later to sell.

In the future, Leyiomet hopes to buy a big ranch and establish zero-grazing units.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Celirena

texts.en:
Celirena, age 47, cultivates fruit trees to earn a living. She harvests the fruit from her trees and offers them for sale. She has been 18 years in this business. Each month, she earns PhP 5,000 from her business. 

Celirena and her husband have three children and live in Buracan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental.

She has requested a loan of PhP 8,000 to pay for the costs involved in coconut harvesting. Celirena is been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Celirena wants to expand her business and to support her children's educational costs.

loans.use: to pay for the costs involved in coconut harvesting

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
This is Angela, 51, resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Quintelo, a tricycle driver, and a father of her six children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to cover her everyday expenses.  

Angela operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She makes money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Angela dreams to be able to give her whole family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 48-year-old woman from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a mother of six children.

Aisha is trading in accessories and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase more accessories to sell.

Aisha is looking to improve her business and increase her family's income.

Due to culturA. issues, the man in the photo is Aisha's husband.

loans.use: to purchase accessories to sell

loans.name: Fortune Plus Group

texts.en:
Munoko, aged 51, is married and the father of six children. Munoko is the chairman of the community bank named “Fortune Plus,” which comprises 24 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Munoko has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 2008. He runs a general store in the eastern area of Kinshasa. He has acquired solid experience, he works hard, and he applies good management skills in order to realize his dream of one day opening a larger store in his area. He would also like to achieve financial independence through his business, which earns him $10 per day. He works to the best of his abilities and uses his contacts so that he might achieve his goals. With his current loan, Munoko will increase his store's stock of goods by buying items such as soaps, canned goods, and sacks of sugar to resell at a profit.

loans.use: to increase his stock of his goods.

loans.name: I Wayan

texts.en: After receiving his first loan, I Wayan wants to continue to borrow to improve his business. Still with his pig for pork rolls business, I Wayan has a plan to sell the pigs at a market nearby to earn more income. He will use this loan to purchase four piglets and will use the rest of the loan to purchase pig food. His primary goal is to save to support his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase four piglets and food.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32 -year-old Hellen from Krootown in the western area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is single with one child age 14 years. Hellen's child attends school. 

Hellen runs a building material store; she sells cement, zinc, sink, pipe, tile, wash hand basin, and toilet covers. She has been running this business for 7 years. She works at the business for 26 days per month. Her source of income comes from renting out a house. Helen says that the main challenge to this business is that during Christmas the sales are very low.
