Helen has requested a loan in order to purchase more building material such as flood waste, pipe, tile, sink, and cement. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her child's school fees. In the future, she plans to open a private company. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase more building material such as flood waste, pipe, tile,sink, and cement.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es: Shirley, tiene la edad  de 44 años, está casada,  vive con su  hijo y su esposo que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar materiales para la construcción de su gallinero y gallinas para aumentar el número. Ella actualmente tiene su granja establecida y necesita amplíala y a su vez aumentar la cantidad de gallinas poniendo. Ella pretende con este aumento de gallinas tener más producción y así poder abastecer al mercado de la localidad generando así ganancias para su bienestar familiar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Shirley is 44 years old and married.  She lives with her son and husband who are her highest priority.  With the loan she plans to purchase construction materials for her hen house so she can increase the numbers.  She currently has an established farm and needs to expand it, while at the same time increase the quantity of laying hens. She aims to increase her production with more hens and be able to supply the town market, thereby generating more income for the well-being of her family.  

This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR.  She has never taken out other loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered her a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: expand her hen house.

location.town: El Ceibo, San Vito, Coto Brus

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 41 years old, married and has two children.

Liza is in the agricultural business with a livestock retail business in the Philippines. Liza requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Liza has been in the livestock retail business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 25 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Liza would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Esther, a hardworking, dedicated and honest 46-year-old dairy farmer. As the key breadwinner of her family, with a husband and three children, she farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Chuka, in the central region of Kenya. For the past ten years, she has been practicing mixed farming and her primary source of income has been milk, eggs and crop selling. She also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income she earns through farming. 
Esther passionately loves dairy farming but the biggest challenge she faces is feeding her cows and satisfying the largely unsatisfied milk market. She is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit and to buy a chaff cutter. The dairy unit will assist Esther in managing her cows well and also protecting them from the harsh weather conditions. Esther also intends to buy a chaff cutter which is a mechanical device that is used in cutting hay into smaller pieces so that cows wont refuse any part of the food. The selling price for milk is 40 Kenya shillings per liter and through this loan she will be making more money. Esther will increase her income from milk selling and her cows will have more food to eat and never reject food. The key to high yield in milk production is proper feeding of the cows and through this loan, Esther will achieve this. An increase in income will allow Esther to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. Her dream is to continue improving her dairy breeds and increase milk productivity to achieve better living standards. Esther fears that her dreams might not be realized if Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders cease to provide their reliable market channel, credit facility and services that she requires to grow her dairy enterprise.

You can help Esther to be closer to her goals, and a loan will do that.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit and buy a chaffcutter

loans.name: Komi

texts.en:
Mr. Komi G. was born in 1967 at Ahépé Akposso in the prefecture of Yoto. He is a sheetmetal welder and merchant. He is married and is the father of four children. Very talented and full of creativity, he is very successful in his business, which he manages rigorously and efficiently. In his neighborhood, he has built his reputation on the quality of his work. Thanks to his first loan, he became a merchant while at the same time working as a welder. Currently, with an ever-growing and demanding customer base, he would like to improve his work performance and to effectively meet the business opportunities that are presented to him on a daily basis.

To do this, he is applying for a $1,200 loan to acquire welding materials and build a stock of electronics-related items, such as batteries and other items for resale. The implementation of this project will ensure that his children are educated and will improve the welfare of his family.

Translated from French by Daniel KUEY

Monsieur G. Komi est né en 1967 à Ahépé Akposso dans la préfecture de Yoto. Il est tôlier soudeur et commerçant. Il est marié et père de quatre (04) enfants. Très doué et animé d’esprit de créativité, il maîtrise parfaitement son activité qu’il gère avec rigueur et efficacité. La qualité de son travail fait sa réputation dans son quartier. Grâce à un premier crédit qu’il a reçu, il exerce le commerce parallèlement à son métier de soudure. Actuellement, devant une clientèle de plus en plus importante et exigeante, il veut améliorer sa prestation et faire face efficacement à la demande qui s’offre à lui quotidiennement.

Il sollicite pour ce faire un crédit de $1 200 qui servira à acquérir des matériels de soudure, et aussi à l’achat à la revente des matériels électriques, des batteries et autres produits. La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’assurer la scolarisation de ses enfants et d’améliorer le bien-être de sa famille.

loans.use: to acquire welder materials, and the purchase and resell of electrics materials, batteries and other several products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beauty and hair products for her hair salon business

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine is a father of two.  He operates a shop at the village market.  He completed his primary education, but his parents were unable to provide school fees for his secondary education.  He has not undertaken any training pertaining to this business, but learned through doing. He started his business in 2005 when he realized there was an unmet demand for this service in the community. Through his business he has been able to build himself a semi-permanent house, support his family, and his parents’ basic needs.  With a loan from PEMCI, he wishes to increase his shop’s stock and stock more items which he has not been able to due to lack of finances.

loans.use: To improve his shop

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en:
For the past eighteen years, Arthur S., pictured here on the right with his loan officer, Vladimir, has operated a shoe design and repair business in Izyum, Ukraine. By establishing good relationships with leather manufacturers, Arthur has been able to provide high quality products at low prices. Motivated, focused, and cheerful, Arthur has successfully expanded this family business to provide a consistent and stable income for his wife and daughter.

Arthur has requested a loan of $1200 to increase his working capital and purchase additional materials for his business. With the increased profits, Arthur hopes to open a shoe store and hire some employees to help alleviate the problem of unemployment in his community. Additionally, Arthur would like to complete some much needed repairs on his family’s home.

loans.use: Increase capital and buy materials for his shoe design/repair business

loans.name: Ivoga

texts.en: Ivoga never gives up. Even though she is divorced from her husband, she still fights for the betterment of her kids' future. She has sacrificed her life for her kava plantation because it’s the only source of income for her family now that her man has left her with the kids. She is still fighting to continue with this plantation, and she will use the financial support from S.P.B.D. to pay the laborers for their hard work at the plantation. She would like this loan so that she can continue to operate this business and produce income for her poor kids.

loans.use: To pay the laborers

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es:
Fotunata is 48 years old and is the loving mother of three children. Since she began her family alongside Félix, she has dedicated herself to raising livestock, work that she continues to this day with much love and patience. As a result of her self-sacrificing work and the care that she brings to each one of her young cows, she has been able to increase the quantity of her calves so that now she is able to give her children the opportunity to pursue university studies, which apart from everything fill her with pride and much satisfaction. Her next desire is to move into the business of buying and selling cheese, milk, and beef. This business would generate enough additional income to sustain her home and to enable her to pay the university costs of her beloved children. In order to meet her goals Fortunata is relying on your generous heart and asks for a loan in order to begin this new occupation without delay. Fortunata awaits your response in order to finalize her plans and to make her dreams of seeing her dear children become professionals a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Fortunata tiene 48 años y es una amorosa madre de tres hijos; desde que formó su familia junto a Félix, se dedicó a la labor ganadera, trabajo que desempeña hasta el día de hoy con mucho amor y paciencia; como recompensa a su abnegado trabajo y al cuidado que les brinda a cada una de sus generosas vaquitas ha logrado acrecentar la cantidad de sus terneritos con el que ahora puede brindarles a sus hijos la oportunidad de seguir sus estudios universitarios que mención aparte la llenan de orgullo y mucha satisfacción.Su próximo deseo es incursionar en el negocio de compra y venta de queso, leche y carne; negocio que le generará ingresos económicos adicionales para el sustento de su hogar y con el que terminará de cubrir los gastos de estudios superiores de sus queridos hijos.Para concretar sus objetivos la señora Fortunata recurre a tu generoso corazón y solicita un préstamo para iniciar sin demora esta nueva ocupación. “Fortunata espera por tu pronta respuesta para concretar sus planes y hacer realidad los sueños de ver profesionales a sus queridos hijos”

loans.use: Capital investment in order to begin a new business with the help of her dear calves.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Sra. D. A. sells typical Nicaraguan food starting very early in the morning. She has done this work for 25 years, starting with capital of only C$50.00 cordobas.

This activity has allowed her to raise her three children as a single mother. She has sought to sustain her family through this business.

She initially maintained her business through loans from CEPRODEL, who helped her to develop the business. She has paid back 5 loans, and has an excellent credit record.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. D. A. se dedica a la venta de comida tipica nicaraguense desde muy tempranas horas, dedicandose a esta actividad desde hace 25 años , iniciando con un capital de C$50.00 cordobas.

Esta actividad le ha permitido el criar a sus tres pequños hijos, siendo madre soltera busca el sustento de su familia por medio de esta actividad.>p> Inicialmente para mantener su negocio ha prestado a Ceprodel quien le ha ayudado en el desarrollo de su negocio en el cual ya ha cancelado 5 creditos con un ecelente record de credito..

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Kamuli C1 (C) Group

texts.en: Yudaya is a 42-year-old widow. She has five children. She has a hardware business where she sells equipment and supplies. She intends to buy a mortocycle (boda boda) with the extra profits.

loans.use: To stock her hardware store

loans.name: Abdunaim

texts.en:
G. Abdunaim is 36 years old, and he is married with four children.

Abdunaim is a cattleman, and has been in this business since childhood, when he used to help his father. As he had been trained by his father, after he had served in the army, he purchased cattle for raising. Currently, he has 1 cow with calf and 1 bull. The business is quite stable and generates the main income for the family.

Now, Abdunaim is planning to purchase one more bull. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting 875.00 US Dollars for the term of 12 months. This is the first loan for Abdunaim and he promises not to let down those who have trusted and supported him.

loans.use: Purchase one bull for raising and then selling.

loans.name: Vien

texts.vi:
Mrs N. T. Vien, 38, lives in the town of Cho, N. Xa. Her main occupation is animal husbandry. Her family's living condition is difficult. She has 4 children to feed so it's quite a big task. She makes about 70000 VND a day (~4.40 usd). She has never borrowed money before. For this loan her objective is to invest in her animal husbandry business. She really hopes to obtain this loan, she will be able to pay it back.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chi N. T. Vien,hien nay 38tuoi dang sinh song tai N. Xa-T. tran Cho.Chi song bang nghe chan nuoi va lam moi truong.Gia dinh chi rat kho khan,hon nua chi lai dang phai nuoi 4con.Ma muc thu nhap trung binh mot ngay cua chi chi dat toi muc 70nghindong/ngay.Tinh den gio chi chua tham gia vay von o dau.Muc dich vay cua chi la de dung cho cong viec chan nuoi cua gia dinh chi.Chi rat mong muon co the vay von cua cong ty vi de hoan tra hon nua lai rat de de tiep can.

loans.use: animal husbandry

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a 35 year old woman who works and lives in the Beirut suburbs. She has 3 children.

Sonia sells home products. This is the first time she has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. She needs a loan to buy new merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Seourn Kheav Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Seourn K. is the group leader in Tie Pram Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a stove maker and she now wants to expand her business. She needs to ask for a loan to buy clay to make stoves. What money is left over will be used to buy firewood for resale.

Mrs. Seourn K., 48, is the mother of three children, one of whom is working in a garment factory while the others are studying at school. Her husband, Vanna Oak, is a construction worker in the village; additionally, he also goes to find work outside the village. Last year, Mrs. Seourn K. obtained a loan to buy clay to make stoves for selling to middlemen.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clay to make stoves for sale

loans.name: Fuente Para El Desarrollo Group

texts.en:
Elisa is a talented and dynamic young woman with two children, ages two and eight. She lives in the beautiful town of Samana. Elisa wants to start a business selling clothes and shoes with this loan. Elisa is excited to start maK. an income to support her family, and wants to continue expanding her business in the future. With profits from this loan she will be able to buy abetter quality of food for her children and will also have the ability to buy medicine when they are ill. Elisa told us that she loves visiting her church, and her favorite food is “sancocho”, a very popular Dominican soup.

This loan will also go to help fund the businesses of the other group members. In a group loan, each member helps to support and guarantee the loans of the other members.

Thanks for supporting this group of entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To buy clothing and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Osarienmen

texts.en: Osarienmen E. is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Benin City with her family. She travels to Lagos and the Asaba main market to buy clothes and sells them to her customers in Benin City. She needs the loan amount of $1,200 to buy more female clothes for sale. Osarienmen is a LAPO client. She expresses her gratitude to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: To buy more female clothes for sale

loans.name: Chhean

texts.en:
Mr. Chhean C., 40, and his wife, Mrs. Chea Un, 47, who live in a small village off of National Road Two about seventeen kilometers south of Phnom Penh, were married in 1988 and have four  children: two sons and two daughters. One of their children is a garment factory worker, two children study in local school, and the youngest one stays at home.

Mr. Chhean has been a mason since 1991. He is also a fisherman, acquiring his catch from the village lake for both sale and family consumption. His wife stays at home taking care of the children. Fishing season is coming up soon, so Chhean is requesting a loan of of $200 to purchase a boat to continue his fishing.

loans.use: To purchase a boat for fishing.

texts.es: Doña Jamileth tiene 29 años de edad, es casada, con una niña de 6 seis años de edad, su esposo trabaja  como bodeguero en una librería, la Sra. Jamileth se levanta temprano para hacer el desayuno a su esposo y los quehaceres del hogar ya que por la tarde sale a ofrecer sus productos a distintas oficinas, su actividad es la venta de cosmético al contado y al crédito, ella trabaja con pedido ya que estos productos vienen en catálogos pero siempre tiene para ofertar a sus clientes. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para invertir  mercadería para la captación de clientes así como hacer más grande su negocio.
texts.en:
Jamileth is 29 years old, she is married and has a 6 year old daughter. Her husband works as a warehouseman in a bookstore. Jamileth wakes up very early to make breakfast for her husband and to do housework. In the afternoon she goes out to sell her products to the offices in the area. She sells cosmetics. She usually takes orders since she has to order the products via catalog. She accepts payments in cash or in installments. Jamileth also likes to keep a stock of products to offer to her clients.

The loan will be used to purchase merchandise to expand her business.


Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Eveliza

texts.es:
Eveliza tiene 29 años. Ella se dedica al alquiler de llamadas telefónicas de celulares, desde hace un año, además por las noches ella tiene un puesto de comida ambulante. Anteriormente Eveliza trabajaba en un taller de costura, sin embargo no pudo seguir trabajando, ya que tuvo una hija y tenía que cuidarla.
El último crédito que ella recibió, lo empleo en comprar equipos celulares para su negocio. Ahora ella necesita otro crédito para comprar una congeladora, ya que piensa vender helados y bebidas gaseosas.
texts.en:
Eveliza is 29 years old. For the past year, she has worked renting out cell phones for making phone calls. She also works as a food vendor at night. She used to work in a seamstress' shop, but then her daughter was born, so she had to quit so that she could take care of the baby. The last loan Evelita took out was used to buy cell phones for her business. She plans to use this loan to buy a freezer, because she would like to start selling ice cream and sodas.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a freezer to sell ice cream and sodas

loans.name: La Union Hace La Fuerzas Group

texts.en:
La Union Hace La Fuerzas is a group of 15 women looking to receive their second small loans. All the women used their first loans to start very small businesses, and so far all member have tasted a little success. With their second loans, they all plan to grow their businesses and hope to increase their incomes.

Daphne D. is the leader of this group. She was chosen because of her work ethic, and everyone in the group trusts her leadership. She started a very small clothing business and is hoping to eventually earn enough to open her own small clothing store. Daphne is the proud mother of 5 children, and she dreams of being able to travel with them. She feels that these loans are the tools that will help her reach her dreams.

On behalf of Daphne, the group, and Esperanza International: Thank you for your support!

loans.use: Buy used clothing to re-sell

loans.name: Crisanto

texts.es: Crisanto tiene 57 años, es conviviente, tuvo 6 hijos, de los cuales vive con 5 de ellos. Desde que tuvo conciencia ha visto a sus padres cultivar la tierra, fue la agricultura quien cubrió sus necesidades básicas, por ello le tiene mucha gratitud y jamás dejaría de sembrar, además si se trabaja a conciencia se puede ganar al doble de lo invertido, nos dice. Ahora, como no es tiempo de cultivar, está trabajando como chofer en una minibús de transporte de pasajeros, realiza esta actividad cuando requieren de sus servicios, pero esto no le es tan rentable como sembrar la papa, por ello que prefiere mil veces la agricultura. Empezó a trabajar con Prisma hace 4 años, este es su 7mo préstamo, y nunca se atrasó en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará fertilizantes para su chacra de papas, lo que le costará un aproximado de S/.2.500 a S/. 3.000.
texts.en:
Crisanto is a married 57-year-old father with 6 children, 5 of whom live with him. As far back as he can remember, he has witnessed his parents cultivate the land. Agriculture has always covered his basic needs, which is why he is so grateful and will never stop farming. Furthermore, he says that if one works with dedication, one can earn double what was invested. Since it is no longer growing season, he is currently working as a minibus driver. He does so whenever his services are required, but it is not as lucrative as growing potatoes, which is why he prefers agriculture a thousand times over. He started working with Prisma 4 years ago. This is his seventh loan, and he has never fallen behind on his payments. With this money, he will purchase fertilizer, which will cost anywhere from 2,500.00-3,000.00 PEN, for his potato farm.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for potato farm

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
GraceT. is one of the executive members of Kilibaki lending group in Jinja. She is a devoted and hard-working lady with a business of selling old clothes in markets as well as running a tailoring business for 6 years. She is happy that now she has a larger bale of clothing to sell and also she now owns two sewing machines with which she does her tailoring work.

Grace has also been able to acquire a bicycle which complements her tailoring business by serving for collecting materials as well as distributing the already sewn clothing to the respective owners. Grace needs another loan to help with buying more used clothes as well as materials for sewing; the profits will help her to send her kids back to school next year.

loans.use: More used clothing and materials for sewing

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes O. is a 53 years old trader.  She is divorced and the mother with two girls. One is married and one is in junior high school. Agnes trades in onions, tomatoes and pepper etc. at a village in Nkawkaw where she lives. Agnes belongs to a village bank called ‘Divine’. She requests a loan to enable her to buy increased stock of tomatoes, onions, pepper to scale up the business. She hopes to increase her savings to support her child's education to give her a future and hope.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of onions, tomatoes and pepper.

loans.name: Assane

texts.fr: Assane habite dans la ville de ngekhok il est agée de 37 ans il est marié et pere de famille .son activité principale est la vente de lait caillé .Il est ussie d'une famille vendeur de lait de pere en fils,il a fait de ce metier son principale activité .Il est le principale fournisseur de lait de la ville.Les revenus trires de son commerce lui permet d 'entretenir sa famille.le pret sollicité  lui permettra de renforcer ses capacités de  production pour faire face à la forte demande.
texts.en:
Assane lives in the city of Ngekhok. He is 37 years old, married, and the father of a family. He works mostly selling curdled milk. He is also from a family of milk merchants, from father to son, and this trade is his principal business. He is the main provider of milk in town. The income derived from his commerce enables him to support his family. The requested loan will enable him to boost his production capacity for coping with the strong demand.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
M.
Empezó vendiendo como ambulante hace más de diez años. Ella ya tenía experiencia en la venta de frutas, es por eso que cuando le nació la idea de poner un negocio propio no dudó en dedicarse a la venta de frutas. Al inicio solo contaba con un puesto ambulante, donde además de frutas vendía también gaseosas. Poco a poco fue creciendo en mercadería hasta que adquirió un puesto propio en el mercado.
Ella es madre de tres hijos, una de veintitrés, el segundo de veinte y el último de tan solo cinco años. Ella y su esposo, quien es chofer de taxi, además de cubrir los gastos se ocupan de la educación y crianza de su menor hijo ya que los dos mayores ya son independientes económicamente. 
Hoy en día goza de bastante clientela y una buena ubicación en el mercado. Más adelante, le gustaría poner una tienda en su propia casa.
texts.en:
More than ten years ago, Santos began working as a street vendor. She already had experience selling fruit, and so when she got the idea to start her own business she immediately decided to sell fruit. At first, she only had a cart, from which she sold soft drinks as well as fruit. Little by little, her business grew until she got her own stand in the market. She now has a substantial customer base and a good location in the market. In the future, she would like to have a shop in her own home.

Santos is the mother of three children, ages 23, 20, and 5. She and her husband, a taxi driver, work to cover their household expenses and those of raising and educating their youngest child, since the older two children are already financially independent.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fruit and soft drinks

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra tiene 39 años, vive con su madre y sus 2 hijos en su propia casa. Desde hace 6 años tiene una tienda donde no solo ofrece productos comestibles, sino también útiles de escritorio, y ha implementado el servicio de llamadas telefónicas, Internet y fotocopias. Este negocio está ubicado en su misma casa, a pocos metros de varias instituciones donde los empleados son sus principales clientes. Sandra recibe el apoyo en la atención de sus hijos y su madre, que son su brazo derecho. Su tienda esta abierta todo el día en la semana, los domingos medio día, que es cuado descansa. Este negocio es un sostén económico familiar y Sandra tiene planes de seguir creciendo con su tienda, hasta que se convierta en un autoservicio con mayor sustentabilidad. Es la segunda vez que  tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una de las máximas colaboradoras de su banco comunal y la que alienta a seguir desarrollando un trabajo unido. Con el dinero que solicita comprará abarrotes para implementar su tienda como arroz, azúcar y tarros de leche.
texts.en:
Sandra is 39 years old, and lives with her mother and her two children in their own house. For six years she has had a store where she not only offers food products, but also writing supplies, and has added telephone, Internet, and photocopying services. Her business is located in her home, only a few meters away from various institutions whose employees are her primary customers. Sandra's children, who are her right-hands, help her run her business. Her store is open all day during the week, and for a half day on Sundays, which is the day she rests. This business is the sole source of income for her family and Sandra has plans to continue growing her store until it runs itself and is more self-sustaining.

This will be Sandra's second loan with MFP, and she is one of the best members of her communal bank, and one of the primary forces motivating them to continue developing a united effort. With the money she requests she will buy groceries to stock in her store, such as rice, sugar, and tins of milk.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking up staple goods in her store

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Mrs. Fely P. is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old and a widow with seven children: three of them are married, two are now working and two are studying. Her life as a widow is full of challenges specially with the finances.

She decided to start a business in 1997 with minimal starting capital. With patience and hard work, she has made it until now. With the help of Paglaum MPC she is able to access additional capital that will enable her to purchase goods in volume at a lower cost. Her customers are the employees of different offices, neighbors, relatives and friends.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics in volume

loans.name: 01-Sơn Vạn Group

texts.en:
Chung N. Thị is a 44 years-old-woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. Chung is the leader of a five member group accessing a loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 1 Son Van (16.05.001).




Chung is married and has two  school-age children. To make a living, Chung owns and operates a business venture in in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising livestock. Chung has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 VND a month from these activities




In 2004, Chung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (TCVM) to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and her ability to engage in business activities. Chung has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,442,600 VND from TCVM. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. She is now requesting a loan of 3,079,800 VND which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by the borrower from TCVM. Chung plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.





About the Other Borrowers in the Group:




1.  H. Thị Dung (48) is a 33-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.




2.  T. Thị Lệ (49) is a 30-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.




3.  N. Thị Sáu (1) is a 48-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a butcher shop.




4.  N. Thị Hiếu (4) is a 41-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.




About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.




Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.




Chung N. Thị (30) là 44 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Chung là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 1 Sơn Vạn (16.05.01).




Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Chung thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 3 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Chung kiếm được khoảng 1.500.000 VND.  Vào 2004, Chung đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Chung đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 2.442.600 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3.079.800 VND.




Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.




Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:




1.  H. Thị Dụng (48) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.




2.  T. Thị Lệ (49) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.




3.  N. Thị Sáu (1) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng T.t.




4.  N. Thị Hiếu (4) là 41 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.




Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:


Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.




*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: İlqar

texts.en:
For the past 15 years, İlqar A. has worked in agriculture, raising animals. He raises cattle. He attends carefully to his animals' needs since, thanks to them, he can cover his household expenses. İlqar is married and has two children.

For İlqar, it is very important to continue to work raising his animals. He is currently seeking a loan in order to purchase additional cattle so that, in the future, he can earn more money. The additional income will help his family. We appreciate your support for İlqar’s projects.

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Ouyètiè 8 Group

texts.fr:
Ouyètiè 8 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Nitabogoro de la ville de Koutiala région de Sikasso(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies avec  en moyenne 29 ans et au moins 4 enfants. 
Elles excellent principalement  dans la culture de l’arachide et du mil.
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe Ouyètiè 8 ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide et de mil, des petits matériels et des intrants pour la culture, au grand marché de Koutiala. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Koutiala et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe Ouyètiè 8 comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice moyen de 50 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Ouyètiè 8 is a group of married women of the village of Nitabogoro in Koutiala City, Region of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They live in large traditional extended families and average 29 years of age and at least 4 children each. They excel mainly in the growing of peanuts and millet. Concerned about making their farms profitable, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program two years ago. After having correctly repaid the first loan, they are now on their second farm loan. The current loan will be used to buy a sufficient quantity of seeds for planting peanuts and millet; some minor supplies and equipment; and some fertilizers and the like, for farming. These items are procured at the grand marketplace of Koutiala. Following the off-season, the crops are stored for a time, so that they gain in value. And then they are sold at the same marketplace and at surrounding marketplaces at the retail level (often wholesale), in cash transactions, to customers generally from large cities. The group members each intend to realize, after selling their produce, an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA, which will be used to repay the loan and to cover common family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seeds, and minor supplies and equipment

loans.name: Mary Kim

texts.en:
Mary Kim D. P. is from the village of Migcanaway, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old. Mary Kim is married and has three small children. To make a living, Mary Kim raises fish for sale. Mary Kim has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mary Kim joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Kim is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair fishing net. This will be the first loan taken out by Mary Kim from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her equipment. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair fishing net

loans.name: Yanire

texts.es:
La señora Yanire S. G. tiene 32 años de edad, vive en el distrito de las Delicias , provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta tercero de secundaria, tiene 1 hijo de 8 años de edad quien depende económicamente de ella.
Yanire se dedica a la venta de huevos en el mercado y en la tienda de su casa. También distribuye en distintas tiendas de Moche y las Delicias
Con su primer crédito de 300 soles compro mas huevos, jabas y bolsas para despachar los productos.
 Con este crédito de 1,300 soles, lo invertirá en su negocio, en la compra de huevos y productos de abarrotes como: arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, entre otros; los cuales vende en la tienda de su casa.
Yanire   tiene como sueño comprar un puesto en el segundo piso del mercado de Moche.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yanire Sanchez G. is 32 years old and lives in the Las Delicias district in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Peru. This businesswoman finished her studies through the 3rd year of high school; she has one son who is 8 years old and depends on her for his well-being. Yanire sells eggs in the market and in the small shop in her home. She also distributes the eggs to various shops in Moche and Las Delicias. With her first loan of ~$100, she purchased more eggs, beans, and bags to distribute her products. With this $450 loan, she will invest further in her business, purchasing eggs and other groceries like rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc., which she sell in the shop in her home. Yanire would like to eventually have a stall on the second floor of the Moche market.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of eggs and other groceries: rice, sugar, noodles, milk, etc. which she sells in the shop in her home

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr:
Cette femme vit dans le quartier d’adidogomé avec son époux et ses 04 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente d’objets plastiques. elle veut agrandir son stock et sollicite de WAGES un premier crédit pour acheter diverses assiettes en plastiques, des seaux en plastiques et divers autres objets plastiques. Elle pourra ainsi grossir ses recettes journalières.
Avec le revenu de son commerce elle contribue aux dépenses de sa famille.
texts.en:
This woman lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood with her husband and her four children. She sells plasticware to earn a living. She wants to expand her stock and is asking WAGES for a first loan to buy various plastic plates, buckets, and various other plastic goods. Thus she will be able to expand her daily receipts.

With the revenue from her business, she contributes to supporting her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of goods made of plastic

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: La señora Amelia es cliente antigua, en su historial crediticio no tiene dias de atraso,su esposo se dedica a la produccion de enaguas y deportivos y ella a la venta de esas prendas, en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad de El Alto, tiene 3 hijos que actualmente estan estudiando, ellos piensan trabajar fuerte para construir un patrimonio para sus hijos, el destino del credito es la compra de rollos de encaje.
texts.en:
Amelia is an old client; in her credit history she shows no delayed payments. Her husband dedicates himself to the production of traditional underskirts and sports clothing, and she sells these garments at the different markets in the city of El Alto. She has 3 children that are currently studying. Amelia and her husband plan to work hard to build a patrimony for their children. The loan will be used to purchase rolls of lace.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric and lace for production.

loans.name: Inocenta

texts.es:
Inocenta es socia del Banco Comunal Orcasitas II.
Inocenta es casada, tiene 48 años y 1 hijo, Inocenta junto a su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de ladrillos de manera artesanal, sus ventas los realiza a los intermediarios, además Inocenta vende comida los días domingos.
Inocenta necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido para labrar los ladrillos.
Los sueños de Inocenta son ampliar sus negocios y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Inocenta is a member of the Orcasitas II cooperative bank. Inocenta is 48 years old and has 1 son. Together with her husband, she dedicates herself to making hand-crafted bricks. She makes her sales through intermediaries. In addition, Inocenta sells food on Sundays. Inocenta needs a loan of 900 soles to invest in making her bricks. Inocenta’s dreams are to expand her businesses and to continue forging ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make bricks.

loans.name: Look Up To God Group

texts.en:
Look Up To God is a group of  5 borrowers led by Solomon G., 37 years old and a 10th grade drop-out due to lack of support. He is married with 5 children aged 6-16 years old and also cares for 2 siblings.

Solomon lives and work on Gurley Street, East of downtown Monrovia, Liberia. Gurley Street is known to be a very rough street, where local night clubs, motels and liquor shops are located, therefore most parents in that community don’t care for their children well, which has a negative impact on their lives.

Solomon’s business is buying used clothing bales wholesale and selling them retail to the residents of Gurley Street. He started this business with a small amount of cash but with courage and seriousness, he is making his business move forward. Solomon has been running this business for 10 years and this business has been putting food on the table for him and his family for the past years. 

Solomon’s good human relations with his customers have allowed his business to reach this far. He needs this loan to purchase more used clothing bales wholesale to grow this business into a bigger one. His goal is to own a bigger shop and expand his business and he also dreams of taking good care of his family and giving them good living conditions and medical care so as to have long lives.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing bales wholesale

loans.name: Teo's Group

texts.en:
N. Teo is the leader of her lending group in Kamwokya. She is shown in the small photo though not in the group photo.

Teo is the single mother of four children and she single-handedly helps to take care of their needs as well as paying their school fees. She is a businesswoman involved in the sale of fish and has supplied to companies and traders in Kamwokya, Ntinda and Bukoto for twelve years.

Teo is requesting a loan to be able to buy more fish for her business expansion so that she will be able to make more profits. She is so grateful for her loans because they have really stood in for her husband and hence closed the gap.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Leodiza

texts.en:
Leodiza B. is from the town of Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old. Leodiza is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Leodiza owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling vegetables in the local community. Leodiza has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leodiza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leodiza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Leodiza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Penh

texts.en:
S. O., age 37, is a widowed mother of three school-aged children. In the beginning of 2000, S. O. built a small store in front of her home. In her shop, she sells a few grocery items to the neighbors who live near her house in the village. Her children help her to sell groceries. 

In addition, she always has one pig that she is raising. She keeps the pig in a stall next to her house. Although she has sold her mature pig, she doesn't have the money to buy another, so she is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase piglet to raise.

loans.use: To purchase piglet to raise

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice sells various kinds of foodstuff and drinks; she has been in this trade for the past three years. This she does to meet her daily needs. She is very hard working. 

She hopes to increase her sales, make more profit that will enable her assist her husband in supporting the family and pay for the children's education. She hopes for loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thanks for the support. Her greatest problem is the power supply.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Heb

texts.en:
Heb, 59, is married mother of three children. Two of her children are grown and have established their own households. Heb operates a medium grocery store in front of her home, selling cooking ingredients, as a means to support her family. Her husband helps her operate the store and also provides rice milling services for an additional profit.

To earn additional income, Heb will use her loan to buy piglets (and feed) to raise in her ready-built pigpen. She will use the rest of her loan to obtain more product inventory.

loans.use: To buy piglets (and feed) to raise.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.en:
Blanca is a 40-year-old woman from Santa Barbara, Heredia, a poor region in the Central Valley of Costa Rica. She is a single mother of two children who completed 9th grade. In the past, Blanca has received two previous loans of 500,000 colones,each that were repaid on time and in full. This will be her third loan from Fundacion Mujer and she is happy to be applying for a larger amount than she has in the past (650,000 colones).

The name of Blanca´s business is "Confecciones M." (M. Apparel). Blanca makes and alters clothing. Her specialty is creating children's pajamas. She makes more profit from selling pajamas than from other types of clothing. She also makes women’s clothes (blouses, skirts) and offers various customized products.

Blanca sells her clothes to a distributor who comes to her home in Santa Barabara every 15 days. The distributor purchases children’s pajamas (for ages 12 and under) and women’s clothing to sell throughout Costa Rica. Blanca has been in this business for 20 years. She opened her business with an initial investment of 125,000 colones from loans from a friend and her sister. In a good month, she can earn 500,000 colones; in a bad month, only 300,000. Blanca plans to use this loan to purchase raw materials and invest in a new sewing machine.

Blanca has been sewing all her life. She has been making clothes for as long as she can remember. She is a hard-working woman who dedicates 12 hours each day to her business. The income she earns from sewing is the only source of income for her family. Her goal is to open a boutique where she can sell children's clothes. 

Due to the high costs of raw materials, Blanca has not been able to re-invest in her business. Her lack of necessities, such as elastic, fabrics, sewing thread, and other raw materials, have hampered her businesses growth. This loan will enable Blanca to purchase larger quantities of raw materials from her suppliers in San Jose. By purchasing in volume, she is confident that she will be able to secure better prices. With this loan, Blanca hopes to generate more income and provide a higher standard of living for her children.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Blanca from  Costa Rica

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Mrs. Ry O. lives in Trapeang Tonle village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who cultivates rice on land that she owns. Her husband, Mr. Nin Noun, is farmer who owns a rice mill and breeds pigs. Since pig breeding is going well, he wants to expand the business so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for his business. Mrs. Ry O. has four children: one works at TPC, a small company, two attend the local school and one stays home to help with housework.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for her husband's business

loans.name: Assa

texts.en: Assa is a 38-year-old married mother of three children aged 15 to 20 years.  All her children go to school and take care of additional family members. She owns a four-room house where she lives with four people. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day.  Assa sells handicrafts in the Nakulabye market. To get handicrafts to sell, she travels to and from shops at the National Theatre, which is one of the busiest wholesale markets for handicrafts in Uganda. She works six days a week in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala.  She serves an average of 10 customers a day and sells to all categories of people at retail and wholesale prices.  Her greatest monthly expenses include feeding the family, school fees for her children, and monthly market dues for her business. Her major business challenge is transportation of bales of products like mats, tablecloths, and hats.   Assa has been in this business for five years and with MCDT for twelve years. She is currently on her twelfth loan, working with the same group mates. Assa joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. She wants to use this loan to buy more handicrafts.  She aspires to grow her business and start selling at wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more handicrafts for resale.

loans.name: Kayed

texts.en: Kayed has owned a butcher shop since 1998, with a previous 20 years of experience in this field. He's married with 2 unemployed children. He is well known in the whole region for the delicious and clean product types he offers to his clients. His target is to continue his children's education until university. Kayed is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy cattle in order to increase his business productivity.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Rosa Martínez

texts.es: Rosa Martínez B. D. M. D. 54 años D. edad, resiD. en el Municipio D. Zacatecoluca, ubicado en el departamento D. La Paz. Rosa vive junto a su hija  y un nieto D. 8 años D. edad, el cual se dedica a estudiar educación básica. La señora Rosa posee una tienda, en la cual comercializa productos D. primera necesidad para el hogar, como también alimenticios. DesD. hace 22 años que ella posee su negocio, el cual le ha permitido salir adelante, y poder brindarle todo lo necesario a su hija. Rosa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para surtir el negocio, comprando más productos como: huevos, pan, embutidos, y otros más los cuales las personas solicitan mucho en la tienda. Esto lo hace con el fin D. poder aumentar sus ventas, ya que son estas las que le permiten contar con una vida digna, en la cual pueda contar con todo lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
Rosa Martínez B. D. M., 54, lives in Zacatecoluca, La Paz department, with her daughter and an 8-year-old grandson, who is in elementary school. Rosa has a grocery store where she sells food and basic household items. She has had the store for 22 years and it has maD. it possible for her to get ahead in life and to proviD. everything needed to her daughter. Rosa is asking for funding to stock her store buying such items as: eggs, bread, canned goods and other items that are in high demand by her customers. She does this aiming to increase sales since they are what allow her to have a dignified life in which she can count on having her basic needs met.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Tit

texts.en:
Mrs. Tit D. owns and operates a small store to sell café to her neighbors who live in the village. She is age 51, a married woman, and the good mother of six children. Tit D. was married many years ago to Sokha, age 50, who is a motorcycle taxi driver. Two of her children are married and have already started new homes, and the remaining four are single. To help with the responsibilities of the family, two daughters work sewing clothes in a garment factory. She is a low-income citizen living in the best territory of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

Tit D.'s café shop is too small and limits her clients. She would like to seek a loan on Kiva through HKL’s project. She will be using her loan to help upgrade to a larger shop. The rest of the loan will be used to buy accessories for her café enterprise.

loans.use: To upgrade to a larger size shop and buy accessories

loans.name: Saira's Group

texts.en:
Tahira wants a loan to buy construction supplies (sand, cement and bricks) for her construction supply-selling business. Kalsoom wants a loan to buy medicines for her medical store. Sugran wants a loan to buy an electric sewing machine for her sewing business. Amna wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Shama parveen wants a loan to buy plastic toys for her toy-selling business. Saira is the group leader of the afore-mentioned ladies. They all come from a city called Borewala, famous for its shrines in Pakistan. 

Saira's husband's name is M. R. and he is a mechanic and runs his own motor-workshop. His shop is located in the center of the market where it's the busiest place for customers. He has ten years of experience in this business.  Saira is applying for a loan to buy repair tools for her husband’s motor-workshop.

loans.use: To buy repair tools for motor-workshop

loans.name: Jonah K.

texts.en:
Jonah is 39 years old, married and has four children who all go to a nearby school. He has been farming for the last 18 years now and counts himself lucky to have been introduced to KADET where he can access loans.

With this first loan, he intends to buy seeds to plant on his farm and to buy more tea seedlings to increase his tea farm.  He hopes to increase his tea production in order to earn more income.

His future plan is to invest in modern farming to get more income to educate all four children and build a better house.

loans.use: To buy seeds for planting and increase the tea bush

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards and phone accessories to sell

loans.name: 10 De Abril Group

texts.es:
El Banco De Emprendimiento 10 DE ABRIL es nuevo y esta conformado por 8 integrantes todos viven en la misma zona de San Jose en el barrio de la Peñita, cuentan con negocio propio hace muchos años.

La Presidenta es la Sra. Julia, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, tiene su puesto de venta y entrega tambien por pedido y aveces a credito, ya tiene muchos clientes y la Sra es muy conocida en el barrio, fue elegida como la presidenta del Banco por su responsabilidad y solidaridad que demostro a sus compañeras del banco, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos pequeños, siempre velando por el bienestar de su familia, con el dinero del credito comprara mercaderia al por mayor ya que por esta temporada tiene muchos pedidos.

todas las socias de este banco de emprendimiento en su gran mayoria son padres de familia y son personas muy luchadoras ellos tienen el sueño de que sus negocios sean prosperos, ellos se encuentran agradecidos con la institucion por brindarles la confianza y la oportunidad  de sacar un credito.
texts.en:
The 10 de Abril Communal Bank is new. It is comprised of eight members. They all live in the same area of San Jose in the Peñita neighborhood. They have had their own business for many years. Julia is the president. She sells groceries. She has a sales stand, and she also delivers by order. Sometimes she sells on credit. She has a lot of customers, and she is very well known in the neighborhood. She was elected as president of the bank because of her responsibility and the solidarity she has shown with her colleagues in the bank. She is married and has two small children. She is always watching out for the well being of her family. She will use the money from the loan to buy wholesale merchandise. She has had a lot of orders this season. Most of the members of the bank have children, and all of them are tenacious people. They have the dream that their businesses will prosper. They are grateful to the institution for having faith in them and for the opportunity to get a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Juan Arcenio

texts.es: Juan es de 22 años de edad, es soltero, se dedica a elabora cortes típicos de la localidad, en esta actividad tiene 5 años de estar trabajando, necesita el financiamiento para comprar un mueble que le será de mucho beneficio, sus referencias personales indican que es una persona responsable y colaborador, con deseos de superar.
texts.en:
Juan, 22, is single and manufactures traditional costumes of the area; he has been in this line of work for 5 years. He needs financing to buy a piece of furniture that will be of great use for him. His personal references indicate that he's a responsible, cooperative person who wants to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a piece of furniture.

loans.name: Awurade Mo Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Susana describes herself as faithful. She is 28 years old and she is the leader of the “Awurade mo” (translated as 'thank you Lord') borrower group. Susana lives in a town near Berekum and sells smoked fish in the community market. She has been running her fish business for 6 years. She is excited to be taking out this loan, which she will use to purchase baskets of smoked fish. 

Susana is married to a mason and together they have three children ages 2, 4, and 9 years old. She dreams of becoming a fish wholesaler and hopes to sell enough fish to be able to provide better education for her children. As the leader of the borrower group, Susana ensures that all members attend meetings and submit their repayments.

loans.use: To purchase baskets of smoked fish

loans.name: Benkadi 2 Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI 2 est un regroupement de femmes mariées du village de Toura Nabitokan dans l’ex l’arrondissement de Kimparana de la préfecture de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali) qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans, 6 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide. 
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe  ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 3 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur troisième prêt de campagne.
ADA D. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semence d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants, au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, sa récolte est stockée pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elle ait de la valeur avant d’être vendue  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses  courantes  de la famille.
texts.en:
Benkadi 2 is a group of married women from the village of Toura Nabitokan in the ex neighborhood of Kimparana in the district of San in the Ségou region (4th administrative region of the republic of Mali) who live in traditional families. They are on average 45 years old, with six children, and grow peanuts. In order to ensure that their agricultural investments are profitable, the members of this group decided three years ago to become active in the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso. After having reimbursed previous loans, they are looking for a third loan. Ada D. plans to use her loan in order to purchase peanut seeds, materials and inputs from the large market of Kimparana. After winter, her products are stored for a certain amount of time in order to ensure they are valuable before being sold in the large market of Kimparana as well as in other markets nearby. They are often sold in large quantities to customers from other large cities. The members of the group hope to each realise a profit of 35 000 FCFA (approximately 67 USD) which they will use to reimburse the loans and interests on the loans and their family's expenses.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds, inputs and other materials

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: G. ama est une femme très dynamique,  elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille à adidogomé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail de pagnes, chaussures et sacs de femme.elle fait ce commerce depuis 2000, pour avoir plus de client il fait ce commerce de façon ambulante. voulant gonfler son stock elle sollicite un 3ème crédit pour l'achat de 5 cartons de sacs, 10 cartons de chaussures.
texts.en:
Ama G. is a very dynamic lady. She is married and mother to two children, and she lives with her family in Adidogomé, which is one of the outer districts of the town of Lomé. She has an income-generating activity selling "pagnes" (a West African term for decorative fabric), shoes and women's bags on a retail basis. She has been carrying out this activity since 2000. In order to have more customers she conducts her activity on a door-to-door basis. She is requesting a third loan to boost her stock by buying five cartons of bags and ten cartons of shoes.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes and bags

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia O. is from the village of Lao Sta. Cruz. She is 49 years old. Lilia is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Lilia owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Lilia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a young, energetic man aged 26, married with three children, living in his own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. As for his family, Amos wants his children to study up to the university level just like most Ugandans nowadays. Amos says he has been having a financing gap in his business and that's why he has opted for a loan to enable him to reach the next level in his business. He wants the loan to buy more maize, beans and coffee for resale.

loans.use: Purchasing maize, beans and coffee for resale

loans.name: Umubano Group

texts.fr:
Chantal U. est une commerçante âgée de 36 ans qui habite au Quartier 3 Ngangara en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le commerce de viande de bœuf. C’est un métier qu’elle exerce depuis 5 ans alors qu’elle faisait le commerce de produits de boutique. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 4e année des études primaires. Son mari, Isaac Minani est aussi un commerçant de bœufs. Elle arrive au 6e  cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle est mère de 5enfants qui sont âgés de 8ans, 6ans ,5ans, 3ans et 5mois. Les 4 premiers sont à l’école. Elle prend aussi en charge 3 autres enfants de la famille proche. 
  
Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter la quantité de viande de bœuf  à vendre dans l’espoir d’avoir un grand bénéfice. Elle espère avoir un grand capital dans l’avenir qui lui permettra de faire un grand business. Elle a été inspirée par son mari dans ce business. Son mari  l’a aidé pour démarrer son business  et le crédit de Turame est venu pour majorer son capital. 

 Elle  est une des membres du groupe  communautaire « Umubano»
texts.en:
Chantal U. is a 36 year-old shopkeeper who lives in the Ngangara 3 neighborhood of Bujumbura Mairie. She sells beef, a trade she has plied for five years while selling grocery products. She attended school up to the fourth year of elementary school. Her husband, Isaac Minani, also sells beef. She is on her third group loan cycle with the Turame association. She is the mother of five children, ages 8, 6, 5, 3 and 5 months. The oldest four children are in school. She also cares for 3 other children of close relatives. She is asking for a Kiva loan so she can buy more beef to sell in the hopes of making a large profit. She hopes to have more capital in the future which will enable her to operate a large business. She has been inspired by her husband, who helped her to start up this business. The loan from Turame will be used to increase her capital. She is one of the members of the “Umubano” community group.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To obuy more beef to sell in the hopes of making a large profit

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria R. is from the village of Arabiat Echague. She is 41 years old. Gloria is married and has five school-aged children. Gloria owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gloria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene K. is a 29 year old married lady and a mother of three children. She sales water to residents of Kibokoni area in Malindi town where she resides. The lady was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing  client of KADET.  Irene has no history with  any other MFI,and she is applying for first loan of Kshs.16,000. 

Irene plans to use the money to expand her one year old business by buying a larger size water tank for her business so that she can be able to serve more clients. She intends to use the anticipated profit to help continue supporting her family as well as expand her business so that one day she may get to become a well established water vendor in the area.

loans.use: To buy a larger size water tank for business

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Izcuchaca, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Bertha; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de transporte, ella tiene un carro que hace servicio interprovincial hacia la ciudad de Apurímac y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar el servicio de su carro. La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro y para comprar repuestos para el carro.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE” communal bank. The bank is located in the Izcuchaca district, which belongs to the Anta province and the Cuzco province. 


The member's name is Bertha. She is 50 years old and a single mother of 2 children. The member alternates her activities between her daily activities and the transportation business. She has a car with which she does inter-provincial service from the city of and Apurímac. With this business she has been able to get her kids ahead. She wants to improve her car service and she has asked for a loan for car maintenance and car replacement parts. 


The member is grateful to those who are a part of her dream in this way and she is committed to making her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan for car maintenance and to by replacement car parts.

loans.name: Joseph Muchiri

texts.en:
Joseph has been operating a motorcycle transportation business in Naivasha town for the last five years. He uses his motorbike to transport people and goods from one place to another. He is 23 years old, married to Eunice Wambui, and they have one child.
Joseph was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by his friend and this will be his second loan. He paid his first loan of 67,500 KES well and in good time. He plans to use this loan as capital to set up a salon for his wife in Naivasha town.

loans.use: To open a salon for his wife in Naivasha town

loans.name: Gerardina

texts.es:
Gerardina, de 30 años, convive con David, de 28 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, de los cuales 2 son de su compromiso anterior. Como una gran familia; ellos en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Centro Huachirik. Como padres responsables, Gerardina y David, se esfuerzan por salir adelante. 

Por su parte David, trabaja durante el día con su auto propio, en el trasporte público, trasportando a sus pobladores en las rutas de: la ciudad de Yurinaki a la ciudad de Pichanaki. Mientras que Gerardina, cuida de sus plantaciones de café, palta y piña, en donde constantemente, riega, aplica abono y fumiga. Ya que el buen cuidado depende mucho del éxito de las cosechas, por ello la mayor parte del día la pasa en sus terrenos agrícolas, para cuando sus cultivos están aptos son comercializados en el mercado central de Pichanaki, aunque le es pesado tener que llevar todos sus productos hasta la ciudad a veces no logra encontrar transporte para regresar a casa, por eso se queda en algún hotel de Pichanaki. En adelante desea adquirir una pequeña casa en esa ciudad, para que pueda trasladarse sin difultad y poder vender toda su producción, además ya no tendrá la preocupacón de quedarse sin movilidad para retornar a su hogar. 

Es el tercer crédito con MFP y se siente satisfecha con el trabajo realizado en su banco comunal, donde lleva 2 años trabajado con ahínco y asegura que tendrá muchos éxitos futuros. 

Con el crédito que solicita, podrá obtener 4 sacos de abono orgánico, de S/. 150.00 soles cada uno; con lo que piensa esparcir en sus plantaciones de piña que dentro estos meses cosechará.
texts.en:
Gerardina, 30, cohabits with David, 28.  They have four children, two from her previous relationship.  Like a great family they live in their own house located in the indigenous community of Centro Huachirik.  As responsible parents, Gerardina and David work hard to get ahead in life.  

David works during the day providing public transportation services with his own car.  He transports residents along the route from the city of Yurinaki to the city of Pichanaki.  Meanwhile, Gerardina tends to her coffee, avocado and pineapple fields constantly watering, fumigating and fertilizing them because much of the harvest’s success depends on the good care she gives them.  She, therefore, spends most of the day in the fields and when the crops are ready for sale she sells them in the city’s central market.  In the future she’d like to acquire a small house in the city so that she can get around more easily in order to sell all of her produce; she would also no longer have the problem of being stuck without transportation to return home.

This is her 3rd loan with MFP and she is satisfied with the work of her communal bank where she has been working diligently for two years; she is sure of much future success.

She will use the loan to get four sack of organic manure, which cost 150 soles each, that she plans to spread among her pineapple plants that she will harvest these coming months.

loans.use: To buy 4 sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: N'babah Kalimusu's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you teachers of the Peninsula School III, in Waterloo, a small town where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. 

This school was founded in 1961 by The Seven Day Adventist Mission (SDA) to provide education for the children of the community. Currently the school is staffed with 70 employees and has an enrollment of 2500 pupils.    

These hard-working and dedicated teachers have come to SMT to seek for a loan of SLL 10300000. With the help of this loan, these teachers can embark on some meaningful projects that their salaries alone cannot finance. Some of them will use the loan to buy pieces of furniture; others, to buy house-building materials. Some will buy a piece of land or pay school fees for their children, while others will invest the loan in a business. 

N'babah C. is the leader of this group of teachers.
