Born in Kambia, northern Sierra Leone, N'babah is married to a businesswoman and the couple has six children, three of whom are attending primary or secondary school. Mr. C., who has been in the teaching profession for 34 years, is requesting this loan in order to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia M. is from the village of Masimag, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 58 years old. Amalia is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Amalia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods and snacks in the local community. Amalia has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Amalia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Amalia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Amalia is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like biscuits and snacks. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Amalia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for resale

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Ry B., 47, is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of 3 USD per day. B. is married and resides with his wife and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. The family spends 80 USD on food, 5 USD on electricity, and 35 USD on other necessary expenses every month. B. is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase more vegetables for his wife to resell. This is his fifth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for his wife to resell

loans.name: Alusine

texts.en:
Alusine K. is approximately a forty-five-year-old man. He was born in Kabala, a  town in northern Sierra Leone where he is currently residing together with his wife and four children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending primary and secondary schools.  Alusine sells rice, groudnuts, palm-oil, etc.  

Alusine is requesting for a loan of SLL 2,000,000.00 from Kiva field partner, Salone Micro Finance Trust (SMT), in order to expand his business. He will use the loan to buy the above mentioned items at wholesale to add to his current stock. In this way, his business will improve both in size and quality, attracting many customers into his business.

loans.use: Buys rice, groudnuts, palm-oil, etc. at wholesale to add to his current stock

loans.name: Ol

texts.en:
Mr. Ol L. is 33 years old.  His wife, Mrs. Chansoul Kong, is 27 years old.  They have been married since 1999 and have three children – two sons and one daughter, all of whom are in school. They live along National Road Number Five, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Ol is a remoque taxi driver (a remoque is a motorcycle with a trailer in the back). His wife is a garment factory worker. He is asking for a loan of $1,200 to repair his motorcycle and trailer and to repair the house where he lives.

loans.use: To repair vehicle and repair house

loans.name: Mbonigaba

texts.en:
R.  Mbonigaba is an individual client from Kihihi. He is 55 years old and is married.  He has 5 children, all of whom are still in school. 

R. is a salary earner and uses his salary to pay back the loans he obtains from Pearl Micro finance.  These loans have helped R. educate his children as well as build a house for his family. He is so grateful that his two eldest children will soon be completing school.  R. is requesting a loan to be able to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Spartin

texts.en: Spartin M. lives with his wife and two children in one of the villages of Syunik region which is famous for its severe cold climate. The best agricultural businesses for the locals are cattle farming and some limited land cultivation. Spartin is planning for the spring – to seed a particular grass to have cattle fodder. He also needs some gasoline in order to transport the grass and cattle once the busy season starts.

loans.use: seeds and gasoline

loans.name: Bekmurod

texts.en:
For the past 10 years, Bekmurod has put much effort into his agricultural activities. Despite the difficult economic situation that he has gone through, he has managed to support his family and provide his five children with everything they need. To develop his business, Bekmurod has made use of loans provided by IMON International, which he has used toward technical assistance for his crops. 

Once again, Bekmurod seeks loan support from IMON International to invest in his crops, later raise his harvest, and survive along with his family. With your help, Bekmurod will be able to get ahead.    

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lungutsa

texts.en: Lungutsa M. is a single man who lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food and rent.  For the past year, he has operated a charcoal selling business, selling in a shop to his community. Lungutsa also operates a farming business, which contributes to his livelihood. Lungutsa faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding and establishing other charcoal selling shops in the future. Lungutsa is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which he will use to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. Lungutsa decided to work with Yehu Microfinance because of its good customer relations.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
el señor Carlos Alberto M. C. tiene 51 años de edad, vive en el barrio Fatima de San Marcos de Colon y se dedica a la venta de mariscos, frutas y legumbres, tiene su puesto en el mercado de San Marcos de Colon, Carlos le distribuye sus productos a gran cantidad de personas y tambien a varios restaurantes y comedores de la localidad.
Carlos se levanta todos los dias a las 5 de la mañana para alistar su producto y estar a las 6 de la mañana abriendo su puesto en el mercado.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de pescado, camarones, peras, manzanas, uvas, repollo, papas, jilotes, tomates platanos, panelas de azucar.
su meta es hacer crecer mas su negocio para obtener mayores ganancias y asi darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos Alberto M. Calderón, 51, lives in the Fátima neighborhood in San Marcos de Colón.  He sells seafood, fruit and vegetables in a stand located in the San Marcos de Colón market.  He sells his products to a large number of people as well as to several local restaurants and eateries.
Carlos rises daily at 5am to get his products ready in order to open up his stand in the market for business at 6am.

He will use the loan to buy fish, shrimp, pears, apples, grapes, cabbage, potatoes, corn, tomatoes, bananas and brown sugar.  His goal is to grow in business and obtain greater profits to provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, pears, apples, grapes, cabbage, potatoes, corn, brown sugar.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 61 years old, married and has 4 grown children.  She earns a living through farming.  She grows rice and vegetables. 

She rents a stall at the market to sell her harvest.  Teresita works hard to improve her family's living conditions.

Teresita is planning to use her loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.  She hopes for this loan to help improve her business and earnings.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Misa

texts.en:
Misa is a highly motivated and skilled mother of four from Sachnin. She recently opened a small flower shop and also decorates cars for weddings and special events. She opened her store in a busy business center located near a local college. Already, Misa has gained a reputation for elegant and beautiful arrangements.

Misa needed this loan for shelving, a display case, work table, refrigerator and flower cutting and arrangement tools. She wants to first strengthen the base of her new business and then hopes to expand into larger markets providing complete flower decorations and arrangements for weddings and parties.

loans.use: to purchase shelving, a display case, work table, refrigerator and flower cutting and arrangement tools.

loans.name: Amarsanaa

texts.en: Mr. Amarsanaa is 34 years old, lives with his wife and 2 children in Kherlen city of Dornod Aimag, the far eastern province of Mongolia which is 750 km away from the capital city. They live in rented apartment at the moment and they have a dream to have their own family house. Amarsanaa’s 2 children attend a secondary school. Amarsanaa has been working for 6 years as a baker in his sister’s bakery. His wife runs a taxi business using her family car. Amarsanaa always dreamed of having his own pig farm so he decided to start a pig farming business. He has already made some financial projections and market research. The loan Amarsanaa is taking will be used to buy a couple of piglets and start fulfilling his dream to have a pig farming business.

loans.use: to buy a couple of piglets and start fulfilling his dream to have a pig farming business

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas   has been in the mining industry for the last 13 years in Naivasha town. He is 33 years old, married to Teresia. They are blessed with four schooling children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend who is also a KADET client. This will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy another extraction site and add more manpower.

In future, Nicholas hopes to own several extraction sites on the outskirts of Naivasha town.

loans.use: To buy another extraction site and add more manpower.

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is a 51-year-old married woman with two children: a son and a daughter. Her son got his education to the 8th standard and now works as a salesman. Her daughter got her education to the 5th standard and learned the skill of embroidery from Naseem. Naseem is a housewife, managing her household work by staying at home. In her spare time, she also does sewing for neighbors and makes some money to manage the household expenses. Her husband is a carpenter by profession and makes furniture on order. He is very skillful in his work and makes beautiful furniture designs for his clients. 

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her son’s business. With the loan, her son will buy edible items such as Nimko, biscuits and chips, etc., to be able to meet his clients' orders and earn profit. Naseem is hopeful that her son's business will be well established after investing in it, and her family will be able to enjoy a better standard of living as a result.

loans.use: to buy edible items to sell.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. 

Julie has a retail shop that sells canned goods, noodles and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy breads, canned goods and candies to sell.

Julie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Julie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy breads, canned goods and candies for resale.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 57 years old and has two children. She has a small juice stand in which she sells all types of juices such as orange, passion fruit, apple and other specialty blends of juices. All of the juices she sells are fresh squeezed and made to order for her customers. Gloria is asking for a loan in order to pay for the rent on her food stall where she makes and sells her juices. She then wants to put her profits towards generally improving her business. She is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for the rent on her juice stall.

loans.name: Givi

texts.en:
Givi is from the village of Gomi, East Georgia. He is 25 years old, married and lives with his wife Nato and one-year-old daughter. Givi is busy with farming. He grows haricot on a family-owned 0.5-hectare plot of  land and sells his harvest at the Khashuri (nearby town) open market. In addition, he has a horse and provides transportation services to the villagers for a service fee. Along with the above-mentioned, Givi has one calf. In a couple of months, the calf will grow and turn into a milk cow.

Givi requested a loan to purchase two more calves. He will raise them and turn them into milk cows. After all three calves are milking, he will start cheese production. The income of the family will increase and Givi will be able to ensure good living conditions for his little daughter.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Cerelinda

texts.en:
Cerelinda works hard to support her family. Cerelinda is married and has a "trisikad" business in the Philippines.

Cerelinda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase tools and equipment. She has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Cerelinda would like to save enough so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Carmen como es conocida por sus amistades tiene 42 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos un jovencito de 12 años el cual estudia la secundaria y una niña de 4 años la cual recientemente entro al preescolar a estudiar, doña Carmen es costurera desde hace mas de 25 años dice que desde muy joven le llamo la atención coser en la maquina ella dice “me gusta mucho coser por que uno mismo puede hacerse su propia ropa y hacer los uniformes a mis hijos”. También se dedica a vender productos para el hogar de una marca muy reconocida donde vende limpiadores de estufas, aromatizantes, artículos de limpieza y cremas para el cuerpo, dice que ella tiene vendiendo sus productos hace mas de 18 años y que le gusta ese negocio porque así ha conocido a mucha gente la cual le vende los productos. Doña Carmen esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de artículos de limpieza que tiene por pedidos de sus clientas, ella esta contenta por que gracias al crédito que le otorguen tendrá lo que le han pedido sus clientas, doña Carmen dice que a diario sale a ofrecer los productos por catalogo y a cobrar ya que vende en pagos sus productos. La meta que tiene en este momento Carmen es comprarse una maquina de coser mas nueva para seguir confeccionando sus costuras.
texts.en: Doña Carmen, as she is known to friends, is 42 years old. She is married and has 2 children, a boy of 12 who is in secondary school and a daughter of 4 who recently entered preschool. Doña Carmen has been a seamstress for 25 years. She says that from a very early age she was drawn to the sewing machine. She says "I love sewing because you can make your own clothes as well as your children's school uniforms."She also sells home cleaning products of a very well-known brand. She sells stove-cleaning products, deodorizers, cleaning products and body creams. She says that she has been selling these products for over 18 years and that she likes the business as she has been able to get to know a lot of the people who buy her products. Doña Carmen is asking for a loan to buy cleaning products she has on order for her customers. She is happy because thanks to the loan she will be able to give clients what they ordered. Doña Carmen says that she goes out on a daily basis to sell her products by catalogue and collect payment as she gets paid in installments for her products  Carmen's current goal is to buy a newer sewing machine so that she can keep on sewing.

loans.use: to buy home cleaning products by catalogue

loans.name: Cho-Estancia Group

texts.es:
La señora Florinda es casada, tiene 30 años D. edad, cursó los 4 años D. educación primaria, tiene 2 hijos 1 D. los cuales estudia, se dedica a la crianza D. animales, inició con esta labor ya que quiere obtener un buenísimo beneficio para su familia, lleva 8 años D. experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica a la construcción D. vivienda.

DeciD. organizar un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra D. pollos para engorD. para venderlos cuando crezcan y obtener su ganancia. Las demás integrantes se dedican al comercio y a actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Florinda is 30 years old, married, and completed four years of elementary school. She has two children, but only one has started school. Florinda raises livestock for a living, which she started doing in order to help her family. She has 8 years of experience and the full support of her husband, who works in construction. 

Florinda decided to put together a group for this loan request. She'll use her portion to buy chickens. She plans to raise them and sell the full-grown chickens for a profit. The other members of the group work in business and agriculture.

loans.use: buy chickens to raise.

loans.name: Exodus Romac Group

texts.en:
Grace is 50 years old and lives in Gweru. She has six children, one of whom is still at school. Grace's husband buys and sells a variety of items and Grace rears and sells chickens, a business she has been running for four years. She faces problems with the cold killing small chicks and has suffered theft.
Grace will invest the money that she borrows by extending the chicken coop and buying more chicks. She hopes that her business will continue to provide her family with a good life and an improved diet.

loans.use: to buy chicks and building materials to extend chicken run.

loans.name: Daniel Njogu

texts.en: Daniel is a 63-year-old married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 17 years to 30 years. He describes himself as visionary. He operates a shoe making business where he sells shoes to locals. He has been involved in this business for 40 years and employs 2 staff members. His business is located in a shopping centre in Kisumu. He describes his biggest business challenge as financial constraints. He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy a motorcycle to use in the running of the business. His business goal is to open more shoe shops within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will own the biggest shoe selling business in Kisumu.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Agossa

texts.fr:
Agossa est un homme âgé de 32 ans. Il est célibataire.  
Agossa travaille comme revendeur depuis 2008. Il achète et revend des huiles à moteur à tous les usagers d’engins à moteur, dans sa boutique à Lomé. Il travaille avec une personne. 
Agossa a requis son premier crédit de 300.000FCFA de WAGES afin d’acheter des cartons d’huile à moteur destinées à la vente. Il veut avec les profits supplémentaires de son activité, agrandir sa boutique. 
Dans les prochaines années, Agossa voudrait ouvrir d’autres points de ventes. Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit  avoir une meilleure situation financière.
texts.en:
Agossa is a 32-year-old single man who has been working as a retailer since 2008.  He buys engine oil which he re-sells to anybody who uses engine oil, in his store in Lomé.  He works with the help of one other person.

Agossa has requested his first loan from WAGES, for 300,000 frances, to buy boxes of engine oil to sell.  He would like to use the extra income from his business to increase the size of his store.

In the coming years, Agossa would like to open other sales locations.  He says that he plans to use his profits to improve his financial situation.

loans.use: to buy engine oil

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La socia tiene una panadería y actualmente a incorporado los pasteles para la venta, ella prepara kekes de vainilla y chocolate llamados kekes marmoleados, la socia también prepara pastelitos y pie de manzana, entre otros pastelitos, la socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de harinas, levaduras, escencias entre otros. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de harinas, levaduras y otros.
texts.en: This member owns a bakery and has just incorporated pastries into her sales.  She prepares marbled cupcakes, which contain vanilla and chocolate batter.  She also prepares miniature pastries, apple pies, and other desserts.  The member wants to invest in the purchase of flour, yeast, essences, and other ingredients.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan to use for this purpose.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, essences, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Jomar

texts.en:
Jomar is 29 years old and married. He lives in the village of Pinto Alfonso Lista, Ifugao. Though they don't have siblings, still he works hard to sustain their daily needs and improve the business of his wife. Farming is primarily the main source of family income.

Jomar has been farming his cornfield for over eight years and he has been managing about four hectares. With his determination to improve his cornfield, he is asking for additional capital of PHP 27,000. This amount would really help his farming business to be more productive because he will be using his requested loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, insecticides and certified seed. He hopes that he could make his dream come true, which is to maintain his cornfield and make it more productive. In this way, his profit will increase, which will help him improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, certified seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en: Rorn, 47, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. Rorn is employed at a factory, and her husband sells palm products. Rorn is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase groceries to sell in front of her house. By doing so, her family will able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Galina

texts.ru:
Галина – вдова, у нее взрослые сыновья. Она занимается выращиванием ранних сельхозкультур в теплицах, а именно высаживает цветную капусту и помидоры для последующей реализации овощной продукции. Галина живет и занимается фермерством в селе Приветное, Цурюпинского района. Она занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 10 лет. В хозяйство вложено 40 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль составляет 3 800 гривен.  

Галина планирует использовать кредит в 7 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить семена, удобрения, пленку и отремонтировать теплицы. Ей нравится заниматься сельским хозяйством и выращивать ранние овощи, потому что это перспективный бизнес и к тому же он дает стабильную возможность содержать семью.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Galina is a widow and has adult sons.  She is involved in growing early agricultural crops in greenhouses and specifically, grows cauliflower and tomatoes until the next sales of vegetable produce.  Galina lives and works in the Privetnoye village in the Tsyurupynsk district.  She has been involved in this business for ten years.  Galina invested 40 000 hryvnia into her farm.  Her net profit is 3 800 hryvnia.  Galina plans to use the 7 000 hryvnia loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, plastic and to repair a greenhouse.  She likes to be involved in agriculture and grow early vegetables because this is a promising business, which provides for a stable opportunity to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, plastic and to repair a greenhouse

loans.name: Atanacio

texts.en:
Atanacio is 45 years of age and blessed with four children. He is satisfied in his work as a farmer. He stated that although he couldn't finish his education, he has a fruitful occupation that serves as a source of income for his family's every need. 

He is sending all his children to school and hopes they attain their goals. It is not easy to provide for their educational needs because of the high cost of tuition. However, he works hard and requests a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy inputs to develop his farm. For better results, he needs to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides. He also needs to pay for the labor of a co-farmer.

Hopefully, through his sacrifices and hard work, he can attain a better outcome, improve his family's poor living standards, and experience a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, and pay for labor by a co-farmer

loans.name: 03.2.86 Quảng Hưng Thanh Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinh operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase vegetables to resell.

Sinh is 26 years old and she is married with 1 child. She is the leader of a 5-member group, the 86 Quảng Hưng solidarity group. Sinh lives with 1 dependent in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Sinh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Sinh has been involved in this business for 3 years. The main hardship that Sinh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Sinh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa, vive con sus tres hijos y su esposo, ella administra una tienda de productos domésticos de primera necesidad, ella inicia su día con los quehaceres del hogar,  tiene también una pequeña granja de cerdos la cual atiende, su horario no es específico, pues esta todo el día en el hogar atendiendo a quienes llegan a comprar.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio como aceite, arroz, gaseosas, galletas, dulces entre otros productos, de esta manera podrá incrementar y atender mejor a los clientes con productos de calidad.
Su aspiración es de esta compra, surtir y generar mayores ventas, trabajar fuertemente para sacar adelante a su familia en especial a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Teresa lives with her three children and husband. She earns her living selling basic supplies. She begins each day with household chores including caring for a small number of pigs. She doesn’t have a fixed schedule but stays around the house all day ready to serve anyone who comes into the store. 

Teresa is seeking a loan to buy merchandise for the store such as oil, rice, soft drinks, cookies, and candy so she can provide her customers with quality items. She hopes that the increased stock in her store will result in greater sales. Teresa works hard to help her family, her children especially, get on in life.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, soft drinks, cookies, candy etc.

loans.name: Ruwa Kumari

texts.en:
Ruwa Kumari is 32 year-old. She is married and has 3 children, aged 15, 14 and 10.  In 2000 she established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 2 loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent to buys seeds and fertilizer for her business. In the future, Ruwa Kumari plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.   

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: HELLO Kiva lenders! Meet Emily, a mother of two lovely children aged 13 and 7. Emily is based in Kimaring, a remote village in the rich highland areas of Kapsowar area of Kenya. This area is known for producing the best milk and their staple food is “mursik,” a mouthwatering delicacy prepared from milk. Emily has been practicing mixed farming for the past 4 years and she has made great strides in terms of profit margins. This small scale farmer generates income through selling milk, poultry, crops and some personal business that she does, or “side hustle” as she likes to call it. She passionately loves poultry farming and the best part is when she wakes up every morning to collect eggs. The main challenge facing Emily is the constant perennial shortages of eggs and poultry products in her village and local market. She seeks to change this through borrowing a loan and buying more poultry. Emily is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase additional poultry. With the loan, Emily will increase her income through selling eggs, poultry meat and also poultry feathers. The demand for poultry products in Kapsowar area is very high and through the loan she will be able to satisfy the demand. Other than profits from poultry farming, she will also benefit from poultry manure, hence saving money that would have been used in purchasing fertilizers. The additional income from this expansion will permanently change her life and improve her living conditions. Emily waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Jeannine Faramalala

texts.fr:
Jeannine a 50 ans, elle est veuve. Elle bénéficie d’une pension mensuelle. Elle a deux enfants de 19 et 12 ans dont l’un poursuit ses études à l’université et l’autre en classe de troisième  dans une école privée (paiement d’écolage pour les deux enfants) . 
Jeannine a comme activité l’aviculture: élevage de poulets  de chair, et élevage de poules pondeuses.  Le premier prêt a été investi dans les deux activités. Elle a déjà bénéficié d’une formation auprès d’AGRIFORM  en matière d’élevage. Elle dispose d’un guide d’élevage. Elle dispose également d’une année d’expérience dans l’élevage canards. 
La famille vit dans une maison héritée de ses parents. Elle prévoit de développer l’élevage dans le but de pouvoir assurer la continuité et réussite de ses enfants dans leurs études.

loans.use: acheter 25 têtes de poules pondeuses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Irene would like to buy sacks of maize and bean , flour, sugar and laundry detergents

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy operates a business which offers beverages, and women and children’s clothing. She began her business in 1986. The business prospered until 1991 when she went through a hard time during the 90s due to the political and economic instability in the DRCongo. Lucy learned about Hope’s microfinance program through a friend and decided to sign a loan contract. Today, Lucy is on her way to stabilizing her business. She requests a loan of $500, which she will use to buy her merchandise in bulk order to minimize purchase prices.  She also plans to diversify her business by adding men’s clothing so that she can increase her earnings and meet the high demand from the community. Right now,Lucy has $300 in business capital. She is married and has six children.

loans.use: To expand her business by diversifying the brands and types of items she sells

loans.name: Moa

texts.en: Mr. Moa B. R., 42 years old, is a father of 7 children, and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He is a secondary school teacher and also runs a business near the school as a vehicle care-taker. R. normally makes around $5 per day, while his wife makes a very small amount of money from working at the local garment factory. Additonally, two of his children work at the same factory as their mother does. 3 of the other children are students and 2 are too young to attend school. B. R. is asking for an $800 loan to build a temporary station where he can keep and guard the students' vehicles.  In the future, he would like to have enough money to run a grocery store in front of the school.

loans.use: To construct a temporary station to run his business

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
K. Nigora was a seller of boiled peas, one of the Tajiks' favourite dishes. But as the competition for this kind of business was very high, it became less profitable. With the financial help of her husband, Nigora started a business selling household goods. Her mother also supported her and gave her a shop. Nigora’s sister-in-law helps with selling products.

Six months ago, Nigora received a loan from Microinvest that helped her to expand her assortment of products. At the moment, one can find anything that is needed for the home in her shop.

If Nigora can get a second loan, it will help her to develop her business further and make more profit. This is very important as Nigora has three kids and her business brings in significant income for the family.

loans.use: to further develop her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in clothing for her business

loans.name: Marita Astra

texts.es:
Marita is a mother of three, two of her sons are studying Systems Engineering at university. The youngest son is still in primary school and lives in her home along with her husband. She started selling bread as there were no bakeries near her neighborhood. Her artisan oven and keen business acumen have helped her to produce delicious bread, which her sons and husband help to dispatch from their bakery located next to their home.

The family business produces enough bread daily to meet the current demand, but they would like to increase their production. They need more raw materials to increase bread production to be able to grow the business. Let´s help Marita accomplish her dreams of having a well furnished bakery and home delivery of her excellent bread.

Marita wants to generate jobs in the community and help her family grow financially by fulfilling a basic need for her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.< Marita es madre de tres hijos, dos de ellos estudian en la universidad la carrera de Ingeniería de Sistemas y el último aún está en el colegio y habita con su querido esposo su modesto hogar. Ella empezó con el negocio de la venta de panes debido a que por la zona donde vive no hay una panadería cercana en varias manzanas a la redonda, observando este hecho y gracias a su aguda mentalidad comercial instaló un pequeño horno artesanal de barro en las instalaciones de su casita con el propósito de elaborar una muy buena cantidad de panes, con la ayuda de sus hijos y de su esposo en la atención diaria al público colindante a su domicilio; siempre preparan suficientes panes para cubrir la demanda de las personas que acostumbradas a degustar un delicioso pan acuden a la panadería de Marita.Debido al crecimiento de su negocio se encuentra en la necesidad de comprar los insumos para la elaboración de los deliciosos panes.Ayudemos a Marita a hacer crecer su negocio, ya que uno de sus deseos es tener la panadería bien implementada y con unidades de reparto para generar puestos de trabajo y contribuir con el desarrollo de su familia y la satisfacción de sus vecinos.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to increase production and sales

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: I am Parveen B.. I am married and have five children, all of whom attend a local school. I live with my family in the small town Raiwind, Pakistan. My husband works at a factory for low wages, and I sell milk from my house. I would like  to buy another cow to increase production and increase my income. Please lend me $200.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Kamuli B1 (B) Group

texts.en: Christine owns a retail shop. She wants to use the extra profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for her shop
